An awesome GTA, for sure. Rockstar keeps going another way I would like them to (I am a big fan of GTA 1 and 2, and also Vice City) but it is fine as long as the content they make is worth it: this GTA is totally worth it. It is HUGE, very long, pretty, buzzing with life, indeed all the good stuff you expect from them now is there. However, this is not what makes the quality of this GTA more than, let's say, its predecessor, GTA IV, who also had the content, but lacked the spark. No, GTA V's quality comes from one thing, mostly, this time: the writing. Dialogues are just too good, and make up the difference for the usual, heavy, casual gameplay we got to get used since GTA 3. The amazing life the writers blew into the dialogues between the 3 main characters is awesome, bigger than life, feel like a crazy action movie but so politically incorrect, and I am glad Rockstar can still write things like that nowadays. It is one of the two reasons why I love LOVE GTA 1, along the actualy amazing gameplay, level design etc (the "game content") - the burning fire of its style, very outrageous, extravagant, irreverent. Rockstar went back to that style here, and I am thankful as I spent a 100 hours of good fun. If you like that, you should love this game. (Note that I do not care about the multiplayer and online aspects of it).

Ignoring the money-hungry shark cards of GTA Online, this game is amazing. The singleplayer is sadly over-looked as its one of the most excellent parts of this game (with a pretty mediocre post-game to be fair) but the real meat is hanging out with your friends and doing stupid shit. Really enjoyable and worth the time.

Well, where do I start...GTA V is one of the best games of our generation and will be for generations to come. Over the past 8 to 9 years where I've bought this game about 5 times on 5 different consoles, it's always been a quality experience! GTA V is essentially real life simulator where you fly around on motorbikes and shoot rockets at people with laser guns. Me and my friend have completed the Casino heist about 500 times and never get bored of picking up gold or cutting artwork because we do it for the money. 

That's the sad reality of this game and real life, everything we do is for money to live as long as we can before our inevitable demise and eternal darkness for infinity but it's okay since we may have a chance of seeing GTA 6 before we all get nuked by vladimir putinus tutinus. Regardless, I'm going off topic a little, back to GTA 5

There's so much to do in this game and it's still one of the most popular games on the market (after about 9 years so that really says a lot about this games success!) Obviously the game is much better with friends like doing heists or just general missions but it's also pretty chill on your own when you're not being blown up by 12 year olds who steal their parents credit cards to buy shark cards to then buy the Oppressor and blow up all the resources you worked hard to get (solo online lobbies ftw!)

Don't even get me started on the story. I only played it once and that was like 6 years ago so I can't really remember much. I just remember Trevor was the crazy one, Franklin was the thug life one and Michael was the rich one with family issues. The characters were great, the story was great and the ending was tear jerking, a definite 9.5/10.

Overall GTA 5 has been an amazing experience and has been with me throughout most of my teenage years. I've played with many different people and also met some amazing people. I've had so many amazing memories playing this game and it's definitely not over yet. I hope the rest of my GTA 5 experience is amazing and I'm looking forward to doing the casino heist another 500 times <3

GTA V online used to be amazing when it first launched and everyone was hyped up about it. Nonetheless, the gameplay is no longer intriguing in 2022 given the amount of hackers, which could lead to having YOUR own account banned for no reason. Let alone the intolerable loading time, the game often crashes thanks to those weird players who keep spamming error codes in chat. The current playerbase is just meh. If you prefer open-world coop games, there are lots of other more decent and worth-every-penny options so don't waste your money/time on this.

I'm just gonna strictly talk about GTA Online, as like 95% of the fanbase is for GTA Online. At one point in time, it was arguably the greatest multiplayer experience of all time. There was nothing quite like it. Missions, heists, online events with hectic PVP. Purchasing your own property and vehicles, exploring the rich map with friends, street races that were super fun, but often unbalanced, I'll admit. I met some of the most amazing people on this game and still talk to them to this day. The reason why it's a negative review shouldn't really be a surprise to anyone; it's nothing like it used to be.

Each update became goofier and goofier with a heist about saving Los Santos from an apocalyptic explosion, to having flying bikes and cars. This game practically turned into Saints Row as time moved on. This game, after Red Dead Redemption 2, has the most unbalanced economy thanks to Rockstars milking of Shark Cards that so many suckers bought into only because grinding in this game isn't even worth it anymore. The only decent money method is grinding a pointless heist that really doesn't fit into the game at all. An expansion that the playerbase was SO hyped for, only for it to be some tiny island that's only accessible through yet another boring heist. Not to mention the extremely cringe stereotypes of modern culture only to be portrayed in each update, somehow worse than reality. Nightclubs, biker gangs, kingpins were all forgotten within a matter of months. What they're doing to this game is utterly disgusting and they're really just shitting on their own reputation. I mean, look what they did to Red Dead Online. I shouldn't have to explain what happened there. 

Game is reaching to be a decade old and they support this more than their most recent title only because little dweebs purchase shark cards and give them more and more unnecessary profit. How people are still playing this game is absolutely mind blowing to me.
the player base is assholes. other then that, its a fine game

GTA V (the story mode) is the culmination of all of the series's previous entries's best [i]and worst[/i] elements.

Please, if you value your mental health and your free time, do not waste it on GTA Online. It's often unsafe considering Rockstar's #### cyber-security. Yes, people can find your IP address in-game with basic mod menus, and hackers with malicious intent run through most public servers like its Gotham City on Halloween night.

The ghost of a former Rockstar Games fan has spoken, you can now get off from your knees and leave in peace.

Only talking about the single player. 8/10 at best, which in my book is usually a game worth skipping. The campaign just felt like wasted potential. The characters start off promising but they just end up feeling so samey and none of them develop at all. That's some uninteresting writing. Pretty much nothing happens. They just end up getting into more bad yet uninteresting situations, all to keep the plot moving forward to a lame ass ending. Also there's nothing to do with the money you make besides buying properties that are almost completely useless. Way to ruin any sense of reward. So the story is all there is, and it isn't even good.

I'm done with GTA. The only reason I gave 4 and 5 a shot was because the PS2 trilogy was so good. It feels completely uninspired now. Actually for GTA 6, they should just forget making the single player entirely and focus on the money printing multiplayer loaded with microtransactions to prey upon kids, because I'm sure that's where most of the effort went with this one.

It's a good game overall, but not without flaws, many flaws. First of all story mode is really glitchy after so many years. I guess many things got messed up by GTA Online updates (special skills on all chars getting reseted every time something is relased!) and story mode was just abandoned by it's creators. Typical for all Rockstar games unfortunately... Secondly whole project of the game is tiring and unclear, hard to enojoy it knowing how easy it is to miss something or f something up. For example random events condition us to help people on the street but following this route you can kill important character in the very beginning that you may find important in the end, lol. I ended up in reading wiki before every mission just to not make such mistakes anymore and also to invest money properly so in the endgame I'll be billionaire, not just simple millionaire. But there's another trick - you can't have more than 2.1b$ just because 32bits limits in game developement... Annoying. Last but not least - poor characters. 3 protagonists and it's hard to like any of them, same for all other npcs, everyone in this game seems to be douchebag or psycho. Because of that it's hard to care about the story at all, 0 connection with anyone, not like in previous GTAs. Honestly even speechless Claude from GTA3 had more charisma. Oh, and one more - extremly fast disappearing cars. WTF? Really? You try to change car parked in garage and before you get one out of it another disappears. It's especially annoying connected with the fact that cars you buy in game can be lost forever.
Despite all this mess there are things that make it a good game. Definitely map with all it's details, graphic is on great level even now, 8 years after relase. City feels like living place, you can encounter huge variety of pedestrian behaviors, tons of cars with different mods and colors, nice weather. It's pure pleasure just to drive around, that's why tens of hours I spent just driving a cab around and listening to many radio stations and tracks featured in this title. As this game was on huge promos in the meantime and even on giveaway once - it's worth trying.

I have more than 1300 hours on this game ( EPIC STORE ). Finished the story and have level 286 in GTA Online. Safe to say, this is a really interesting game, possibly the best open world online experience ever possible. It is "definitely best" but not "perfect". There is a lot to be improved but for what it's worth, this is the one to be played. You can do Heists, cruise around city in expensive cars, play deathmatches, crazy stunt races, visit your friends' house, have a chill time, do business missions etc etc. Even after 1300 hours there is so much more for me to explore. The bad thing I would say is : since the game heavily depends on micro-transactions ( in-game currency ), the online experience is very grindy. You need to put in many many hours to establish some passive income and become self-sufficient. But, thats the actual fun in this game. I guarantee this, if any player will hack or purchase currency and get everything, the game will become very boring. There will be nothing to put effort for. This is like "living in the moment" game, you enjoy doing chores in the game, either alone or with friends. But, I'd say with friends this game becomes much much more fun, alone is efficient but gets boring really quickly. Rest assured story mode is also pretty fun if online is not your thing.

I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 14. My son recently downloaded Multiversus and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, did the tutorial but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you."

Singleplayer experience: great.
Multiplayer experience: awful. Not because people online sometimes keep killing you or because there is hackers (there will always be hackers in every game ever), the awful part is the loading and crashing. I have a really good laptop that has more than good enough specs to play this game. My wifi is also pretty good, so if I have to wait for 10 minutes for the mission to start, it is not a "groundbreaking online game experience". Also the fact that, many times, missions would end, load for 15 minutes (not exaggerated) and then I would get no money from the mission what so ever. Missions crash at random times, I tried finishing a mission with someone 5 times and it would always say we "Failed". Just an example: we were robbing a casino, we came to the vault, it said we had about 2 and a half minutes to steal as much as we could. The timer hits about 2 minutes and 12 seconds left to steal, game says "Failed to steal in time". Another example: we were trying to do a mission and we were on our way to a building. We both approached the yellow marker and there was a 2 minute loading screen. When it finally loaded I was stuck outside the building, I couldn't walk away, I couldn't enter the building, I couldn't run, equip guns, or get inside a vehicle. These are just two of many many examples of the really sad cases of my experience on gta 5 online. For such a big company and for a game that is so focused on multiplayer and is said to be "one of the best games ever" it is extremely sad and disappointing. If you are buying the game, buy it because of singleplayer.

Quite simply, there is no other game like it, and I have been a long time fan of the GTA series since the DOS version. Once GTA evolved into 3D in grand theft auto 3 it was another mile stone in this game defining series. GTA 3 Being native to consoles at the time introduced "normies" or mainstream gamers to this one of a kind type of game. While working as an electronic game retail worker in the 2000's, after the underground sucess of GTA 3 (and at the same time) the rise of broadband internet, I rember saying: "When they implement online elements to this game, (i.e. playing with your friends) IMO it has the potential to be the best selling game of all time. It is rare for me to guess correctly about video game industry trend predictions. If you buy one game on steam, buy this if you have never played GTA before.

If you thought this was a review of Grand Theft Auto V, you are entirely wrong, This is a guide on how to make Methamphetamine at home here are the steps: 

List of chemicals and materials:
Diluted HCl ‚Äì also called Muriatic acid ‚Äì can be obtained from hardware stores, in the pool section

NaOH ‚Äì also called lye.

Ethyl Ether ‚Äì aka Diethyl Ether ‚Äì Et-0-Et ‚Äì can be obtained from engine starting fluid, usually from a large supermarket. Look for one that says ‚Äúhigh ethyl ether content‚Äù, such as Prestone

Ephedrine The cottons in today‚Äôs vicks nasle inhalers don‚Äôt contain efed or pfed (ephedrine or psuedoephedrinE) but there are still lots of easy ways to get good ephed or pfed, pure ephedrine can be extracted out of it‚Äôs plant matter, from a plant that can be bought at most garden stores. Or you can get pfed from de-congestive pills like sudafed. Most people prefer to work with pfed from pills rather then ephed from the plant. The important thing is that you must have pure pfed/ephed as any contaminants will fuck up the molar ratio leaving you with over-reduced shit or under-reduced shit. Or contaminates will jell during baseifying and gak up your product which will then be very hard to clean. So you want to find a pill that is nearly pure pfed hcl, or as close to pure as you can get. Also check the label on your pills and see what inactive ingredients they contain. Inactive ingredients are things like binders and flavors. These you don‚Äôt want and will remove when cleaning your pills. but certain inactive ingredients are harder to remove then others. You don‚Äôt want pills with a red coating, you don‚Äôt want pills with alot of cellose in them and you don‚Äôt want pills with much wax. you also don‚Äôt want pills that contain povidone. As a rule, if you have a two pills that contain the same amount of pfed HCL then take the smaller sized pill because it obviously has less binders and inactive ingredients, time released pills are usually harder to work with because they have more binders and tend to gel up during the a/b stage. Also only buy pills that have pfed HCL as the only active ingredient. You first have to make ephedrine (which is sometimes sold as meth by itself):If you are selling it‚Ä¶I would just make ephedrine and say it‚Äôs meth.

Distilled water ‚Äì it‚Äôs really cheap, so you have no reason to use the nasty stuff from the tap. Do things right.

List of equipment :
A glass eyedropper

Three small glass bottles with lids (approx. 3 oz., but not important)one should be marked at 1.5oz, use tape on the outside to mark it (you might want to label it as ether). One should be clear (and it can‚Äôt be the marked one).

A Pyrex dish (the meatloaf one is suggested)

A glass quart jar

Sharp scissors

Clean rubber gloves

Coffee filters

A measuring cup

Measuring spoons

Preparing your Lab:

Preparing Ethyl Ether:
WARNING: Ethyl Ether is very flammable and is heavier than air. Do not use ethyl ether near flame or non-sparkless motors. It is also an anaesthetic and can cause respiratory collapse if you inhale too much.

Take the unmarked small bottle and spray starter fluid in it until it looks half-full. Then fill the rest of the way with water, cap the bottle and shake for 5 minutes. Let it sit for a minute or two, and tap the side to try and separate the clear upper layer. Then, draw off the top (ether) layer with the eyedropper, and throw away the lower (water) and cloudy layer. Place the ether in the marked container. Repeat this until you have about 1.5 oz. of ether. Put the cap on it, and put it in the freezer if you can. Rinse the other bottle and let it stand.

Ethyl ether is very pungent. Even a small evaporated amount is quite noticeable.

Ephedrine & or P-Ephedrine:

5. Pour 1/8 teaspoon of the lye crystals into the bottle of ephedrine and agitate. Do this carefully, as the mixture will become hot, and give off hydrogen gas and/or steam. H2 gas is explosive and lighter than air, avoid any flames as usual. Repeat this step until the mixture remains cloudy. This step neutralizes the HCl in the salt, leaving the insoluble free base (l-desoxyephedrine) again. Why do we do this? So that we can get rid of any water-soluble impurities. For 3 oz. bottles, this should take only 3 repetitions or so.

6. Fill the bottle from step 5 up the rest of the way with ethyl ether. Cap the bottle, and agitate for about 8 minutes. It is very important to expose every molecule of the free-base to the ether for as long as possible. This will cause the free base to dissolve into the ether (it -is- soluble in ether).

7. Let the mixture settle. There will be a middle layer that is very thick. Tap the side of the bottle to get this layer as thin as possible. This is why this bottle should be clear.

8. Remove the top (ether) layer with the eyedropper, being careful not to get any of the middle layer in it. Place the removed ether layer into a third bottle.

9. Add to the third bottle enough water to fill it half-way and about 5 drops of muriatic acid. Cap it. Shake the bottle for 2 minutes. When it settles, remove the top layer and throw it away. The free base has now been bonded to the HCl again, forming a water soluble salt. This time, we‚Äôre getting rid of ether-soluble impurities. Make sure to get rid of all the ether before going to step 11!

10. If there is anything left from step 3, repeat the procedure with it.

11. Evaporate the solution in the Pyrex dish on low heat. You can do this on the stove or nuke it in the microwave (be careful of splashing), but I have found that if you leave it on top of a hot-water heater (like the one that supplies hot water to your house) for about 2-3 days, the remaining crystals will be ephedrine HCl.

If you microwave it, I suggest no more than 5-10s at one time. If it starts ‚Äúpopping‚Äù, that means you have too little liquid left to microwave. You can put it under a bright (100W) lamp instead. Microwaving can result in uneven heating, anyway.

First Batch: 120mg ephedrine HCl Estimated: 300mg (100% of theoretical, disregarding HCl)

STEAM DECK SCORE: 4.5/5

Compatibility layer: ProtonGE

Gameplay: 5/5 - I thoroughly enjoy playing this game. Especially with friends. The fact it is a console game as well as PC makes analog stick compatiblity a breeze. you can aim accurately using the sticks, touchpads. there's not even need for Gyro. Recent updates to the game itself allow for you to perform Business actions in Online on invite-only servers, allowing you to keep script kiddies at bay. Genuinely fun to build your criminal enterprise and run heists with friends. And the singleplayuer campaign is nothing to laugh at either.

Graphics: 4.5-5 It is 2 console generations odl by now. but it still looks AMAZING, especially at 800p on a 7" screen. The small test is actually quite easy to read on the Deck screen.

Audio: 5/5 - I admit I use "Self Radio" a lot becuase of my strange tastes in music.  All the voice acting, car nosies, gun noises are all very satisfying.

Conclusion:This game feels like it is desigend from the ground up for Steam Deck. It owes this to being designed from the ground up for consoles, but that is not a shortcoming with the fun factor. Absolutely recommended.I don't recommend buying Shark cards or the CEO pack if you can avoid it. the game is MUCH MORE FUN if you work from the ground up to earn your ingame money.

Its a great game whether it is story mode or online mode GTA 5 is one of the best of all time, boasting great soundtrack, story line and game play mechanics, its hard to get bored of this game because of the amount of activities you can do, online mode is great with friends and with the people you meet, heists are fun, racing feels like its the midnight club all over again, the only downside is the case of cheaters ruining the fun for most of the players, online mode should not be moddable and could have been a separate file, there are also balancing issues in terms of vehicles strength most vehicles look like they can tank a bit more explosives but they can't for some reason and aren't really worth the price, overall its a an amazing game 11/10 would recommend.

The Origin of Purple Guy

In 1976 William had twins: a little blonde girl and a little brunette boy. He started to teach Michael to take care of them, because "Daddy won't be around forever".

During his free time, William started designing and projecting new robots (he hated the name "animatronics") and plans for his own company: Afton Robotics. But he had another plan under his sleeve: ruin FFP from the inside.

He disguised himself as Dave Miller and started working applied for day time security guard at FFP. As he was always wearing purple - the uniform's colour - and usually hid in the shadows to stay out of sight of anyone who might recognize him, he was nicknamed by every child as "The Purple Guy".

During this time, in 1980, he did his evil plan: using the Spring Bonnie suit he built years earlier, he lured five children to a back room, murdered them and hid inside the body of the animatronics. In case you're wondering what he did with the fifth one, he obviously hid it inside a spare Freddy suit he then painted yellow, duh.

Fortunately for Billy, they actually caught Henry instead of him, as one of the cameras caught him walking around in one of the suits. He got out sometime later, as they managed to prove he had some mental disabilities and had a fixation with wearing the suits around, and had no violent behaviour.
But Dave? Well, he was fired when FFP closed.

Circus Baby

With the help of the money he got from selling the children's organs in the black market, William opened Afton Robotics and had everything ready to open his own kid-friendly restaurant: Circus Baby's Pizza World. The problem is that he got a new hobby, and this where his hill went down.

He liked so much the idea of killing children and the profit he could get from selling their organs - healthy children organs are way more valuable than adults' -, he made special alterations in his robots, turning them into kid-kidnapping and killing machines.

The problem is that, in 1982, he accidently let his daughter get close to Baby when he wasn't looking; and Baby killed her. He knew he was the one to blame, but he actually blamed Michael for this, saying that he, as the older brother, should've protected her.

This incident lead to the pizzeria's cancellation and William's divorce. His wife took Michael and the other boy with her, leaving him alone. His new hobby and this incident in his life lead him to become a human monster.

So I have to respect what it says "on the tin" - it is basically fast and furious- in a world hyper-polorized it is nice to have a no fs given type of game HOWEVER. 

When I play a game again and again and cant desire to complete it - that is a bad sign. I relized the only things polished in this game is the graphics and the online purchasing.  Both of these things work like a charm but everything else is a mess. 

If you play online or single player their will be moments when it loads for what seems like forever. For a game that has the assembly of realism - I think the mechanics are screwy. When I play a Saints Row I know its a facimily but GTA convinces you it tries to be realistic but first person is ridiculious to master- controlers are bulked and the key pad has some inventive key bindings that could crash any game experience... dont even try to modify things you will break more than you fix. 

Air- planes have 2 pitches and thats the key right their..... redudency. Every single thing is copied in triplicate - guns and cars - controls and environment. Every time you try something new it might as well be a new experience. The amount of times i said to myself " remember it was that way in this curcumstance but not right now" was baffling. Swimming is a joke- Ive never seen a more broke thing. Many of these things can be fixed but its not a Farcry driving sequence its major game things that change requiring eagle reflexes to remember. Ive played many games and the amount of times when ORIGINALITY was required here is stupid. EVEN Ravenfield didnt re-invent the wheel. 

I want to love this game. Its ballsy- its loud- but everything is put together backwards. The slow burn of the story is far more dragging than having to restart a game that doesnt allow skippable 10 minute cutsceans. The characters are charming in a phycopathic way but I have no clue as to why they do the things they do. Having a character who didnt know of something have everything ready for you when you arrive so he can get revenge and turn a martyr out of his enemy was stupid beyond compair. The amount of times single player chacters do something that could have been awesome but did not lent me to the idea that the world of gtaV needs to be blown up. 

Multi-player is maddening. With little competion they probably feel secure. However these is no excuse- you should sort griefers from PVP from people who just want to hang out with friends. Everyone usually tries everything eventually but lumping them all together sends a bad message. This isnt sea of theives its not built to mix the differing ideas together. In the past ive lost 100,000s because I was shot before a passive activation was counted. The Guns however are even worse. They dont lie but Ive found most of their stats are usless. Since everything in this game is a "like" and not really like true life... you have no Idea if something behaves like it does in real. A short stop AK is more deadly than a custom one even though its stats are worse? Racing it gets real bad but the stats are mostly accurate just throw out any comparisions to real life or games. The matchmaking is bulked and anyone can interupt and while I dont know how they break into a "closed" game I do know I dont want greifers. Ive tried on 3 seperate occations to try this game over at least some years apart. Every time IM PUNISHED. 

It wouldnt be so bad but my social is not reading me but if I click purchase something the shark card is up before I can blink. This game does not get credit for being made before the "pay to play" craze. 

Im mostly making this review in the vain hope that somone on GTA V relizes their will be no VI because nothing in politics has changed. The only hope is to fix this game and keep it going because as Ive said- Its kinda the only car and gun game around. I can understand banning mods when your fleecing us of all our money but their is no excuse for bad load times.- Glitches and the abundance of hackers who seemingly delight in their aparent relization the world must die... {wonder where they think they could go if they get their goal.- lol} 

As Ive written this review Ive relized many mistakes in grammer but Id like to keep it up. The real test of greatness is understanding a person's message no matter how rough. I feel I wont change anyone's oppinion but surly they would have thought of matchmaking corrals and faster servers.... as for single player either you like battlefront 2 the new one grind feasts or you already know you can handle a few bugs on pc and have bought Cyberpunk 2077 { I dont give into hype so i didnt have an issue. A few T poses but no grining my gears}- even in the future it makes more since than this simulation. Ill probably still play now and then for friends but Ive a ton of hours on Payday 2 and I imagine that I will still out-pace this game from onward this moment. 

If you like fast and furious and dont mind everything being jankey, laggy, and bug ridden its perfect. If you dont care about cars- play Payday 2 - If you dont like multiplayer - Cyberpunk 2077. 

rant over- hope this helps

Did you ever want to see Los Angeles, California? Grand Theft Auto V is set in the city of Los Santos, a fictional city that has a striking resemblance to the City of Angels. One will not be bored here because of its massive content from Hollywood, Downtown LA, LAX, UCLA, Staples Center, and even Napa Valley. It is now up to the player how he or she wants to live the life in this beautiful city.

The Criminal Enterprise DLC is absolutely worth it if one buys it during a Steam Sale, for those who are wondering.

Review on GTA:Online only:

Been playing since 2015, but took a couple years break.
Returned because I've heard of the recent QoL update - You can now do 99% of the previously online exclusive events, in private / invite-only / friends-only session. Modders? Hackers? Cheaters? Griefers? Not a problem, at all, anymore.

And now that I've returned to GTA:O after my year long hiatus, the passion, the fun, the excitement were reignited.
GTA:O is like a theme park, it's got a little bit of something for almost everyone. And the enjoyment only multiplies if you've got someone to share that experience with.

The more friends you can drag on in this adventure, the merrier it'll be.
But the GTA:O is definitely a lot more bare bone if you're playing it like a singleplayer game, however even basing that experience, GTA5:Premium Edition of a CDN$14.80 is well worth the price.
It can be fun and enjoyable but I think it's slightly overrated and its story is pretty shallow, especially when compared to other games rockstar has made like rdr2 and gta 4.

A strict downgrade from Grand Theft Auto 4. The combination of lack of building interiors, worse physics, collision detection, vehicle damage modeling system, pedestrian behavior scripts, and AI makes for a less immersive game with inferior world building. The story itself is a slog to get through so it is absolutely critical for free roam to take up the slack but unfortunately the game just falls apart on that front.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Start GTA V in 2022, Buy at least $200 worth of Shark Cards, purchase an Agency, Nightclub, Arcade, Penthouse, other shit, and all guns at once. 
Go achievement hunting, finish your heist series from Fleeca bank to Cayo Perico. Own a Bunker and start killing MFs and then get targeted and called bounties on, be confronted by a hacker, get forcefully Ddossed and Money drop to where you are vulnerable to getting your account banned for cheating. 
Everything back to normal since you start staying in private Solo/Friend/Crew lobbies.

Buy a Auto Shop get a bunch of tuner/muscle cars with the money the hacker gave you, start doing car deliveries, finally you find dopamine on how great GTA Online has developed since you aren't able to play GTA Online in Old Gen consoles, and then...

Knock! Knock!

If you're going to suit up to play GTA5 Online on PC, you might want to just start looking into mod menus now.  The game is filled with modders, and with the accessibility of free mod menus, every 12 year old and all their friends are in god mode griefing every session.  You literally cannot find a session online that doesn't have at least 2 or 3 modders.  The differences between console and PC are pretty vast.  On console every session is basically all out war with everyone killing everyone... on PC it seems to be kind of frowned upon, but you can still find a fight here and there.  Mostly just people cargo grinding, or screwing around modding sessions.  It is amazing that this game after all these years is still almost as relevant today as it was in what, 2013?  Still a fun game and you can do many many things from hitting up the Casino, racing, cruising around in free mode, grinding cargo, heists, etc.  You can even enjoy a game of golf or tennis.
This game is immersive, and you can get lost in here. You can create a whole new life! I have been playing the franchise for years.

Ok on steam i have over 300 hours, but i cant tell you how many more i have on my console. so well over 500 hours total. The campaign alone is worth buying the game, its a little bit slow at first, but it has such a great story and all in all a good game. The Multiplayer on the other hand not so much. If you have friends to play it with it is great, you can do heists together and missions, races, so many things. the multiplayer has so much to offer. But if you are playing by yourself, its hard to find randoms that are willing to help with heists or heist prep so theres not much to do. plus even with or without friends there are lots of griefers, and lots of hackers, so be wary. The campaign alone is worth the money, but if you have friends to play this with multiplayer is great. BTW FYI, this game is not cross compatible. you can only play with other pc users, no consoles.

My online experience:
After years of playing and loving this game, I have finally quit. The game in its current state is unplayable. In every single lobby there are modders that are trying to ruin your experience. In the past you could start a solo lobby with the task manager and only 3 to 4 players would eventually join. Now at least 1 of those 3 to 4 players is either modding or griefing. There is no longer any fun to be found in trying to play the game. The updates have made the game more favorable for griefers because of all the new ways to kill your fellow players and Rockstar is still not taking on the modders.

Advice for new players:
New people shouldn't consider playing online. I tried getting a friend to play the game, but she ended up get griefed so much because of her low level that it was near unplayable for her. You can play minigames and races, but that is all.

Advice for returning players:
If you like griefing there is definitely some fun to had for you in this game, but you need to already have some money to buy the stuff you need to do so, because it will be hard to get the money because of all the griefers.

If you like doing missions and heists I would suggest to find another game, because there will be a lot of players trying to stop you from finishing the setups. It is possible, but you will face a lot of modders and griefers so it will take up a large amount of time.

If you like doing races and minigames with friends, then you should definitely still consider playing this games. The minigames are great and the races are still enjoyable. There are not a lot of good new minigames but old classics like sumo are still very enjoyable.

STEP 1
Cut 185g unsalted butter into small cubes and tip into a medium bowl. Break 185g dark chocolate into small pieces and drop into the bowl.

STEP 2
Fill a small saucepan about a quarter full with hot water, then sit the bowl on top so it rests on the rim of the pan, not touching the water. Put over a low heat until the butter and chocolate have melted, stirring occasionally to mix them.

STEP 3
Remove the bowl from the pan. Alternatively, cover the bowl loosely with cling film and put in the microwave for 2 minutes on High. Leave the melted mixture to cool to room temperature.

STEP 4
While you wait for the chocolate to cool, position a shelf in the middle of your oven and turn the oven on to 180C/160C fan/gas 4.

STEP 5
Using a shallow 20cm square tin, cut out a square of non-stick baking parchment to line the base. Tip 85g plain flour and 40g cocoa powder into a sieve held over a medium bowl. Tap and shake the sieve so they run through together and you get rid of any lumps.

STEP 6
Chop 50g white chocolate and 50g milk chocolate into chunks on a board.

STEP 7
Break 3 large eggs into a large bowl and tip in 275g golden caster sugar. With an electric mixer on maximum speed, whisk the eggs and sugar. They will look thick and creamy, like a milk shake. This can take 3-8 minutes, depending on how powerful your mixer is. You‚Äôll know it‚Äôs ready when the mixture becomes really pale and about double its original volume. Another check is to turn off the mixer, lift out the beaters and wiggle them from side to side. If the mixture that runs off the beaters leaves a trail on the surface of the mixture in the bowl for a second or two, you‚Äôre there.

STEP 8
Pour the cooled chocolate mixture over the eggy mousse, then gently fold together with a rubber spatula. Plunge the spatula in at one side, take it underneath and bring it up the opposite side and in again at the middle. Continue going under and over in a figure of eight, moving the bowl round after each folding so you can get at it from all sides, until the two mixtures are one and the colour is a mottled dark brown. The idea is to marry them without knocking out the air, so be as gentle and slow as you like.

STEP 9
Hold the sieve over the bowl of eggy chocolate mixture and resift the cocoa and flour mixture, shaking the sieve from side to side, to cover the top evenly.

STEP 10
Gently fold in this powder using the same figure of eight action as before. The mixture will look dry and dusty at first, and a bit unpromising, but if you keep going very gently and patiently, it will end up looking gungy and fudgy. Stop just before you feel you should, as you don‚Äôt want to overdo this mixing.

STEP 11
Finally, stir in the white and milk chocolate chunks until they‚Äôre dotted throughout.

STEP 12
Pour the mixture into the prepared tin, scraping every bit out of the bowl with the spatula. Gently ease the mixture into the corners of the tin and paddle the spatula from side to side across the top to level it.

STEP 13
Put in the oven and set your timer for 25 mins. When the buzzer goes, open the oven, pull the shelf out a bit and gently shake the tin. If the brownie wobbles in the middle, it‚Äôs not quite done, so slide it back in and bake for another 5 minutes until the top has a shiny, papery crust and the sides are just beginning to come away from the tin. Take out of the oven.

STEP 14
Leave the whole thing in the tin until completely cold, then, if you‚Äôre using the brownie tin, lift up the protruding rim slightly and slide the uncut brownie out on its base. If you‚Äôre using a normal tin, lift out the brownie with the foil. Cut into quarters, then cut each quarter into four squares and finally into triangles.

STEP 15
They‚Äôll keep in an airtight container for a good two weeks and in the freezer for up to a month.

To start off, GTA V is a good game. It might not have the best storyline we‚Äôve seen from the series, but it is a very well-crafted and enjoyable experience. The map and atmosphere of Los Santos are unmatched by anything on the market, there is truly no competition. However, the singleplayer part of the game has not been updated since 2015, with all of the content being added to online instead. And Online is very different to GTA V, and the reason for why this review is a negative one. To start off; it‚Äôs simply silly. In a game about street crime and taking scores R* has decided adding content such as flying jet powered bikes w/heat-seeking missiles is appropriate. The reason for such additions and departure from an experience that remains a little more grounded is simple, it‚Äôs money. At this point GTA Online only exists for the purpose of extracting as much monetary value from children (or rather, their parents) as possible. Putting aside how unethical this is, it makes for a much worse end product. That being said, it can still be enjoyable at times, simply because it is built upon the foundations of GTA V, the map and atmosphere is still there, and on PC where players tend to be a little more mature than on console you can usually end up in peaceful sessions away from R*‚Äôs bullshit additions. However, even if you do enjoy online, the downright non-existent security opens up more problems. This is because R* has made no attempt at making their software safe to use. First of all, flaws within the Social Club application make it so that you can be tracked across the game by people who exploit them, and since servers are peer-to-peer this means an external party can have complete control over your experience; they can straight up make it impossible for you to join online, effectively banning you, and there‚Äôs nothing R* can do about it. And this is the least of the problems associated with R*‚Äôs peer-to-peer system, since not only does it make hacking in the game incredibly easy and pretty much impossible to prevent (not like R* has made any attempts at stopping hackers mind you), it also means that anybody can see your IP address, giving this software the potential to doxx your rough location. Long story short; Grand Theft Auto Online is an exploitative mess that R* has not even attempted to make safe for us to use.

We are our own worst enemies when it comes to GTA.

Pros,

Best campaign in the series.
Voice acting is on point.
Graphically has always been stunning.
The map is diverse.
So many vehicles and options to customise them.
Buying properties and starting businesses is a cool concept.
Amazing gunplay.
Large amount of weapons.
Many easter eggs and the urge to explore everywhere.
Minigames gallore.
Amazing characters and side characters.
Unique character swapping system.
Alive world where NPC's have random encounters frequently.
Stock market in single player.
Amazing mod support.
Engaging and fun online missions.
Heists.
Over 20 radio stations packed with popular music.

Cons,

Online public lobbies are the most toxic place in online gaming.
Pay to Win.
Shark cards.
Playing without purchasing shark cards is a long and tedius grind.
No single player DLC which is a massive tragedy after GTA4.
Game misses the health notification from previous GTA games when shooting somebody.
Mission timers if you take too long.
Car customisation is overly expensive.
Oppresser.
Business running is pointless without the upgrades.
Loading screens.

Look.

It isn't perfect.

And it WASN'T bad.

But we as a community destroyed this game, I have thousands of hours on console but recently purchased on PC to play with another friend. 

The community are the reason there is not a GTA6 yet, Youtubers and streamers, shark cards and hackers.

All part of the problem.

Why would Rockstar make another GTA rapidly when GTA5 is still one of the biggest cash cows even 9 years on?

Supporters can blame complex development and blah blah blah.

But the reality is that Rockstar are going to squeeze every last droplet of money out of this game before they even show a trailer for VI.

We all joke about Skyrim but I think GTA is a far worse business practice considering the MTX.

TLDR.

Do not buy this for online unless you have at least one friend.

If you are for single player then you will enjoy the greatest of what Rockstar USED to do with their GTA games.

It can be fun online.

But sometimes it feels like a job.

While Grand Theft Auto V is a fine game on it's own, it's ruined by the existence of GTA Online. The story holds up even to this day, but the same cannot be said about online play. What started as a simple racing, deathmatch, and mission mode with your friends became and absolute solo grindfest. The economy is in ruin, where a single supercar will cost you hundreds of dollars in microtransactions, of tens of hours in grinding. The issue only gets worse when you consider the existence of griefers and modders, as well as the piss poor performance of the game itself and the security of peer-to-peer. As someone who's spend well over 800 hours in the online mode itself on PC after exhausting all story mode content, I cannot recommend this game in 2022 unless you've never seen it's story.

A walking simulator set in a fusion of a fantasy Los Angeles, Canon City, Fontana, Bullhead City and other places.

You can ride bike.  You can drive cars.  You can drive motorcycles.  There are aircraft and boats.

You can pretend to a criminal and set up various criminal enterprises and schemes.

You can be cannon fodder for anyone who has more time /played than you unless you find all the menus and learn how not to be cannon fodder.

You can shoot a gun or two.

You can get chased by cops or the army or other players.

Once you have enough unlocked it is time for you to determine if you are going to stay or go.

Staying means either learning to hunt other players or collecting outfits, vehicles and firearms that you didn't need to use to get to this point.

Going means you have fond memories of being here in either case.  If you are gonna go, don't stay so long as to ruin it for yourself.

Despite my hours, I have never actually touched the single player portion of the game outside the required tutorial -- all of my time has been spent enjoying GTA Online.
This should give any prospective customer a good idea of just how much game they'll receive for their dollar, here.

The campaign in GTAV takes a fresh approach to the protagonist -- allowing the player to switch, at their leaisure, between 3 different scumbags with 3 different lives.  It's fun way to tell the story, and works well for approaching the multi-tiered narrative these titles have been famous for, as you get different firsthand perspectives on events and circumstances.

It's great fun, and I highly recommend it for both single & multiplayer open-world afficienados.

Never has more effort gone into a satirical piece. I finally beat this game a decade after it was released and still found it amazing. Top tier open-world. Go slow. Take the time to read signs, talk to strangers, listen to the radio and just absorb all that is GTA5.

TL;DR

ok so to start with lets talk about the game the story telling is what you would expect from rockstar games. but unlike its siblings this episode of GTA allows the players to take on the roles of 3 antagonists.  
franklin tailed consistently by the idiot known as lamar. micheal desanta retired bank robber and struggleing to control his family and Trevor phillipes the very embodiment of a phsycopath trailed closely by wade an unfortunate but idiotic person and the more disguisting ron. as you play each micheal franklin and trevor you begin to learn a great deal about their pasts but ultimatly your led down a extra violent path leaveing chaos and destruction in your wake. in relation to story telling the game fullfills this very well but once you've completed it once it like red dead redemtion 2 pointless going through the story again unless you intend to make different decisions. but there isn't really any way to improve on the story

then you have obviously the online element. you play as your own custom made character (and yes you are mentioned in the story. since for awhile up until the ill gotten gains part 2 update online events occured before the story mode and then as the ceo warehouses came into play events of online occured after the story mode. 
the updates for the online of gta was great and fun to play but due to modders hackers and the likes things got gradually more and more expensive. which is fine. in any event you have alot to do from warehouses to stealing top end cars to gun running drugs sales nightclub oownership many heists and more 

now theres the GTA5+ subscription service, you are in no way obligated to  subscribe to the service as its more aimed toward helping new players  and it is utterly useless to veteran players who already have alot of money or at the very least have a bussiness that you rely on to make money with. from recent discussions only other reason to have it is for the rarest loot in the casino hiest the diamonds. 

thankfully now since the last dlc release everything is playable in invite only sessions removing the need to force solo public lobbies when playing ceo biker bunker and nightclub businesses. you may not get a bonus for the sale but most people are happy to give-up that bonus so long as we get to source and sell in peace. this is somthing the gta online community has been asking rockstar to do for years and they finally listened and gave us what we wanted. in general the update might not have been as big as the agency doomsday heist general heists businesses or others like it but that one change was more then enough to make us all happy.   but it didn't exactly address all of our issues but it is enough to satisfy us for now.

unfortunatly there has been abit of a dark cloud or controversy surrounding rockstar in the last year. 
where does this come from none other then red dead online. many feel that rdro is being severely neglected. but i am able to see things from both sides of this coin. having played both. 
honestly has rdro been neglected it certainly seems that way, rumors have it that rdro was merely a testing grounds for future gta titles and future gta online content but be that as it may truth is rdro has formed a following of devoted players and they feel left out because gta online still recives sizable updates. is it seriously lacking. atm yes it is but rdro is only on year 3 it seems to be following the same path gtao took for the most part for the first 3 years there was a lul in the size of content as in the first 3 years of gta only really saw small dlcs until the heists released after that updates got bigger and better. will rdro follow this i don't know. i can uinderstand rdos feelings the game is a good game and has potential but they have to understand to when all is said and done gta is their golden child.

The singleplayer is amazing, and I gladly wasted a good chunk of my life for it. Having said that, let me describe to you what multiplayer is like. It's buggy, it's slow, it's filled with griefers, and there are so many complications and steps and tutorials you have to complete just to play a simple mission with your friends. That is if your friends can connect at all.

Grand Theft Auto V - A 100% Review

Gta V, an action adventure game developed by the greatest devlopers of our life time. Rockstar is a company version of Quentin Tarantino. The story is so raw and real that we didn't ask for the insanity that is trevor, but we would be shameful to not appreciate and applaud them for making such great characters. The Story as much as a I love it, is dated, but is still a story that every gamer knows about none the less. This video game came out in 2013, a true neoclassical beauty. 

Story - The single player story mode lacks character development, Franklin after he gets his house. stays the same, Trevor, never changes, Micheal never changes, he thinks about his choices when he talks to his shrink but thats about it. That being said, the charisma, action, comedy, crude, porn things that happen in this game are SPECTACLUAR. The gameplay mechanics, graphics, and action packed missions and side content are somthing truly one of a kind. 

Story 8.5-9/10

Gta V Online - CANCER. but just like real cancer their is somthing beautiful about this game. the constant updates, content, hiests, cars, weapons, missions, events, collabs, music, PVP, fun, companys, bussiness etc etc, its amazing. This game on current gen and even next gen consoles is almost borderline UNPLAYABLE. but on PC what a joy ride. not being capped at 30 frames or even 60 and enjoying a good smooth 80-120 is just amazing. 

THE FLYING CANCER MARK II is what ruined  GTA V online, and now that is no longer a threat due to the constant updates and work by the dev team. SLOW but they got there. 

Online 8/10

All in all a solid game, that has a lot to offer and much like all of rockstar games, a must play 8/10

My only problem with this game is that it does not teach you how to play it. Like, at all. There's an entire keyboard of bound keys for functions of menus and sub menus and layers of interactions. It's like looking at that psycho map of conspiracies in that TV show, but there's no guide on how to use it. If that's a deal breaker, then this game isn't for you. They did a LOT of things right though, smooth game play, nice collision, graphics aren't going to burn your PC down on potato settings, fantastic dialogue so far, and incredible diversity of activity.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Online is marginally worth it if you get the game on sale cheap, but...

I can only really recommend it if you have some friends playing it already or to play it with, or really are fine with a lot of grinding solo.

The true online portion still suffers from cheating and remains mostly intolerable unless you want to spend a large amount of your time switching lobbies around to find one without someone cheating.

The single player meanwhile is quite bad. I'll try to explain it without providing any serious story spoilers.

The protagonists could have been interesting and I genuinely do like all three, yet none individually really get enough time to be fully explored or fleshed out, and the mission structure can feel schizophrenic due to sometimes forced switching and plot threads being dropped or picked up between protagonists.

Missions also pay few and far between early on, and a story theme seems to be characters ripping you off or not paying up, forcing you to basically earn money through dry stock market play on the few that do pay, or simply bum rush your way through half the story if you want to start buying much of anything.

One should not be stuck sitting around with the wiki, inevitably spoiling the story, to figure out which stock market stuff to invest in on all three protagonists before you even start a mission just to get some sort of reward out of early missions.

The later story often trips over itself with too much perspective swapping and picking up or dropping of plot threads, but failing to devote enough time to any specific thread to give it real impact, or to devote any time to meaningful interaction between the protagonists that could have built more on them.

Some of us are in this for the journey, not the destination, and this game purely messed that up compared to previous entries in my opinion. Not because of three protagonists being a bad idea, or the story being bad in concept, but because of shoddy execution.

As for side missions, many are unrewarding/disrespectful of time investment, or fail to respect player skill.

An example of unrewarding is a chain of tow truck missions that reward you no money on completion, but at the end of the chain allow you to purchase the towing company, which costs $200k, just so you can grind radiant tow truck missions that pay $500 each. A really terrible deal if there ever was one.

An example of disrespecting player skill is one involving a parachute jump leading in to a race against a character, where even though I landed a full 40 seconds before he did, I was forced to wait on him before starting the lame bike race where his AI practically cheated. A better game would have allowed me to have that 40 seconds lead from my skilled jump and landing as a head start in the race portion. Instead it wasted my time and made me wait around.

Previous entries from my memory just let you murder annoying "optional" characters like the above and basically opt out of their content and additionally get rid of their marker on your map to keep it "clean". I do not see why that freedom was removed given that the save system easily rectifies any accidents here.

Cars you have in single player are stored in a garage that you have to manually wander off to to pick up. While that was fine in the older single protagonist titles, there is little point buying the protagonists here other vehicles or customizing or storing things outside of their default due the fact that on switching, doing something on another one, and switching back, they will basically always be back in their default vehicle and might be literal miles away from their garage.

An ability to set your default would have been nice, or to call the mechanic and have one brought to you similar to how Online handles it. Instead due to the lack of that, you're mostly just going to have to come to terms with the default vehicle of each character.

The customization of the three protagonists can also feel rather lacking. Due to all three having rather set lifestyles and personalities they of course have styles and preferences they lean to. While I am personally okay with that, it can feel a bit limited and previous titles had a bit more flexibility while keeping the personality of their lead intact.

As for the game in general, expect a lot of unpolished elements such as clunky UI and genuinely horrible mouse and keyboard controls. It can get to the point of feeling like no matter what you are doing, your character and inputs simply are doing something else, acting unresponsive, or acting overly responsive to the point of wondering if your hardware is broken. 

The flight controls are also exceedingly bad and require an almost immediate remap, when a lot of other PC titles or ports have managed to get this right that were made prior to this game. Even when remapped however, expect them to at best be awkward and somewhat twitchy.

To have good controls when flying, you are stuck sitting around with a controller like a console peasant, when this is a PC release. That should not be a thing.

On other elements, the police are borderline psychic at times and will notice it when you shoot a lone pedestrian way off in the wilderness with a silenced weapon, during a thunderstorm, at night. At other times meanwhile I can, on crowded, open street in broad, clear daylight, simply blast someone with a shotgun with zero consequences. It feels like there is no real rhyme or reason to when what happens when it comes to how police in the game behave.

The wanted levels also take a rather long time to fade, and while one might argue "realism", it just ends up a time gate or annoying having to stand 100m off of some road waiting for it to go away.

Add to this that having any form of flying vehicle makes escaping any wanted level a complete joke, with me and a friend having successfully escaped 5 stars in a blimp. Flying reduces cops to a time gate to wait out before you get your mission way-point back, and makes this less "GTA" and more "Flight Simulator".

Even the original San Andreas had jets come after you eventually if you tried to escape by air, and it managed that balance of "Cops respond to things" and "Cops can be escaped with some but not excessive effort" better than this game does.

Other AI behavior can be just as rubbish or inconsistent, with them sometimes instantly headshotting you from 50m away with a shotgun on opening a door, or shooting you with laser accuracy through tiny slits in vehicle armor during chaotic high speed chases, and other times simply accepting death as you shoot them like a defenseless watermelon, or trying to take cover behind nonsensical objects like a parking meter or small tripod telescope when something far more suitable is a single step away.

Traffic meanwhile seems even more aggressive or intent on hitting the player at times than previous titles. While rockstar seems to find this "funny", it really isn't and loses any "haha wow random" charm it might have after the 30th time it happens. This is generally a trend that needs to die in rockstar titles.

As a final glaring problem, the game, like other rockstar titles of the generation, loves it's animations way too much.

Most times when I get killed it's not because of combat being "hard",  but because of almost instant, and endlessly, respawning enemies appearing within firing range while my character is taking their sweet time opening a door, carefully getting in to a vehicle, then needing to mess around to start said vehicle, all while being shot. I have literally no input or control over this while it happens, or way to speed it up.

That's not endearing. It's just annoying. While I respect "realism", it shouldn't come at the cost of game play and some contextual speed ups in what is being done, or just the ability to abort out of an animation to deal with a situation at hand would have been nice.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

The single player version is fantastic. The online version is absolutely awful. No real explanation of what's going on most of the time, throwing new players to the wolves. You start with some money, but aren't allowed to buy any good equipment and have no skills. This would be ok if you could play with people at a similar level to you, but you're turned loose into a hellscape of high-level players with unbeatable weapons randomly killing everyone, particularly new players. The missions have virtually no instructions, and if you join missions with other people you have no idea what skill levels are going to be required, and often don't have the equipment needed to successfully complete the mission. There's constant messages popping up everywhere that you have to deal with, random events going on that pop up screen-blocking notifications (and will often cause high-level players to randomly start murdering you), and general chaos happening everywhere. The game is probably reasonably balanced for higher level players, but if you're low level you're basically screwed.
Would definitely recommend this game. Very fun to play, the story is engaging and there are lots of places to explore around the map!

I'm a 42 year old medical professional and family man who has been gaming since he was 3 years old (1983 - Commodore SX-64, one of the first "portable" computers with a 5 inch 16 colour screen, which I still have in it's original box, look it up).  

I enjoy playing this game online with several of my oldest friends who are also in their early 40's. I also game with a couple guys on Empyrion, world of warships and similar who are in their 60's.  Age means nothing, i'm sure there are older people still - we all love gaming, it's at the heart of our recreation and I hope that it will remain at the heart of yours when a lot of you get older.  The body gets older, but what the mind enjoys stays the same. My friends and I all live separate lives across the country and across the world.  GTA V remains one of the main ways that I can stay in touch with my friends from childhood, forget the troubles of the world and hang out.

So, in essence that's 39 years of gaming under my belt, of which I have played and completed every GTA ever released.  So i'd say I am someone who is more than qualified to truly use the phrase "noob" to a lot of the young, toxic punks who think we shouldn't be online.

One day I hope you'll reach this age, and far beyond. Your life will be different and, no doubt, technology will have changed. But, you'll still be gaming and i'll be in my 60's, 70's & 80's, still kicking your butt at the latest version of GTA, because people are NEVER too old to game.

Most negative reviews I see are on the Online part. I have not engaged with that. I only played Story Mode and just quit in the middle of a mission and uninstalled the game because I got so bored with it.

- There is little (meaningful) to do besides story missions. 
- "Activities" like Tennis, towing trucks etc are pretty much pointless.
- Money is basically not a concept in the game. You get essentially no money for most missions/activities, and then a few bursts of absurd income through heists or stocks which allow you to buy any gear you want.
- The game is very easy with no difficulty options. There is basically no challenge except getting "Gold" on missions by fulfilling optional objectives. As far as I can tell, you do NOT know those objectives until you have completed the mission, so often you would need to replay the mission with the objectives in mind to get Gold. What's the point of getting Gold? I have no idea.
- Most missions are heavily padded by long drives, boring chases, waiting for stuff to happen etc. If you'd cut away all that stuff out, you would probably reduce play time by 50% or more.
- Missions and activities keep introducing new control schemes which are often terrible and you will never be able to remember all the button prompts until the next time.
- The main characters are idiots and the entire story feels contrived.

I don't think it's a "bad" game. But I do think your time and money is better spent elsewhere.

All in all, it's an amazing chapter of an amazing series.

But.
Ever since GTA 3, Rockstar managed to make GTA less playable on PC compared to consoles.
I'm talking about controls - it's not enjoyable for those who tries to play with (allegedly supported) keyboard and mouse.
Every installment has it's own way to spoil controls.
Vice City: no mouse steering for bikes.
San Andreas: normal mouse steering for bikes, but for cars, the wheels always drift to zero angle
GTA 4: no mouse steering. Fair enough. at least it's not declared as supported.
GTA 5: the steering for bikes has impossible sensivity, making them impossible to drive that way.

Is it made on purpose, idk. I doubt it's not.
Better buy it on consoles.
