The Hog Rider card is unlocked from the Spell Valley (Arena 5). He is a very fast building-targeting, melee troop with moderately high hitpoints and damage. He appears just like his Clash of Clans counterpart; a man with brown eyebrows, a beard, a mohawk, and a golden body piercing in his left ear who is riding a hog. A Hog Rider card costs 4 Elixir to deploy.
Strategy
His fast move speed can boost forward mini tanks like an Ice Golem in a push. At the same time, he can also function as a tank for lower hitpoint troops such as Goblins as he still has a fair amount of health. Most cheap swarms complement the Hog Rider well, as they are nearly as fast as him and usually force more than one card out of the opponent's hand.
The Hog Rider struggles with swarms, as they can damage him down and defeat him quickly while obstructing his path. Barbarians in particular can fully counter him without very strict timing on the defender's part, though be wary of spells.
A Hunter can kill the Hog Rider in 2 hits if placed right on top of it. However, if you place something in front of the Hog Rider, the Hunter's splash will damage the Hog Rider and hit the card in front of it more.
The Hog Rider in conjunction with the Freeze can surprise the opponent and allow the Hog Rider to deal much more damage than anticipated, especially if the opponent's go-to counter is a swarm, or swarms are their only effective counter to him. Skeletons and Bats will immediately be defeated by the spell, while Spear Goblins, Goblins, and Minions will be at low enough health to be defeated by a follow up Zap or Giant Snowball.
However, this strategy isn't very effective against buildings as the Hog Rider will take a while to destroy the building, giving the opponent ample time to articulate another counter.
Against non-swarm troops, it can deal a lot of damage during the freeze time, but this can allow the opponent to set up a massive counterpush. For this reason, players should either only go for a Hog Rider + Freeze when they have other units backing it up from a counterattack, or if the match is about to end and they need to deal as much damage as possible.
It is not a good idea to send in a Hog Rider simply to destroy a building, especially if it is the only building targeting unit available, as defeating Crown Towers becomes substantially more difficult. Spells or simply waiting out the lifetime of the building are more effective. The exception to this is an Elixir Collector placed in front of the King's Tower. If a Hog Rider placed at the bridge, he can destroy the Collector for a positive Elixir trade, though the damage from both Princess Towers will usually mean he does not survive to deal any damage to them. However, if the opponent sends in defending troops, it can be an opportunity to gain spell damage value.
In a deck with several low-cost cards, it might be worth it to simply send the Hog Rider against one building. These decks shuffle their card rotation quick enough, that they will arrive to their next Hog Rider before the next building arrives in the opponent's card rotation.
Long-ranged troops like Musketeer and Flying Machine can snipe those buildings, preserving some of the Hog Rider's health, possibly allowing it to get some Tower damage.
When there are buildings placed in the middle to counter the Hog Rider, understanding the placement of the Hog Rider and the type of building placed can help the Hog Rider to bypass certain buildings.
Passive buildings such as spawners and Elixir Collector have a larger hitbox than defensive buildings; which means that if a passive building was placed 3 tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, then it is impossible for the Hog Rider to bypass that placement as the Hog Rider will get pulled to that building.
Defensive buildings have a smaller hitbox than a passive building, which means if that if a defensive building was placed three tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, a Hog Rider placed at the very left or right side of the Arena may be able to bypass it due to its smaller hitbox.
If the player has a building already placed down in the center of the arena, and the opponent tries to bypass it with a Hog Rider at the edge of the arena, they can use certain air troops to push the Hog Rider towards the building as it jumps over the river, effectively denying the bypass attempt. They must be already hovering over the correct placement, as very quick reflexes are required to correctly perform this technique.
For Bats, Skeleton Dragons, and Minion Horde, they should be placed right in front of the Hog Rider as soon as it is deployed.
For Minions, Skeleton Barrel, Mega Minion, Flying Machine, Electro Dragon, Baby Dragon, Inferno Dragon, Balloon, and Lava Hound, stagger the above placement one tile to the right if the Hog Rider is placed on the left side of the arena, and vice versa.
They can also use ground troops to achieve the same result. Something like an Ice Golem deployed at the Hog Rider‚Äôs landing spot will obstruct his path and force him to go around the unit, which causes him to be closer to the building instead of the Crown Tower.
The Hog Rider can kite Very Fast non-building targeting troops due to his own Very Fast speed and building only targeting if he is placed on the fourth tile from the bridge, slightly into the opposite lane. He can also stall grounded units when placed right at the bridge. He will pull them towards him while deploying, and then be untargetable by them when he jumps over the bridge. After landing, he will pull them back. This can be useful when the player needs to deal damage in the same lane they are defending. It will also help separate troops behind a tank in a large push.
A Tornado placed on the second tile front of the player's King's Tower and staggered two tiles towards the Princess Tower will activate it without any damage dealt to the Princess Tower, helping them in defending future pushes. This can also be a method of mitigating all damage dealt to a Princess Tower, but doing this more than three times may result in the King's Tower's health being low enough to be targeted directly, opening up the possible threat of a back door three crown. A better alternative is to pull the Hog away from the Princess Tower into the attacking range of all three Crown Towers, which will negate all damage as long as none of them are already distracted
A very powerful combo is the Hog Rider, the Musketeer, and the Valkyrie, typically referred to as the Trifecta. The Musketeer will defend against most troops, while the Valkyrie can protect her and the Hog Rider from swarms or high damage units. The Hog Rider is used to deal damage to the tower.
This can be effectively countered by Lightning, one-shotting the Musketeer and severely damaging both the Valkyrie and Hog Rider. The Minion Horde is also effective, but the enemy can Zap them and the Musketeer will one-shot them all. Even if the Musketeer is defeated, the Hog Rider and Valkyrie will have enough time to severely damage the Tower.
The Hog Rider should be placed behind the Valkyrie to give it a boost so that it stays in front of the Hog Rider, protecting it.
A Hog Rider combined with a Goblin Barrel can be awkward for the opponent to defend against. Timing it so that the Hog Rider is tanking the tower shots for the Goblins is the most effective way to deal damage. However, a Barbarian Barrel can shut this down with minimal Tower damage for a positive Elixir trade, as long as the Goblin Barrel was placed directly on the Tower.
Pairing the Hog Rider with the Balloon can deal devastating damage. If executed properly, the Hog Rider will act as a tank while the Balloon threatens to deal massive damage. The Hog Rider can also destroy any buildings attempting to slow down the combo. However, this combo is very vulnerable to swarms and anti-air cards as neither of the troops target anything but buildings.

Even 8 years later, this game is easily one of the best that you can buy. Whilst GTA Online has gone in a direction I don't like - and wouldn't really recommend in engaging very much with to complete newcomers by this stage - I can't ignore that it still has thousands of hours to offer players across a variety of different activities - there's something for everyone in GTA Online and it will also make them money whilst they're at it. Single Player is also undeniably a brilliant experience. Even though it will take you a while to get through to the end of the story, there's really no excuse for not playing it through at least once. A lot of us have got a bit tired of this game in the many years since it's original release, but from an objective point of view, even if this game released for the very first time this year, it would still be one of the best video games ever made and blow us all away. The driving is much easier than GTA 4, literally anyone can be a decent driver in GTA 5 unless you have brain damage, but I guess it makes it more accessible, lol. Shooting is also much improved and is high quality, and those two elements combined with many others, including but not limited to the excellent map, make this game a perfect sandbox.

U all know about this game!

Grand Theft Auto V. One of the most iconic games in gaming history. A game with an online that is worse than trying to perform your own surgery, without anaesthetic. And a story mode so fun, I could play for another 50 hours un-modded on another play-through. I want to talk about both and talk about how I like the game.

Grand Theft Auto V's Online at the current moment and probably for a long while, modder's are in every game. You could be blown up at best, and get ddossed at worst. The gameplay loop is semi-entertaining at best and boring at worst. As I have seen online, anyone with a mod menu can view your I.P Address so playing without a VPN is probably not a good thing. They can also kick you from sessions, blow you up, crash your game, trap you in a cage and give themselves millions of dollars.

The singleplayer experience is a amazing game. It is definitely worth playing. I have sunk countless hours on my Alternate Rockstar Account on Epic Games and my PlayStation account. The Story and the characters are so well built and the game feels fun. In the last month I have played 65-ish hours in the story mode. I love the story mode.

My suggestion is that you don't play the game online, or if you do, use a VPN, and do the 'Resource Manager' empty lobby trick. Buying the game full price is probably a big scam, buy it for around $50 AUD. When the game gets a massive online update, and when I sink in an additional 104 hours, I will add another paragraph.

I really enjoy the story, and every single character. 
I don't like how ludicrous, in difficulty, some of the heists and missions are. 
I definitely like the submarine, and how it can be piloted while your crew moves around inside. The details in that thing are amazing.
I don't like how slow it is generate wealth, in order to afford the DLC, and other cool stuff. I know Rockstar has to make their money, somehow, but come on. 
I like how the world of GTAV has grown. There is so much more to do, than there was when the game first released.
Honestly, with the massive potential GTAV has, it should have had 3 times the content it has. today. I know it's not easy, keeping up the quality, juggling costs, planning, the cost of implementing changes, plus a hundred other things, but it's not too late to push a little more into it. 
My biggest and most infuriating pet peeve about GTAV, is that there are certain hills that a 5 year old could climb within seconds, but your adult character just can't figure it out. It is the single most clumsy thing that keeps this game from being perfect, on the standpoint of exploring the world.

Fix your game Rockstar. I am unable to do the easiest of tasks in a public lobby without getting glitched into a wall. griefed by  a modder, D-DOSed, or having the game crash.

I have a couple of suggestions to slightly improve the game (by slightly I mean greatly):

1. Does anyone actually like the fact that NPC drivers are programmed to randomly change lanes in front of you? Why is it a thing?

2. If a player has a level of 6000 and game  time of only a few hundred hours, why are they allowed to join any public lobbies? Even players who have been playing since the game came out are only around 1000-2000.

3. Check the chat logs before banning people who get cash dropped. Even a bot could easily do this by looking for the words  "cash", "money", "give", "modder." Then dont ban those who get cash dropped if they did not ask for it. 

4. eliminate the MK.2 entirely. There is no need for a flying bike that fires homing missiles. 

5. MODERATE YOUR SERVERS. even if it is undercover employees or bots acting as players. If Nuclear submarines are falling from the sky, hundreds of cars are being spawned per second, or more than 4 or 5 players are being transported to cayo perico, there might be a small chance that a modder is in the server. If there was a way to contact devs or submit proof of another player modding, modders would probably quickly die out or at least not last that long.

6. READ REVIEWS. I know this will not be read by a dev, so I clearly have too much time on my hands. but if a single tiny update added these features, it could fix the biggest issues of the game. 

Well I just wasted 15 minutes of my life. Overall the game is great, but the fact that these issues have been in the game for so long means that the devs clearly don't care about their players at all. Maybe at least one or two of these issues will be fixed when GTA 6 comes out in the year 2256.

Nope you got disconnected so now we're gonna make you load into story mode and then switch back to online mode. Want to do heists? Want to enter your arcade? nah you're screen is gonna freeze and force you to completely restart the game. Want to go into any building or do something without taking a chance on your game freezing? Sorry but we're gonna put a loading screen in every possible spot we can so we can show you all the great opportunities there are in this game that nobody plays because its either boring or takes forever. Want to buy a deluxo or a vehicle that helps you get around the map? Bought it for GTA Online mainly. Played for two weeks and then realized: The devs don't care about the enjoyment of the player experience, all they want is playtime, which is reflected by the boring and stale delivery missions, lack of passion in new updates, and just not updating security exploits and hacks. The game for sure was a a good game but as time went on (btw 9 years old!!!) the devs neglected it tremendously and are squeezing out every last of drop money and time out of players.

Neg:
- You are caught in a loop. To be able to play missions you need to buy certain properties and vehicles which cost millions, so naturally you just farm and farm and farm to collect the money. Basically you have to farm way too long to even be able to afford one item, because everything is so ridiculously overpriced (only to push the players to buy their sharkcards). Example: A Deluxo (flying vehicle) costs around 4 million, now you can earn these 4 million by playing delivery mission which at bets give you a slim chance to earn 100k each time or you can buy 4 million by sharkcards which translates to roughly: 50 USD real life money. Youre choice. It's either: A fat amount of time or a big chunk out of your wallet.

- The game has a lot of issues with toxic playerbase and hackers. Rockstar since release has MINIMAL efforts to solve these issues and just leaves the playerbase on their own, which I think makes honest players even quicker to join the dark side.

- It's all in all very unbalanced and designed to literally squeeze playtime out of you and drive you closer to buying one of their sharkcards.

Pro:
- The game on high settings doesn't look too bad.

- Cool cars and possibilities to tune them.

Bottom Line:
Don't buy the game at all, not even for it's campaign. It really just drags out time and (if you give in: real money) out of you. They do that because the game is now 9 years old and is about the get swallowed by its descendant: GTA 6, which will come out around 2024 -2025, so they are squeezing every last drop out of this game right now. If you buy the game now, you will basically just get shit on by the devs,

If you want to mod the game, tough luck. Rockstar for whatever reason wants GTAV and GTA Online to share the same executable and files, despite all the issues it causes for both them and their player base. Specifically here, it means that around 95% of the mods released for the game no longer work because the constant updates for GTA Online have broken them.

If you like the grindy, pay-to-win borefest that constitutes GTA Online, that's great, I'm happy for you. It just sucks that the mode has completely ruined one of the best aspects of the single player experience for what is effectively no good reason.

[h1]Story mode[/h1]

Excellent writing and gameplay! Rememberable and iconic protagonists! Unforgivable environmental storytelling and world building! 

The only negative feedback is all the random obstacles along the way. Kill corrupt and bad guys, rinse and repeat. Could‚Äôve had some weapons from online even if it‚Äôs not meta.

After completing the game a few times, there‚Äôs always the option to download Script Hook V. Always fun to mod the story mod with some extra challenges and realism. Maybe even a Native Trainer ;).

[h1] Online [/h1]
[hr][/hr]
Yeah‚Ä¶

Has alright missions and heists to take a part in. A few businesses to own and expand. Low-end apartments to high-end penthouses, dope cars, smashing clothing, you name it. Cannot forget that mf- orbital f- canon ([i]though, nowhere near what the online experience really has to offer[/i]). 

[b]The GTA Online experience[/b]

[i]Modders using godmode, aim botting, teleporting, removing weapons and cash, stalking, griefing, getting you banned, obtaining clients network identifiers, targeted harassment, outright toxicity, server and client scripts injections, crashing clients, boot looping, connection rejections. To name a few‚Ä¶[/i]

Don‚Äôt bother reporting anyone for modding. Not only won‚Äôt the report be submitted, but you‚Äôll also have to pay the price along with kissing your Social Club account goodbye.

Instead try and force the client into a new public session with only in it or a private session. However, once you‚Äôre targeted by modders this won‚Äôt get rid of them. Use custom firewalls like [url=https://gitlab.com/Speyedr/guardian-fastload-fix]Guardian[/url] so only whitelisted clients can join your session.

As someone who likes singleplayer games, I was annoyed by a lot of the aspects of gta Online, HOWEVER, I still think it was more fun than gta 5 on its own. I was expecting something a lot different, as this was my first gta game. I guess I sorta thought it would be more like saints row, with a customizable player character, a bunch of jokes, and a lot of shooting. Instead there were a group of pre-determined characters which I had to switch between, none of which I really found interesting at all. Online at least let's you make your own character, which I really appreciate, and if you finesse the character creation, you can even make a good one. But the forced online aspects were really a bummer, especially since I hate gaming with other people and my wifi is pretty ass anyway. Yes, you can join a private session, but you can't have it default to that, so you have to change it every time, and a lot of the missions aren't meant to be done solo, so they can be a little balls to the wall depending on the mission type. That, and all the world activities are based on making groups with other players, which is fucking annoying when you're looking for something to solo. That being said, this game did have it's moments, and I certainly won't be refunding it, so I definitely have mixed feelings. I like that the player character in online is a silent protagonist, because noisy, chatty, annoying protagonists make me want to shoot things (which I guess is desirable anyway, but I digress). Overall, would recommend, but just wanted to warn people like me who are looking for a saints row-type game. This isn't really it.

Years after release, and it's still a buggy mess.

Rockstar only has one game online at the moment, since RDRO has gone away, so I decided to play some GTA Online for the first time. I was immediately greeted with graphical glitches, and my first time attempting to deliver crates for my business, to really get started with Online, the game glitched and I received zero reward for hours of playtime.

My friends said not to worry, as Rockstar support was good. I emailed support, and their response was to update my drivers. When I assured them that my drivers were updated, they gave me GTA$92,000 to rebuy the crates, when the mission that glitched would've gotten me GTA$480,000.

They requested video proof of the incident to provide any more help. I am incredibly disappointed with the game and wouldn't recommend anyone to purchase it, if they haven't already. GTA Online is a buggy, often frustrating mess that is a once-good developer's excuse for relevance. Pass.

IF YOU ARE BUYING FOR GTA ONLINE - DO NOT BOTHER! Devs are hell-bent on getting players to pay for "Shark Cards" to convert to in-game currency. Thus most of the online game is extremely grindy - boring and repetitive, with small payouts compared to the effort required to complete said missions. Any mission or heist offering a decent payout will either have the player's weapons nerfed like mad, or infinite waves of helicopters and other enemies to ensure mission failure. Also, for new players, it's pointless to join a public lobby as you will be killed/griefed within minutes. Very confusing initial gameplay, with little explanation of how the mechanics of roles such as CEO/Club President/VIP actually work. You will need to consult Youtube tutorials to play correctly. If you just want the 2013 game (story mode), which was very good, then go ahead, but don't purchase GTA V for the online play alone - you will be disappointed.

How to Make Baked Potatoes
The best part about this recipe is that it's so incredibly easy! You'll find the full recipe below, but here's what you can expect when making the perfect baked potato:

Season the Potatoes
Start off by rinsing and scrubbing the potatoes. Then, pierce each potato with a fork or knife so that steam can escape when baking. Coat the potato with olive oil (you can use your hands to rub it all over the skin or place the potato and oil in a zip-top bag and shake it up) and season with salt.

Bake the Potatoes
Bake in a 300 degree F oven until the potatoes are tender and golden brown, about 90 minutes.

Top Potatoes
Slice the potatoes and fluff the center. Then top with black pepper, butter, Cheddar cheese, chives, sour cream, or anything else you like.

How Long to Bake Potatoes
The baking time for baked potatoes will depend on the size of the potatoes. It can take anywhere between 50 minutes and 1 ¬Ω hours. 

You'll know the baked potato is done when you can stick a fork in the potato and it easily pierces through the skin. If the potato is still hard in the middle, keep baking it for a little longer. 

When in doubt, pull out your digital thermometer ‚Äî baked potatoes are done when they have an internal temperature of 210 degrees F.

Gta V was a good game to me because of the story mode. Back in 2019 I used to play this game on an xbox one every day. It used to be a hell of a time, but the story got repetitive. So I ventured into online. It pissed me of due to the toxic community and constant pressure to buy shark cards. Anyways, I ended up getting a pc in 2021 and buying Grand Theft Auto V on steam.
I also decided to add realism mods into the game and make it more challenging and sure enough the game was fun again. This meant that I got out of my comfort zone and got a ton of other mods such as, mission mods, texture mods, trainers, role play mods, and much more! This made going back to xbox so boring.

In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is an experience that is great. So long as you don't touch the online mode of the game. Especially if you play on pc, as this game has excellent modding potential.

End of review.

I do enjoy this game, I really do. It is a great time with friends and can create some amazing new experiences. I'm not denying, there is a lot to like here, and I like most of it. That's where the other part comes in. And that is the simple fact that this game does not reward you for 100% of the work that you put in. It rewards you for ~60%. One of my biggest pet peeves in gaming is where you put your blood, sweat, and tears into a job just for it to give you an impossible task to complete the job, making the entire 2 hours of previous grind void. Didn't finish the job but completed 80 percent of it? Give me that 80 percent. Make a dumb excuse for the other part that I did not complete. But it does not. It gives you nothing for 2 hours of work. This makes the game, for me, completely unenjoyable and unplayable. The only way to get that time back, is to mod it back in. That is not okay. Reward players for their work... all of it.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories. h

Shame I can't review the singleplayer and the multiplayer seperately because they are very different in quality. Storymode is a classic, with a good story, interesting characters and all kinds of fun to have in between. Online though... online is a buggy mess. Rockstar is smart for combining the two games into one so I can't leave a bad review, because online would be torn to shreds. The loading times are horrific, the connection issues are painful, especially given you have to suffer the first issue as well because of it, and to top it all off Rockstar don't seem to care about mods, hacks or any other kind of game-shattering software. You'd be lucky to find a lobby that doesn't have at least one hacker in it, a bot that spams links to websites to get mods, or just a generally unpleasant kind of guy who will blow up your car because "haha explosion". Even still, it's the wild west in online and even if you have a party of people to play with, the quests are grindy, unrewarding and oftentimes unfair too. 

TL;DR Get this game for a great solo experience, but put it at the bottom of your multiplayer games list.

GTA5 is the Goat of Urban crime gaming in a simulated environment. 

The level of detail to the level design, and where the game is at as of writing this... if this was released today it would be an AAA game for just GTA Online.

I don't think much more needs to be said about the game itself. So let's move on to the players and the business model.

First off the Shark Cards by themselves is the industry normal. In my honest opinion, unless you are making about $100+ an hour at your job, Shark Cards are NOT worth it.  So if you are single, living with your parents and pulling in close to 70-90k a year go ahead. Otherwise you are an addict and need help if you find yourself in defense of purchasing these - and I am not being offensive here: 

Rockstar's business model uses the adversarial nature of the game to increase the difficulty of avoiding the use of Shark Cards. Pack that with their new content all being behind pay walls further all but coerces you to consider Shark Cards.

But the real issue isn't just the subversive tactic here, it's also that there is no stability to the game to justify considering Shark Cards as paying for a service. (Which would give them more value in my book). Imagine trying to form a group, you guys are doing a CEO mission and suddenly your game crashes, okay you dust yourself off relog in and spend the time to form up a group again, a few minutes later it freezes and you crash, or you end up in a cage, or you get booted to story mode. This is the poison diminishes the value of GTA Online, the game is unplayable online and so I will not recommend this game.

Yes it had a rough start. Yes there were a lot of things promised that weren't there, but they have worked hard to bring us much of what was lacking, and the game is much better for it!

If you are expecting this game to be a fast-paced sci-fi thrill ride, you will be disappointed. Yet if you play it for what it is, a game heavily focused on exploration, and don't mind a slower pace starting out, you might be like me and learn to really like it. I find it great when I want something casual, and laid back. Sure, it gets a bit annoying starting out with having to repair your equipment seemingly way too often. Yet once you get on a planet with a decent environment, that isn't such an issue. Then you get vehicles (look up how to get them as I could have gotten many days earlier if I had know it). They help a lot.

Tips
1. Early on, don't worry about hanging onto everything. You can't. Find stuff that has a high value (tooltips tell you). Trash the low value stuff, and load up your bags with high value stuff. Then go sell it at a space station.
2. The stuff you need to fuel your ship (Tritium) can be found shooting up asteroids and the crystal formations stuck to them, just beyond your planets atmosphere! Easy to farm.
3. Scan for and get buried technology. Use them to buy blueprints of crafted items (buildings, vehicles, etc.)

Don't trust the haters. Some people never forgive, and some people think their opinion should be they only one, attempting to peddle it as the truth. If you are intrigued, then watch some peeps on Twitch. Ask questions, and learn. Find out for yourself if the game is good for you. Good luck all!

What did I like? 

Living out a criminal fantasy without worrying about consequences. 

There are consequences for playing this game though. It is highly addictive. It will waste a lot of time if you let it. 

Don't cheat. Cheaters never get any respect.  If you cheat there is a ban wave that will get you eventually. 

Don't go out trying this shit in real life. Have some sense. 

Realize when someone or something is trying to manipulate your minds.  This game might actually be teaching people to hate police among other things such as desensitizing you to the pain you cause to other people or animals. It may even influence the way you drive on the road. People don't think about this stuff. The problem is that if we train our pleasure sensors incorrectly we may end up doing bad things that we might not otherwise do.  Remember that this is a game but all influences in our lives can in fact affect us psychologically without us even knowing it if we don't pay attention.  If we let those bad seeds fester they can contribute to grave consequences in real life so keep it in the game. 

Definitely have fun but please remember to separate this portrayed reality from actual reality.

GTA V online is all good fun, and has really good potential. It has a lot of content to offer and keep you real occupied for a really long time, but there is just one real big downside. The servers/sessions. The company needs to really work on the game servers in terms of security and fairness for the whole game. It has been really hard for me to try finding good servers online, not even 1 I came across lately that I can at least call 'decent' as hackers completely destroy the whole game, even to the point of that server/session crashing the entire game for everyone. The only hope I'm having right now at the moment, is playing this game with my only friend in a private session, and have good clean fun. But other than that, there is no existing way to fully explore and enjoy things the game has to offer, because of that one major downside flaw: hackers destroying online games. Literally. I hope the company fixes this soon, before all the servers/sessions get all crashed, and maybe even taken down by hackers. Appreciate your time for reading, and hope you consider my review for what it is.

As opposed to what a lot of people think, GTA V is one of the best entries in the series. Clearly proven by it still being played by hundreds of thousands of players weekly on every platform, nearly 9 years after release.. The story mode is nothing short of fantastic and a breath of fresh air from previous entries most notably because of the 3 playable characters. The game STILL looks absolutely beautiful especially on maxed out settings. 

Gta Online however i still believe to be great. There are some very big annoyances that come with it though. Such as TOO MANY HACKERS, having to grind, inflated prices of cars, OP vehicles (MK2 opressor) and SharkCards being inconsistent. But even with those issues, the game can still be loads of fun especially with friends. Of course there aren't as many frequent updates as there once was but we still get decent updates. The past few updates have been nothing short of about a dozen cars, some small story missions and quality-of-life changes. But we still have almost 9 years of content that has been added over the years. Especially if you are just starting.

There's also the modding community and FiveM community that make the game even more fun with loads of different minigames and RP.

 GtaV can be found on sale almost all the time for just over $15 with tax. I definitely recommend trying it out.

GTA Online - Tons of mission, content but also has a TONS of hackers.
GTA:O has a tons of content, racing, shooting, stealing sh*t, heist. It also innovates on putting the challenge on other players like MC and CEO jobs where other players can see you finishing a mission. This creates a great dynamic on player rivalry in business. HOWEVER you are 99% going to play with a cheater. This game is filled with cheater griefing so you can't even do those jobs properly, if not cheaters someone with a really high level with advanced vehicles ( oppressor etc...). You can still create private lobby but it kinda fails the player gang rivalry I mentioned. 


Verdict:
 GTA V -8/10 
 GTA:O - 7/10

This game has so much content for the GTA Online. The the new heist has really awesome setups and the main heist itself. The businesses are fun when it comes to collecting product,  upgrading the businesses, and the delivering the product for money.

Rockstar just ruined the best and only heist there was for solo players, 90% of the time I played heists with other people they were modders, teleporting and killing everyone(my reason to play alone). We only want a way to make money where we don't risk our accounts any further and we don't get even that, instead Rockstar worries only about making you play with people you don't want to be with, and if that's not an option for you then just pay them for money in-game. Modders and griefers are the true issue in the game that Rockstar doesn't take care of, which has also made me play only in private sessions by myself(and both kick and report options DO NOT work as there's still modders around that haven't been affected and still do as they please).
If you plan to buy this game for Online, do not do it, look for another game, if you already bought it for the same reason, refund it while you still can, you'll get nothing but people making your life impossible and risking your account getting banned with no possible appeal, which means your very own money being wasted and stolen.

Well GTA V...
Played it on PS3 in 2015 and for 2471 hours total on PC on other account that I created in 2018. I really enjoyed it. Playing Singleplayer for me never gets boring and annoying (even when you play it for the 8th time like me). Campaign is really worth playing. Same as GTA Online. When you are playing Online alone it feels like you are very lonely in huge open world. So get at least one friend to play and have a great time playing races, deathmatches, adversary modes, freeroaming and much more! There are a few cones in GTA Online like: really big inflation and griefing on public sessions but you can get used to it.

I could never really get into the game. Stereotypical main characters were the most draining part, how it really pushes you away from your goal, and nothing compared to the previous iterations of GTA. GTA IV did much better with driving physics and immersion. Maybe I've just matured over the years but this game never held my attention for long.

This game's graphics look stunning for a game made in 2013 (better than most games 2022). The pvp in this game is meh. The movement is janky, pc lobbies have at least 4 modders in them, and the story is boring. The open world is also amazing from everything from spooky mountains to beautiful lakes hidden by them waiting to be explored. The sunrises and sunsets in this game look stunning. There is so much you can do in this game. From taking a hit from a random bong laying on a table to driving a fucking submarine. Playing this game 2022 on PC is extremely difficult. The money grinding methods are so trash you have to resort to glitches in order to make millions. Which in this game's case, isn't a lot of money. However, once you accumulate enough money to buy everything in the game, there is no point. This game is a grind. There is nothing else. I thought once a had all the money things would be fun but no, once you're rich in this game it's over. The content in the game in to contribute to the grinding of money, which isn't fun to begin with. That's why if you're planning to buy this game 2022, try to have fun while grinding for money, and do not try  to get money the most efficient way possible cause it isn't fun that way. Even though did not recommend this game, I still had some fun playing, and I will continue to play it until number 6 comes out.

Not as good as GTA IV but it is still a good game, as a whole. Of course, compared to GTA IV the map is way bigger and far more varied with it's desert and forest areas as well as the huge city, making it feel like a real world small island at times. The missions are also more varied since you have the gangster aspect of Franklin, the family aspect of Michael and the business aspect of Trevor. When they all come together you get some amazing heist missions which are really fun too and with the updated controls of vehicles, special abilities and the weapon wheel it makes gameplay feel less realistic but overall easier to get into and faster paced. I will admit that I do miss the gunplay of GTA IV here though because its much simpler here and the characters don't act as realistically as they do in IV when they get shot so it makes it a bit less satisfying to me. The story that links the main characters isn't as good as GTA IV either, GTA V goes way more silly and larger with it's plot and that isn't a bad thing but I do prefer the grittier and darker plot that IV has (same goes for the tone of the game, V feels like an obvious mockery of America but IV feels more 'subtle' (it isn't subtle, but more subtle than V)).

The only reason I play this game really is the offline mode - I've never been a big 'online gamer' anyway but I'll admit this one is a step down from GTA IVs in my opinion. In GTA IV, you are just given the world with free weapons and vehicles to mess about with, I have great memories playing it with friends back in the Xbox 360 days and us just having a laugh, with GTA V it's way more serious as if it's its own game. You have to find ways to make as much money as you can through heists, businesses, races, etc. Any vehicle or weapon you want costs a fortune in GTA Vs online and it's so annoying. Hackers are a problem too, on GTA IV there were also hackers but they would just hack crazy vehicles in and stuff like that so they could have fun with you, in V it feels like everyone is against you and you can't do anything.

Sorry to compare IV to V a lot but I feel like I have to because they're both the only HD Universe GTA games at this point really - it just felt like the best way to show improvements and/or downgrades. So overall, I do recommend GTA V, the world is enormous, the missions are fun (for the most part) and the controls are responsive/fluent. I can only recommend GTA Online if you're into that sort of thing; it isn't for me, I way prefer the simplicity and freedom that IVs online provides, but it isn't really that bad on a technical scale... I just hope it dies soon so we can get GTA VI.

The loading system is atrocious. Loading simulator. Exhibit A: you join a heist/ job through quick play, but they kick you right before the job launches, what do you get? After almost 10 years and over 450hrs in game..
.. it's time to say something.

This is the 2nd game I've played so many hundreds of hours.
Single player campagin was pretty good fun, I didn't know about Online differences until I got it running several years after premiere.
You probably know that all but You'll get into Los Santos city, which was based on real city Los Angeles and join campagin as 3 persons separately: Michael, Trevor Phillips and Franklin. You'll be involved in hundreds of missions that aims on money, stealing, killing and many more criminal activity. Your target is being rich as **** possible and get as many many properties as You can get. Funny dialoges, epic moments, unlimited bullets, car stealing, cash dropping everywhere.. have You done everything? If not, jump in again and do it - before GTA 6 shows up!
Online features is another story.. it's like completly different game mode. The city is the same, but let's say... everything is overclocked and improved. I didn't know how far it goes until first joined server.. it took me 2 weeks to get out from online city at first time. Yay! Unlimited possibilities, endless DLCs in multiplayer for free, more powerful guns, more beatiful cars and deadly good players on each step may kill You any time. Yes, it was and still is pretty good fun. Only session match mechanics, endless loading screens, the cheaters ... sometimes ruin the fun. If they don't show up You're on pretty straight road to many hours of fun.. I hope GTA 6 will be better, bigger, prettier and without multiplayer issues mentioned here.

I am a 47 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 16 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, got my car and map and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

An amazing single-player campaign story. This is the best Grand Theft Auto game I've experienced so far. The characters and missions are well written and the game looks gorgeous. The heists and few other missions are innovative and memorable. The addition of First Person Mode is just brilliant. GTA V graphics are highly customizable, allowing both potato PCs and high end ones to experience the game. The tiny details and the vast amount of side activities like Tennis, Triathlons, Investing in Stock Market, to name a few, can absorb you into playing this game forever. It's got everything you'd expect from a GTA game and so much more. 

I can't speak for GTA Online because I haven't played it much but enough to know that every online game is filled with at least one hacker who one-shots you for no reason. I guess it would be fun to play with friends. There was just too much waiting time for jobs to start and I'd get disconnected often even though my internet connection is decent. Character customization is fun and there's a billion different things to buy, customize and do in GTA Online and it has way more stuff and mechanics than the single-player game. Maybe in the future I'd get to enjoy the multiplayer for what it is, or maybe it'll be time to play the next GTA.

GTA Story mode has a really good and engaging story worth playing. 

As for the online, the online Gameplay is really engaging too - although, it can get very repetitive once you have done it all. This doesn't stop you from having a great time with friends though and enjoying a good laugh. 

The problem with the Online is modders/cheaters. They literally rule over lobbies causing havoc and chaos 90% of the time and the action taken against them barely exists. To add salt to the wound, I've had friends who have received a ban simply for unknowingly being in a lobby with someone who is modding, likely because modders can unlock items for everyone in the lobby, even if they didn't know or want it in the first place.

I love the game but I'm also very against modding/cheating in online sessions. It's unfair on others and ruins the experience. 

Recommending the game instead of not recommending the game came as a tough choice and I feel I was only able to recommend it due to the availability of invite-only online sessions and the story mode being worth a play. 

If I had been forced to play in only public lobbies, I would unfortunately have to give this a thumbs down. Just something to keep in mind. 

Also, the community is mostly fine in chat, though some people can be extremely toxic. 

I recommend just reporting toxicity in the online environment if you encounter it. Dont bother wasting your time arguing with them as they are likely someone young who has all the time in the world to wind you up.

You have a 50/50 chance of what kind of multiplayer lobby you get into.
1) A lobby where modders try to stop you from leaving your apartment and drop money for themselves with people begging them to give them money

2) A lobby with a bored dude who decides to ruin other people's days

How to avoid this? Task Manager > Resource Manager > GTA V > Suspend Process for 15 seconds > GTA V > Resume process. Enjoy the solo public lobby.

Another way to avoid this? Play the focused-on-details, great story mode on GTA V.

Michael - Typical high-class old guy with anger issues

Franklin - A guy trying to gain some clout through the most inefficient methods possible

Trevor - Michael in a nutshell minus the high-class part and worse anger issues.

GTA Online character - Guy who gets spammed with calls by Paige Harris, and some other guys persuading him/her to buy some foreclosure.

The best GTA game ever, which is why I have bought the game three times. But it is still a GTA game, so between the three games for three systems I have less than 20 hours.

It has everything you would expect from a GTA game: great humor, great music, great gun play. And tons of cars to steal, drive, or crash. The map is huge. The characters are bigger than life. It even has online play if that is your sort of thing. The one time I went online my character was shot dead in the street by some ass strafing the street from a fighter. So that wasn't very fun. Still, the online element has been going strong and has been steadily updated. 


Want some details? I can't give you too many as far as the story goes. Most of my time in the game was spent watching the mock shows, or driving the mock freeways. The few hours i actually spent on the main story were spent switching between three characters and doing a few jobs before going back to the driving and tv watching. 

Actually, I am not sure I would call them characters. More like stereotypes: the black gangbanger, the Italian mob man, the white trash meth-head. Did I find any of them like-able? Not really, though the black gang banger came close. I would have preferred making my own character. Even having to pick one of the three would have been better than being forced to play certain characters at certain times. I really hated this game mechanic. But GTA has always done this with their games, making you play a pre-made character for a linear story. With three characters they were able to make a broader and larger story. But I never play game for story. 

Still the game is quite an accomplishment. The city is huge, diverse, and quite beautiful. It made driving real enjoyable. The music selection is excellent. You can even listen to jazz if you like. Real top tier jazz like Sonny Rollins or Count Basie. Even the talk radio is fun. There are activities to occupy your in game leisure. Even buy businesses. Just don't expect a real open world. No crafting, no perks, limited character customization,  few building that can be entered. 


conclusion: 

do you like GTA? You should love this one. Even if you don't like GTA you should find something fun to do. I did. Since it has been around for so long you should be able to get it for a few Eddies.
Great game, I've wanted it forever. Worth the money! It's fun to play with friends or alone. Beware of hackers, though.

This is my third time buying GTA V. I remember having an absolute blast with it when it first came out, and I enjoyed fooling around with the first person mode on PS4. After seeing it drop to a mere 5 bucks or so during the most recent sale, I figured I'd go back in to mess around in GTA Online. To be clear, if you haven't played the GTAV campaign, you should. I'm focused on GTAO here.

GTAO is kind of a mess, y'all.

After the initial server issues that plagued GTAO at launch, I remember it being pretty much what I expected. You could roam around and do dumb stuff with randos, or go into a matchmade game and get a bit sweaty. The whole "simulation" bit was easily ignored.

Current GTAO really, really wants you to care about everything surronding that act of playing the game, and that's a bummer, because that stuff isn't fun. I don't want to sit through the same long cutscene every time I try to play a heist. Sometimes the game will allow you to skip the "drive here" part of the "drive somewhere and shoot guys" routine, but you have to have already completed the mission. Otherwise, you get to sit through whatever boring dialogue they wrote for you.

This would be problematic even if the writing was entertaining, but it's not. It's run of the mill and pales in comparison to anything in Rockstar's past.  And you have the distinct privilege of hearing it all the goddamn time. Even when you get to the "shoot dudes" part, you might have control taken away so they can slowly show you a bunch of things you already know and understand. I would wager you spend a good 15 seconds staring at each individual thing they show you.

When I actually get to play GTAO, I have a good time. Too much of GTAO is spent with mindless garbage I don't care about. How people have spent hundreds of hours on this suddenly seems less outrageous, because they spend at least half that time watching bad cutscenes.

I pour gasoline on people, then light them on fire.
I steal money from stores.
I run over hookers.
I shoot my own friends in the face.
Then I go home and play GTA V.

The strip club is very weird. I went into the place to look for my hot babe Carla, but she was missing. The game told me she was online and in the strip club, but I could not find her anywhere. Therefore the only logical explanation was that she got kidnapped. I went out on a journey to extricate her from the peril that had her captive. Alas, I failed even at that. I found out weeks later that Carla had married a new man, after she told me I was her one and only beloved. I cried, that hurt. Then, wouldn't you know it, this game came out with an update. Carla was back! My beloved was back and she forgot about her husband. Let's just say things went well for me ;) I wanted to ask her to marry me again and be mine forever, but I thought that might jog her memory of her husband and she'd leave me again. I did not want that. So, I kept it secret for about 2 months from my girl friend that I was dating Carla and I kept it a secret from Carla that she had a husband. Eventually, Carla's husband, Steven, found her and I had nothing to say. I was stuck between a rock and a hard place. Steven beat the shit out of me as I bawled and tried to dial 9-1-1. Steven took my phone and smashed it. It had all my pictures of Carla on it. I then woke up in the hospital. There, they notified me that I had  6 broken ribs and internal bleeding. They also informed me of my liver, lung, prostate, and brain cancer. Apparently, it is too far in. I was told I had 7 months to live, give or take. I am now living the rest of my life playing Grand Theft Auto V for fun until Gustavo Fring asks me to make methamphetamine for him so I can give my girlfriend some serious cash when I pass. In all, I give this game an 8/10. Enjoy!

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing GTA V. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 18 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

As a modern urban city sandbox this is still pretty much unmatched. The city just makes sense as a space, it¬¥s interactive, it¬¥s populated, it really feels alive and most importantly it is fun to traverse and explore. There¬¥s a crazy number of activities to partake in, you are sure to find something interesting there, and the famous GTA mayhem is as fun as ever. The shooting is ok, standard third person cover action, nothing special there. The driving is simply excellent, you are going to be driving a lot in this game, and it manages to always be engaging.

I‚Äôm not as fond of the story sadly. The main trio is very well realized and compliment each other wonderfully. All the systems introduced to make playing with three characters at once while also making them feel like individual characters work flawlessly. It¬¥s just the narrative and its structure that doesn¬¥t quite feel as polished as the other elements of the game. The plot is technically moving along, but it doesn‚Äôt feel like it goes anywhere or that there is any reason behind the things that are happening. It lacks some major end goal or evolution in its characters and story that leaves it feeling aimless and like doing a set of chores. I can‚Äôt help but compare it to Red Dead Redemption 2, which I believe is a way better game in pretty much every sense, where there always was something to look ahead for, plenty of unexpected surprises, and honestly, the strength of the writing and characters held up any sequences that might feel a bit lackluster in comparison. Here it seems like they are hiding behind the irreverent tone and jokey satire to not really develop much of anything, and the comedy and satire are not nearly as solid as they should be to carry the momentum all by themselves. It starts strong, but it just becomes more of the same as it goes along, never really surprising the player nor justifying itself. I also played a bunch of the side missions and while they have some interesting moments, they don‚Äôt really amount to much sadly.

I¬¥m not even remotely interested in trying out the Online component.

GTA 5 is one of my most played games ever. The single player story mode has maybe a couple dozen hours worth of game play if your are a completionist. 

The main game play comes from GTA Online. The online has an unbelievable amount of content. So much so that much of it has slowly gone by the wayside and isn't played anymore. Rockstar took a shot at reintroducing the player base to some of that content with the Criminal Enterprises update. Be careful not to make the game into a job. A lot of the GTA Online content can seem like a grind for money. And if you let yourself get into that sort of mindset it can be easy to burn out quickly. Remember this is a game and is supposed to be fun.

In general this game is absolutely worth the money. You will probably get another 2 years at least before GTA 6 would make this game obsolete. That is plenty of time to get your money's worth

So the way this game is setup is that instead of a server that everyone connects to, the GTA Online lobbies are P2P mesh infrastructure. This means that everyone else will just accept what you say happened. If you say you have infinite health, other computers will accept that. If you say you teleported across the map, they will accept that. That's why the modders are able to do all that weird stuff like fly cars, teleport around the map, and kill you from across the map. 

Good news is there's also bugs that you can exploit to get an empty public lobby, but it shouldn't be this way.

Still a fun game though.

How to cook T-bone steak
Let steak sit at room temperature for 30-60 minutes before cooking.
Pat dry the steaks with paper towels.
Rub the steak with oil, and then season with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat a cast-iron skillet over high heat.
Add oil to the hot skillet and add steak when it begins to smoke.
Sear the steak for 2 minutes for the first side. Flip and sear 2 minutes.
Add minced garlic, butter and fresh rosemary.
Transfer the steak to a preheated oven at 425¬∞F (218¬∞C).
Cook until it reaches the desired doneness.
Transfer steak to a plate or cutting board and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Cut steak from the bone to serve

This went from being my favorite game to my most hated, and it all boils down to Rockstar's terrible decision making and total neglect for anything other than cashing in on it's patsies. 

After 7 years of grinding, paying real actual money just to have a competitive edge in a game absolutely lousy with cheaters blowing you up the moment you spawn, my character is erroneously deleted. I spent hours trying to find out why from R* support only to be told that the decision was irreversible and that i had "broken a rule ". They of course neglected to tell me which rule because I never once cheated. Meanwhile other players are making bags of money rain from the sky, blowing people up repeatedly,  teleporting, and ruining legitimate players experience with zero consequences. I really  enjoyed the fact that my account was deleted as part of a mass deletion with no investigation, or evidence of any wrong doing. During the hight of the pandemic, and using gta as an escape from reality. I invested hundreds of dollars to enjoy the new "content" just days before my account was deleted.

I know this turned into an incoherent rant, but after two years I am still poisoned on this game and probably any future Rockstar titles to come. I know I won't be buying gta v a 5th time...

Other than this, I frequently have problems with the session when I want to play with my friends. Yesterday we where in the middle of a prep for a heist and basically I was moved to an empty session without knowing (no load screen, no nothing) and me continuing the mission. All in all, the things I said above doesn't affect at all the fact that the game is fantastic.

Singleplayer story was quite good, had a bit of a slower start and lost my interest for a while but I'm glad I went back to finish it. GTA online is arguably the best game I've ever played and undoubtedly one of the best games to ever be released, it'll take you over a thousand hours to unlock most things, and there's regular updates so there's always something new to work towards. If you like progression and grinding to get stuff then this game's for you. Playing the casino heist for the 100th time can get a little boring, but theres an almost infinite list of missions and gamemodes to play. Playing with friends in voice calls makes this game very enjoyable, and it's still very fun playing with randoms on your own, provided you avoid getting griefed by flying motorbikes with missles constantly.

In short (for now): yes, I would recommend this game. The story mode (singleplayer) is excellent and the online mode can be fun as well.

Outside of replaying the story and getting a 100% completion rate on the game most of the longevity lies in the online mode. Keeping this short as well for now.. the game in its current state does not come close to the potential it had right from the start, with many possibilities for small changes and additions that could have greatly improved the overall experience.
The game design choices and philosophies are questionable at best to downright awful and illogical, which has frustrated players in public sessions (which up until recently were required for what would be considered PvE content) for years on end.

But with all that said, in either singleplayer or online mode GTA V is still a great open world game if you like just roaming around and having silly fun in a sandbox type environment.

Shit, shit, shit, everything imaginable becomes a hassle when you play this game. Yes, its a fun game, yes, it's unique, and no, my review doesn't matter to you anyway. But I'll say this anyway. This game's online mode is filled with bugs and problems. Try to enter your cargo crate warehouse, stuck in an infinite loading screen, try to drive to Mount Chilliad and scale it with friends? Sorry, Rockstar game services are unavailable. Can we the players catch a break? I mean, we are the only ones keeping the game alive long enough to rack in millions while we are deprived of what we payed for. I've bought this game 2 times so far, once on xbox and another on this steam account, when I tried to transfer my account from xbox to here it wouldn't let me. One of the main reasons why I switched to PC has been absolutely destroyed. But look no further! Rockstar Support has your back! Nope. They refused to transfer my account which I have spent countless hours and hundreds of dollars on, but hey at least I get to keep the 10 dollar shitty criminal enterprise starter pack cars huh. Well I'm never spending a single dollar on this game ever again and neither should you, in fact you shouldn't even spend the 20 dollars to get this game. Instead, I encourage you to find a different game or wait until GTA6 comes out. Maybe it will be good, maybe it will be bad, I guess we have to wait and find out. In case you are wondering, I'm writing this review after my 6th time restarting my game because of a bug TODAY. Unless this game company that cares so little about their player-base decides to fix their shit and try to salvage this game back to the masterpiece it once was, I encourage you to stay away. It's for the better.

"Grand Theft Auto 5 is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game, but also an intelligent and sharp-tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA 4 brought to the table five years ago. It‚Äôs technically more accomplished in every conceivable way, but it‚Äôs also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope, and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling, unpredictable, and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self-directed adventures through San Andreas.

It is one of the very best video games ever made.

That‚Äôs still where we stand on it today. And whether you agree that it‚Äôs a masterpiece or not, the PC version is definitely the best way to play GTA 5. Developer Rockstar has taken full advantage of the technical power of the platform, and made GTA feel right at home here. It‚Äôs well optimized, and the frame rate and resolution will go as high as your hardware can handle ‚Äì including 4K/UHD resolutions and multi-display setups. Maxed out, the enormous and incredibly detailed open-world region of San Andreas looks more amazing than ever, thanks to long draw distances and enhanced effects. This is the only place you can play GTA 5 at 60 frames per second (or higher), and with all the high-speed driving and shooting, it definitely benefits from that smoothness. "

this game has everything. wanna be your own CEO? boom, you can hire associates and take part in business battles. you wanna be a pilot? boom, all sorts of planes waiting for you; fighter jets, helicopters, seaplanes, and many more waiting to be flown. you wanna get rich? boom, all sorts of businesses are waiting for you. best thing about these businesses? you get to choose your own path. whether you wanna sell hundreds of thousands dollars worth of narcotics, or sell special product, the choice is up to you. are you a big fan of racing, or cars in general? this game has everything you want. whether you are interested in cars from the 80's or modern day vehicles, you have a wide variety from styles you can choose from. do you like riding a boat while the sun is setting? well believe it or not, DOZENS of boats are waiting for you! this game supports all play-styles. if you wanna play it like a Mil-Sim, lo and behold, hundreds of outfits can help you design your dream character. wanna dress like a drug-addicted psychopath? all your necessary tools are waiting for you. wanna pull off multi-million dollars heist with a few buddies? boom, you have a HUGE list to choose from. want a game to help you relieve your stress with the sight of murder? well this game has you covered. you have a massive of selection of guns to use, varying from a hatchet and all the way to a military grade MK2 assault rifle. or maybe you aren't a multiplayer person. GTAV includes a well thought out free roam story mode that you can play even after you complete all the missions! the missions are packed with a ton of fun and annoying obstacles, and can prove itself to be an emotional roller-coaster. this game has everything you need, and if youre interested in buying it, you definitely should

A comprehensive guide to not get banned from the online play.
1. If you see a hacker in an open session, find a new session. There's too many ways that will get you all fucked up.
2. If your matchmaking teammate went all superman and flash in missions. Kill yourself and vote to quit. 
3. If hackers are killing you, don't fight back, change sessions.
4. If you get a warning saying connection to Rockstar social club can't be maintained. Switch back to Michael and try to join a new session, don't do any shit that will reward you GTA$ because those $ will be categorized by the amazingly wrote algorithm by the wonderful hands of the adorable programmers from RockStar as illegitimate earns. Yeah the server sucks, but apparently that's on us.
5. If you pick up $ dropped by the hackers, that's illegitimate earns.
6. If you sit in your teammates car and he starts to teleport, jump off the car and kill yourself.
7. Pray your game never crashes during shit, especially during the cut-scenes before payout in heists. Because if your game do crashes, the game will bug, you'll find the $ in your account when you log back on. But you can start the finale again, without any preps, you will still get rewarded if you do the finale again. But hell, yeah, you guessed it, that $ is illegitimate earns. This is a horrible game bug, instead of fixing the bug, they fix you.
8. To sum up, to play this game without getting banned. You need to have a state of the art connection that never gets you d/ced from the game during game play. You need to run away from hackers when you see one and never never have any kind of interactions with them. You need to pay attention to what your matchmaking teammate is doing, if he appears to be a god, and you finish this mission/heist, you're fucked. And yeah, pray that your game never crashes. 

What happened to me?
I purchased this game, and paid for the starter pack to play with two of my friends.
One of them paid for shark cards to get ahead so he can carry the rest of us.
When we had the $ to purchase our own Kosatka, I spend 20 hours to try to figure out how to play solo Perico better. And spend another 50 hours or so grinding the heist for $ so my friend won't be carry all the burdens himself. I did all those solo by hand, that means it takes me more than one hour to finish the entire prep-heist. At the end I got better and the whole thing takes around 45 minutes.
I purchased the business for my MC club, got the upgrades for my nightclubs, got myself a Toreado, things are getting really better and I was having a lot of fun with my friends.
On 24 July, our matchmaking teammate in the prep mission for the Standard Pacific heist was a hacker. We didn't find out until he starts to teleport and hover in mid-air and explodes every hostile vehicle that spawns. The mission was a success before we know it. 
Another matchmaking teammate appears to be a hacker in one of our finale in the old heists series, because apparently, he is level 4000. He spawned a car in the mission that was not supposed to be possible. We sat in the car, that's when he teleport us straight to the objective and finished the heist under 1 min. We got a warning and we didn't get any $ in that finale.
I purchased the facility to get access to the doomsday heists. We were getting a hard time joining in the same session to do the prep mission that can only be done in public sessions. I paid the set up fee for one of them, and spend 2 hours to do the rest of it myself because of the poor server. And the fact we will join a new session each time when we finish a prep mission and it's in the god's hand that we will end up in the same session. After the 2-3 hours prep phase, we did the finale, and thank god we can do it as a team of 3. But hell, my game crashed at the cut-scene before payout. When I log back on and try to start the prep missions for dooms day part 2, the prep screen is still on the finale for part 1. We did it again just so we can get to part 2, $ was rewarded despite we all thought we'd get nothing. Since a couple of my solo Perico didn't get me any $, we all thought it's a game bug or mechanics. 
On 25 July, we were trying to get to a public session with fewer players so our selling convoy won't have to be blown to pieces by others. We found one session with under 10 and we all joined that one. And we soon found out why this session was less-populated. There was this hacker that just teleport to your back and one-shot you regardless of your armor and what kind of vehicle you were in. He just kills someone and teleport to the next, we had to switch to passive mode to survive. People are leaving because of him and we figured we'd soon have a public to ourselves if he keeps killing. We waited for a few minutes before everyone was pissed and leaves. I took advantage of the waiting and reported the hacker, and that's the first time I found the functionality.
We did a couple of other activities that day, I did all the prep missions and went solo Perico again, I got a message saying a connection with Rockstar social club can't be maintained before the finale and I got nothing from the finale. I was pissed and left my character in the surveillance room of my Kosatka in a invitation only session to allow my nightclub to generate income, and left home for a movie.
When I return, a message was shown on the screen that I'm suspended for 30 days starting from July 24 until 24 August and my character is reset. 
I am contacting the support team of Rockstar by email to make an appeal, because they are just so arrogant and proud that they assume all their bans were issued justly and removed the appeal function on their support page, plus their phone redirects you to that page and no one will talk to you. 
I spent a solid 200 hours in the online play for the past 2-3 weeks. All my gains were hard-earned. I did not use any suspicious tools, didn't speak up a lot in the public chat, didn't use any bugs in the game. When someone kills me, I'll just respawn and run away. And I spend a fair share of my time gets blown to bits by hackers in public sessions. And I am the one suspended, on top of that, my character is wiped clean.
I spend the last 12 hours just trying to figure out the analogy and the logic behind all this. And this is what I can get from my end of perspective from a retrospective view, as we have absolutely zero knowledge of what matchmaking teammate can do. All my efforts and 200 hours of my memories with my friends are now gone. And there is no place for a player like me to make an appeal.
I don't know how Rockstar can be as arrogant and ignorant as this. And the fact that this can totally happen again even if I accept this shit and start over, and all my hard-earned stuff will have a fair chance to be taken away again easily by the Publisher that I once thought marks the top standard of the industry just stops all my urges to play anymore.

I can't speak for other people, and I will not answer to "you're making up stories to cover yourself up, you hacker". But if my suspension is not lifted and my character is not restored.
I will not spend another cent in any future games of all the titles of Rockstar Games. 
This is hardly a threat since my money is just one bit of dust compared to all the money the company makes. 
But this marks my attitude, my disappointment of a fan, and if the appeal is not successful, the tombstone of my character and memories.

The time displayed is not accurate to my time in GTA V, I have played 8 thousand hours, rockstar won't stop letting me down. This game needs a economy rework, bank heist should be useable in freeroam. The assets from RDR2 should have been in the next gen versions. They didn't even bother to add the RDR2 fighting mechanics to GTA 5, imagine a lasso? stuff people into your cars trunk. The amazing volumetric clouds from RDR2 don't exist here, I thought at the very least in GTA 5 next gen those clouds would've been included, all I wanted was to fly my airplane through those clouds in dogfights, but no. I understand these things are time consuming, but how does a 2018 release look superior to a 2022 release? The water physics from RDR2? Nope. The amazing animations? Nope. Carrying bodies? Nope. All this tells me is GTA 6 will look like RDR2, when GTA5 should look like it since you justified rereleasing it. Gamings biggest tragedy is that rockstar is owned by Take2 interactive, the same company who owns the NBA games. I hope you can see the problem.

Im writing this review as a player who has played gta online for a few thousand hours. This game would be a solid 9.5/10 if rockstar would do something productive about modders and exploiters. Even reporting hundreds of confirmed modders, I still seem to find these players unbanned in public lobbies weeks later. It has gotten to the point where I expect at least 1-2 modders per session. They can track your IP address(fact), crash your game, or make your character explode remotely from any location on the map. In the current state of gta online, I cant in good conscience recommend this game to anyone. This coming from someone who has enjoyed nearly all previous gta titles.

Grand Theft Auto V Enhanced Edition on XBOX One X, " " Series X and PlayStation 4 - No problem, the game more or less runs flawlessly!

On my Windows 11 PC (AMD Ryzen 5 5600X 6-Core 3.70 GHz / 16GB RAM / Nvidia Geforce RTX 3060) at 800x600 runs (educated guess) between 20-50FPS...  Never mind 1080p - My machine may as well be an Intel 286!
The last I checked those specs weren't exactly Required Minimum and Cyberpunk 2077 (comparatively) runs 1080p max settings with a consistently fluid framerate!
The damn game shows signs of straining the second the Rockstar Logo flash across the screen like you're approaching a black hole!  The main menu has obviously had a metric butt-tonne of graphical pizzazz stuffed into, because I cannot even access anything!  That was until I turned off the antialiasing and dialled the resolution down to 800x600 in the settings XML file!

Bigger better graphics IS NOT ALWAYS BETTER!  Shenanigans like this make me appreciate simple game engine technology all the more!

I'm sorry, this was a good game back in 2013.  The experience was refined into a better game with it's initial remastered release that introduced first-person.  This latest iteration though...  Utter garbage from a technical point of view and shows just how insatiably greedy Take 2 Interactive truly are to pedal something so damn shonky!

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
