‚†Ñ‚†Ñ‚†Ñ
Fortnite Battle Royale sets itself apart by trading the traditional, bland military simulation vibe with vivid colors and an outstanding, freeform building system that‚Äôs unlike anything else in competitive multiplayer games.As its name suggests, Fortnite Battle Royale fits so neatly into the battle royale genre that blew up last year that the basic description sounds as standard as you can get: Up to 100 players are dropped onto a large but constantly shrinking map with the goal of gathering weapons and gear to become the last person or team left standing. But if you look just a little closer, it can‚Äôt be mistaken for any other game because the vehicle you‚Äôre skydiving out of is, inexplicably, a flying party bus ‚Äì a nice change of pace from a drab military plane ‚Äì and the place you land is a giant, beautifully colorful island, instead of a realistic landscape, surrounded by a violent storm.
Thankfully, unlike other battle royale games, like PlayerUnknown‚Äôs Battlegrounds, where an unlucky circle could leave getting out of the encroaching circle almost impossible, Fortnite‚Äôs map is at least small enough (relative to PUBG‚Äôs) that even if you have to run across the entire island to get to the safety of the randomly centered eye of the storm you run very little risk of being killed by the collapsing border.
On the island are several large and totally unique cities, each with their own style of structures ‚Äî a quaint suburb of houses, a giant office district filled with skyscrapers, or a retail area with an outdoor mall. Each city is full of vibrant colors, and the map as a whole has hundreds of buildings with randomly spawning loot in the form of guns, explosives, and healing items.
Wait, Which Fortnite Is This? Developed by Epic Games, Fortnite was originally conceived as a third-person, co-op, survival game where teams of players could mine resources and build structures to hold off hordes of undead enemies. That version, now a standalone game called Fortnite
Fortnite Battle Royale‚Äôs inventory management is, thankfully, simple by design. You get just five slots, so you‚Äôre forced to balance your arsenal of guns with your need for healing or explosives to deal with enemy structures. It‚Äôs a neat limiting factor that forced me to keep a mental shopping list of exactly what I was on the lookout for as I ran across the island, and to resist the urge to pick up anything else. With such specific needs in mind, every chest came with the thrill of hoping it would reveal the weapons I wanted most. Fortnite gives you plenty of ways to mix and match weapons, so even if that chest doesn‚Äôt come up with the exact item you want, you‚Äôll never feel powerless in a fight.
Once you do find the weapons you‚Äôre looking for, most fights in Fortnite go about the same way: You start with one shot from a slow-firing heavy weapon like a sniper rifle or pump shotgun in hopes of ending the fight before it really started, then (if needed) switch over to a faster assault rifle or tactical shotgun to carry out the rest of the battle. While it‚Äôs far from the only way to play, this combination seems to be the preferred method for almost every player and provides the foundation of almost every fight in Fortnite.
It‚Äôs a chaotic and fun system that makes fights a little more complicated.
It‚Äôs a lightning-fast system where fights can end in the blink of an eye with just one slight miss. This makes for a stark contrast from other battle royale games like PlayerUnknown‚Äôs Battlegrounds, which is filled with long, tense standoffs where sustained accuracy often matters more than a single well placed shot. It‚Äôs a chaotic and fun system that makes fights a little more complicated than simply aiming at your opponent and firing, but after a few hours with Fortnite I started to get the shoot-and-switch rhythm down and fights started to become almost automatic.
It‚Äôs the stuff around the shooting that helps Fortnite differentiate itself from every other battle royale game and shows off what truly makes it special: The building.
Carrying over the building system from Save the World is a brilliant choice that sets Battle Royale apart not just from other battle royale games, but most competitive multiplayer games in general. Just about everything that isn‚Äôt the ground can be mined for wood, stone, or steel, which can be used to create walls, stairs, and floors anywhere on the map (so long as some part of the structure touches the ground). It‚Äôs a massive system with so many possibilities that, at first blush, it can be daunting to try to figure out how to build the massive structures that others around you have created. But that‚Äôs one of the best things about Fortnite: It always keeps things simple.
That‚Äôs one of the best things about Fortnite: It always keeps things simple.
With just three primary tiles ‚Äì floors, walls, and stairs ‚Äì the building toolset may seem limited, but it‚Äôs got everything you really need. Whether it was building a staircase up to that hard-to-reach loot chest or quickly laying down an impromptu piece of cover to protect from an attacking enemy, I found I always had the tools I needed for the job at hand, and I could swap to the piece I needed without missing a beat. In fact, that swapping is so easy that one of my favorite moves is placing one platform and jumping off of it, then switch to another type in mid-air and place it before I land. That trick allows you to scale vertical walls or go straight up a mountain. While this may sound like an impressive feat of dexterity, Fortnite makes it so simple that almost anyone can pull it off ‚Äì and they do, making it one of the most common tricks to getting around the island.
The first time I really understood how Fortnite‚Äôs building and shooting played into one another came in the middle of a fight in Retail Row, one of the map‚Äôs many cities. Another player and I were sheepishly taking shots at one another from behind single walls we had built. After I ran out of ammo in my assault rifle, I was forced to turn to my shotgun ‚Äì a weapon I had largely disregarded up until this point. With the few resources I had left, I built stairs over my opponent‚Äôs wall, jumped off, flipped around, and shotgunned him. Looking back, it was as routine a play as it gets, but it was an absolute revelation for me at the time. Suddenly, everything made sense, and I realized that Fortnite Battle Royale is more about building than it is about shooting.
While the little things you can use it for may seem obvious ‚Äì like building stairs to get to the roof of a building, or making a wall to block an enemy‚Äôs shots ‚Äì the system also gives you room to think outside the box. You could build around a downed teammate that you can‚Äôt help yet, or create a decoy fort to lure enemies into an ambush while you wait behind a tree. The system even provides some elegant solutions to getting caught outside the trademark random circles of the battle royale genre: If you find yourself on the wrong side of a lake or chasm, no problem ‚Äì just make your own bridge to the other side.
One player lured me into his elaborate fortress of hallways in hopes of forcing me toward his waiting shotgun at the end of the maze.
Thanks to the building system‚Äôs simple but robust design, you can throw structures together in a way that suits your style. While some people love high towers that stretch into the sky, I like to keep things at a lower altitude, giving me more room to bounce between my platforms and the ground. One player I faced lured me into his elaborate fortress of hallways, with doors that led to nothing, all in hopes of forcing me toward his waiting shotgun at the end of the maze.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing

Lots to do, fun to play with friends. I don't recommend playing online on a public server, though, as the other comments mention, people will harass you just for the "fun" of it. It's honestly ridiculous at how many modders/cheaters there are and how they can just grief you. They can spam explosions on you, spawn on you, be invincible so they can just keep killing you. There's no escaping them without just leaving the session. A real shame honestly, as there are some features of online that can only be accessed in public servers (which I wish would be changed because I hate playing with other people online, especially in this game with such annoying, toxic players). All that being said, was it worth it? Yes, but I would only purchase it at a discount.

This is a game that I've been interested in since it originally came out in 2013 but I never thought I'd be able to play the game that well. However, nearly ten years later, I stated playing GTA V's story mode and it blew my MIND! It is clear that Rockstar put a lot of time and effort into its development of this game. The graphics are incredible and still stand up to the graphics of some of the games released within the last few years. I've truly enjoyed playing this game with my loved ones and I can't wait for GTA VI to be released!!

This company, and this god awful game will just keep punishing you, for even attempting to play it anymore.  They have added so many annoying little things to the game to try and force players to get frustrated and buy a shark card, so much to the point that it isn't even enjoyable in any aspect.  Want to drive one of your cars?  Npcs will purposely wreck you, stop in front of you, hell even just spawn right in front of you.  Want to do your jobs/businesses? Rockstar has added homing missiles to most of the vehicles, so have fun trying that....chances are you barely won't even be able to walk around or spawn a car with this griefing happening constantly.  Want to have some good ole pvp fun?  Good luck, 75% of the people still playing this will have a mod with god mode on, or just hit you with so many mods you have to close your game because it becomes unplayable.  If you waited until this long to play GTA V, just save your money and play something else, because these days, it isn't worth the frustration you have to put up with just to have and even slightly enjoyable experience.  The developers have added too much nuisance programming to the game, that you can barely have fun just messing around anymore.

Game is full of people who grief and mod

This game saved my life

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

For whatever reason, being a big fan of the four previous entries, I had never played GTA V until now. After seeing it was leaving Game Pass soon, I decided to dive into it and hope I would be able to at least finish the main story. 38 hours later, I can honestly say this was definitely one of the best games I‚Äôve played over the last decade. It‚Äôs not to say GTA V doesn‚Äôt have its issues - the main ones being, in typical Rockstar fashion, an overly limiting mission structure and a clunky control and movement design that is especially frustrating when indoors and handling vehicles. But this is a case where the positives far outweigh the negatives to deliver an awesome overall gaming experience. Even though the story suffers from some continuity problems and even a lack of logic here and there, it was actually a lot more interesting than I thought it would be. The aggressiveness in tone and themes was one of the most prevalent traits in previous GTA titles, and it‚Äôs great to see it refined here, even if it‚Äôs done in a more over the top, caricatural way. Being able to jump between three very different characters, all with their particular personalities, strengths, storylines and business opportunities to explore, was in my opinion the best new addition to the franchise considering the depth it offers. And of course, the game‚Äôs strongest point: the world. The setting GTA V was able to create is nothing short of wonderful. There‚Äôs so much to do, so much to see, so much variety in terms of scenery, interactions, side quests, investments and mindless activities, that I can see anyone easily sinking 100+ hours into it without feeling a bit of boredom. This may not be not my favourite GTA in terms of atmosphere, but it‚Äôs certainly the one with the most accomplished world, and I now get why it serves as the blueprint for the formula that so many of the open world games that came after tried to capture.

I‚Äôm sure nothing I‚Äôve said here is new, but I still wanted to share my thoughts for the few people out there who haven‚Äôt tried this game yet and are wondering if it‚Äôs still worth it in 2021. To my mind, it 100% is. Even factoring in its flaws, GTA V is a fantastic game and a fully realised satire of modern day crime, fun, consumerism, routines and stereotypes, in a world that feels connected and constantly engaging. A straight A, 5/5 experience in my book.

EDIT: Honestly didn't realise this game had become so divisive over the years, but I can understand why. Perhaps it's because a) I have zero experience with GTA online (I don't do multiplayer), and b) I played both SA and GTA 4 when they came out, so it's a long time for me to draw full comparisons between 5 and those earlier games even though I remember liking both of those more. Also, to be clear: even though it suffers from some of the same issues, RDR2 is IMO a much better game than GTA V in almost every single way, no doubt in my mind about that whatsoever.

This review is for GTA V Online, not the singleplayer GTA V. GTA V's singleplayer is great for what it is but most people buying this game in 2022 will be purchasing it for the online experience.

GTA V Online has such an amazing groundwork. A beautiful map, tons of content, and a plethora of things to do.

All of the above features are thrown out the window by the amount of modders and cheaters in the game. While many people would argue that there aren't that many of them or that they don't affect the experience, both of these statements are just untrue. From my experience, almost every public lobby has at least 1-2 modders in it. These "modders" and the amount they can do outside the game's boundaries is absolutely unacceptable.

They can spawn unobtainable vehicles, become invincible, fly, explode the entire map, teleport, become NPCs such as animals, lock you into a cage, crash your game instantly, and many other things. If this wasn't enough, they can violate your privacy. They can force you to type things into chat and even SEE YOUR IP ADDRESS. Having a VPN does not help this.
Your first thought would be to report these people to Rockstar, correct? Well. Modders get alerts when you send a report through the game, which allows them to delete them before they even reach Rockstar. That's right. You can't even report these cheaters which can be an actual threat to your game experience, your Rockstar account, and your real-world well being.

On top of all this, Rockstar as a company is just completely awful. They have taken most customer support down for the game, so most email reports will not work to get any cheaters banned even with video proof. However, they do have ban waves in which they ban accounts of suspected cheaters every month or so. Hilariously, my account was falsely banned for 30 days and my entire character reset. All of the 95.4 hours you see at the time of writing this review was erased for existing in a lobby with a modder, something out of my control and completely without my consent. I had never received a warning nor committed any offense on my GTA or Social Club account before this.

The single player experience is decent: the story is engaging, the missions are sometimes uninspired but pretty much always fun, thanks to the passable gun and vehicle handling which sits somewhere squarely in the middle of realism and arcade. 

The online experience is cancerous, if not downright unplayable however. Hackers run rampant and unpoliced, and the overall culture of the playerbase even among those who play fairly is extremely toxic and utterly incompatible with getting any enjoyment out of the online missions the game has to offer. 
What's more, there is no reliable way to play the online content without these hooligans. Even the option to enter a "crew only" session (a session of only yourself and those you invite) heavily restricts the content you can do online to the point of making me wonder why it even exists. 

Play the single player if the game goes on a huge sale. Hard pass on the online content, unfortunately.

GTA single experience: It is normal fare and the progression to it is to be expected from past generations.

However the biggest gripe is the lack of money consistently being doled out.  There are only a few missions that dole out money.

There is that one "bug" with the underwater suitcases of money that Rockstar placed in there to see if people will exploit and almost everyone did -- obviously because the majority of players were given scarcity proposition so most were hesitant to spend any money throughout the campaign.

GTA Online: It is for the grinder and for those that have friends to mess around with. I would recommend to have an invite only sessions.

For those that go into the public sessions, GTA:O becomes a test of patience and resolve for the new players. Some of the practices are "realistic" but they quickly lead into some toxic behaviors which will attract mostly an aggressive player base.  Passive grinders be wary of the other players and learn how to read the atmosphere of the lobby that you are in before doing any high paying sell missions.

If you meet godmode cheaters and modders out for griefing, only recourse is to leave for a new online session and hope some more.

Currency is still an issue that makes GTA Online play like a gacha game -- forced to spend money on the shark cards.  What's worse is that the shark cards were not adjusted for the inflation of the in-game items so R* could get more out of their whale players.

If you heard of GTA Online Plus, it is just a slap on the face with the pittance of benefits that it offers. It's plain anticonsumer.

If you abuse any of the glitches and make millions at the hour, R* will ban you easily but the godmode KD warriors and modders are easy to find.  Every day you will find a handful mucking around, just be glad if they aren't messing with you.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Hello everyone this is my first time giving a game a long review.

For me personally Grand Theft Auto V has been game I have been playing for years across multiple different platforms and having fun on all of them. I first started playing this back on the Playstation 3 and then went to the Playstation 4 and now to PC. In total I probably have around 5-8k hours in the game across all of the platforms. In all of those hours I have had a lot of time to get opinions about the game in multiple different ways regarding Story mode and Online, I am going to start with online.

[b] Online [/b]
I started playing the online part of GTA in around 2016 and that's when it all started and I fell in love with the game. Playing hundreds apon hundreds of races to get cars and whatever else I wanted to get that looked like something I wanted, along with the many different exploits that were in the game that made the game fun. Moving on to the PS4 and PC where I have a lot of my time in the game which I am around level 200 on PS4 and around 270 on PC. Primarily doing heists and just relaxing playing with my friends in lobbies and having a great time, Playing the game with friends is so much fun and rather then playing the game with randoms you don't know, because having friends is helpful in many ways for example doing missions in lobbies, doing heists where you should all be in communication and being able to plan your moves and what not.

[b] Story mode [/b]
This will be my review about how how it has affected me and now how the story is, In the PS3 when it was fresh and new I had a lot of fun playing it and having a lot of fun working my way through the story and all of the heists. When I got to the PS4 I completed it again but never really touched it because its the same story. Finally moving on to PC I like story mode again because I am able to use mods and have fun in the game in ways that isn't possible on consoles at least not easily. If this is your first time playing GTA 5 and you haven't played the story before, I do recommend playing it because it is a good story to it.

[b] My final notes [/b]
if you are getting GTA 5 I would really recommend playing the game with friends online because just from my personal experience that is where I have had the most fun from the game. I love the game and I look forward to the future games in the series. I hope you all find this review helpful.

Good dumb fun. The story didn't really get to me, I mean, it is there. Is it anything special? Uuuugh, not really. The main gripe I have with it is the ending, shit, it didn't even feel like a final part of the game, there was essentially no build up. The cars at first felt strange, but that withered away rather quickly, the shooty stuff is fun, no surprises there. I don't know, the whole experience didn't feel as impactful as I had expected. Story missions treat you like a baby, the characters are all extreme, but that's the satire part I guess. I just wish the story was a bit more memorable and intense than it is. Still, the game's sandboxy nature provides for some quality fun carnage. Won't cover the online part, because I couldn't care less for GTA Online.

lets be clear, the 100 hours i've spent on this game is mainly in the online component so this review is based on the online not the single player ,however, if i was to review single player id likely give it a glowing review because of how fun it was.now! onto online ,as i said the online component is what i'm focusing on and i have played it extensively both on pc and ps4 so i have a pretty good knowledge of how this game is literally broken
1.the economy, unless you buy one of many "shark cards"(which cost real money) for the first 50 hours your gonna struggle to gain any actual amount (word of advice, stay the hell away from apartments and doomsday heist they suck more then a vacuum) the tldp of the first 50 hours is -play simion car mission-get reward-play until you get million-realise that simion only pays you 15k per mission-do simple maths-realise that you'll have to do simion mission over 66 times-cry-eventually get million-buy ceo-realise you have to do more simion because cargo warehouse doesnt come with ceo-cry again 
2. ai in this game are far more artificial then intelligent and for the most part you'll be shouting profanities and other such insults, at them particularly when your driving, they have an amazing habit of switching lanes to hit into your car and slow you way down. As well as these idiot car ai we have retarded shooting ai with aimbot no less. In short gtao has some terrible ai but whats worse then that is your companions 
3. companions, one word "lester" another word "agent 14" one more word "pavel" just one more "page" also"assistant" if i had all day id go on a frenzy just explaining the problems of all these characters ,however, ill keep it brief and just talk about lester the crest ,i personally realistically probably definitely wholeheartedly hate lester, he is annoying,he is not a good character ie he literally has no plot except for wanting to bang this asian one,and finally oh my god he is so unfunny.Its telling when almost every character in your game tells the same jokes over and over and over again you'd think that rockstar might change it it up but no, the jokes in this game mainly go like this "now its time to rob a bank,lets hope you don't die or anything hahah" that is literally the extent of lesters lines and also represents every other "funny" line you'll hear in the game 
4,what they got right, now i could go into vehicles and mention the absolutely brain dead decision that was the oppressor mk2,however, thats too low even for me so i'll tell you now what the online got right 1.the heists are usually fun and entertaining with good gameplay tossed in there and kinda good rewards 2.leveling up isn't the worst thing ever and generally isn't that grindy 3.the gun play is always good not amazing or in depth but it gets the jobs done 4.i guess i like how you can personalise your character fairly well.

and with that iv'e only discussed about half the problems and all this is coming from the top of my head so do take it with a grain of salt i personally like this game however the online really drags it down and gives it a bad name however i will recommend it to anyone just for the storymode

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

I personally believe Grand Theft Auto 5 currently holds 1st place in the open-world game genre. It offers a variety of different styles of play depending on your preferences. Whether you want to play a few missions or go on a complete rampage with the cops or pedestrians it is incredibly fun to enjoy the world of GTA 5. Even just driving around in the city of Los Santos or visiting the casino you always have something to do and I can guarantee that running out of options is not a possibility. Long story short I really enjoy playing this game and I absolutely recommend it to everybody who has not tried it yet.

I think, Grand Theft Auto V is already a [b]timeless[/b] game. Despite almost 10 years in the market and it still [b]impresses[/b] with its [b]graphics, great driving model, frequent updates[/b] and many more. I've spent over 1000h in the game and there's still something to do!

[b]About storymode[/b]
I completed the whole story (every story missions, side missions and side activities) in around 60h. An interesting fact is, GTA V allows you to play as 3 characters during one play through: as a young gangster [b]Franklin[/b], retired thief Michael and psychopathic Trevor. An amazing combination that lets you play various missions and side activities aspecially designed for the character. The story has wacky humor and engaging with a dramatic or very satisfying ending. In addition, there are many side activities that allow you to get even more involved in the gangster world. [b]I highly recommend this game![/b]

[b]About Online[/b]
Almost 95% of the game time I spent in Online mode of the GTA V - [b]GTA Online[/b]. GTA Online allows you to play with your friends. There are [b]countless[/b] activities you can play solo or in co-op as well as many different types of vehicles (such as helicopters, boats, cars, motorcycles etc.) which, combined with the excellent arcade driving model, creates an interesting alternative to other racing games (such as NFSs or Grid). By regular updates this game tries to keep your attention and engagement at the highest level possible.

So the setting of GTA V is hugely impressive, miles and miles and miles of city, beautiful countryside, amazing shorelines, loads of vehicles to play with. However...it's empty. It's just driving around and around and around - there are barely any missions available at any one time, you can't really interact with people unless it's in a strip club (which is just plain creepy and weird). Compare this with Skyrim, where you're picking up missions left right and centre, you can speak to everyone, there's always something to do, your mission marker is very clearly defined. Also, all 3 main characters are thoroughly unlikable, a******s - so even though the world is truly amazing and impressive...it's just not a world I want to spend any time in.

I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 40 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching Ukrainian men French kissing canines on YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
i love getting killed by a little kid on a flying bike that has homing missiles

This game, probably known by most people already, had a lot to offer. The single-player mode is not bad at all and the online version is even better.  Sure there is a lot of violence (if you so chose to) but there is actually a lot of other things you can do apart from that.  Missions, tasks, free-roaming and didnI mention the unnecessary violent actions that... Well.. it *is* fun and could give you a great case of the giggles.

You will get the most out of the game in multiplayer mode with IRL friends because trying to get unrelated people to join in is hard and many times there are a lot of pre-teens with foul mouths just messing about and trying to ruin the experience.

Glitches!? Of course! The game is bug-ridden, but most of them are known and a part of the experience.

Game physics?  Well..  it is not *realistic* but had it been so you would have been dead in seconds and where is the fun in that?

Would I recommend it to others?
Sure thing!  If you have someone to play it with definitely. If you don't have anyone close to play with then maybe try out Big Red Redemption III instead.

I have been playing without committing any crimes in 1st person perspective.  I haven't used any of the criminal enterprise starter stuff, I have only accepted freebies when they are part of the current update's free stuff, and I drank my bonus Million dollars at the casino so I would start with $0, the casino gave me a free 1000 chips, I spent 500 to gain access to the wheel and rolled a $40,000 cash roll. With that I then hired cabs to take me treasure hunting, I grabbed some collectibles as well, rapidly reaching high enough of a rank to be able to go to flight school, doing that has earned me over $1M I have a decent property with a 6 car garage and Heist room I'll never use, and I'm only $1m away from being able to open a legit business.  8 hours for $1M and a $245K property is not too shabby at all, then I bought a bicycle, and took advantage of the free Armored Kuruma they are giving away this week, hopped on my bicycle and rode it to the casino to spin the wheel again for another $50K in cash.  I haven't fired a single shot and no one has died as a consequence of my actions.  The taxi driver did get into a few fender benders though.

As for single player, well, I haven't played that any further than necessary to get to the online portion.  I have played over 1,000 hours on my other account, and I've enjoyed nearly every minute, and the story was engrossing and the characters were loads of fun to play.  So in my opinion this game has not only aged well, but is fun enough that I created a whole new steam account and bought it again just so I could try playing it as a legitimate citizen of Los Santos who avoids crime, but who will still punch out a MF who tries to start somethin.

GTA5 is a great sandbox game!  I've been playing the game for years now and there is just so much stuff to do, that I actually enjoyed doing. The story mode is great as well. Starts you off robbing a bank. I feel like that just shows through the game and fun stuff that you can't really do to much of in real life. Then as the Story Mode progresses, you unlock 2 more characters and do more illegal things and mission/heist! After you Finnish one mission or heist, you can literally do anything you want in real life in a game and not go to jail for it. SUPER FUN!  There is also an Online Mode. GTA5 Online is also SUPER FUN! There are so many different ways you make money, illegally, and once you have all the money in the world, you can buy sick houses, penthouses in casinos, apartments, super cars, planes, boats, ect. Anything you can think of, you can buy. And also, don't forget the best part about GTA5, both Online and Story Mode,     THE STRIP CLUB!!!
Amazing!
On a real note though, I would definitely recommend this game to anybody that is interested into buying it! Again, AMAZING, GREAT, CREATIVE, game. Definitely the best sandbox game every, and up there with the best games in history. 
Hope you buy this game, and if so, enjoy!!!

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Grab this review template here! üëâ https://vojtastruhar.github.io/steam-review-template/
This game should be renamed to Total Tryhard Shitfest V: Grief you and your Cargo harder.

It could even be a good game, if it was not for the devs' complete negligence. No game I have ever paid for has this much cheaters, really... and this is supposed to be an AAA game. Well, even the ancient MTA/SAMP servers do way better job at keeping their servers clean.

I must add that I also had this game on PS4 long ago and it was really fine. PC version however is in a very sad state and the truth is that: it was never good and it only got worse over ages. Idk maybe the idea that PC version essentially makes players host the session in a P2P manner instead of real, dedicated and secure servers is not such a bright one after all. I am sure you(R*) can save some money on the servers, but this is at the cost of the game. 

I get that PC will always have more cheaters than consoles, but what is game presents us in its multiplayer mode is way past the tolerable point. No game will be like that unless the devs just do not care. It could be greatly improved if R* was willing sacrifice some revenue on proper servers and also take a more a more aggressive approach to gain back the control over their game. 

I can only hope that GTA 6 will employ way way way more strict anti-cheat mechanics at any cost, along with a more sensible hosting solution for PC, because GTA 5 sucks really hard when you set foot in its offical multi sololy because of the sheer number of cheaters...

In short:

GTA Online's public lobbies are no reason to buy the game, they're boring, full of griefers or cheaters and in general just very anti-social. If you do plan on buying the game for GTA Online please try to get some friends to play it with you in private lobbies to do heists etc. Many of the newer CEO missions, Heist preparations etc. need to be done in public lobbies but there are workarounds to getting a lobby without any randoms.

For the GTA V (Story) part on the other hand, this game is a must-buy if you like Singleplayer story mode games! I've played through the story about 6 times by now on Playstation and on PC and I loved it everytime it just never gets boring to see the great development of Franklin, Michael and Trevor with each turn and twist of the story. There is no mission that i would deem as absolute lackluster or in any way boring, some are better others are not as good but they all have their charme.

This game is a masterpiece and a must-buy for every person that has ever played video games in my opinion.

The life of a GTA Player
You're on <insert console name> and are playing the same old game
Your friends are playing a new game they started playing again
They tell you to buy it
You spend ages begging your parents for money, but you've already bought something this week
They won't let you buy it for a few months
You finally buy it and hop on with your friends
You make some of the best memories with your friend group
Most of you switch to pc
You spend ages saving up for one and have finally bought one
You have all gotten so much in the game after hundreds of heists
You have reached rank 600 and have 900mil overall income
You just bought a really fun vehicle after a heist
You and your friends are having a lot of fun messing around with it
You are creating more memories, even better than on <insert console name>
It's getting late, all of you head offline to sleep, there's school tomorrow, isn't there?
School was really boring that day
You finally get home after the most boring and long day
You take a minute to remember how much you've worked to get everything you've got
You feel so much pride you've done this all legitimately
You're feeling so much more accomplished that you didn't use mods to reach your goals
You fire up your pc after your friends have gotten online
You open up steam
You open GTA
The rockstar launcher is taking ages to load
You restart it
You, and multiple friends have been banned from GTA Online
All of you put thousands of hours into the game
You pick up your PC and fling it out the window
You contact R* Support and they more or less tell you to deal with it
You find a new game with better devs
FIX YOUR ANTICHEAT, R*

Came here for the story mode and it did not disappoint. I bought it because it was at an extremely deep discount, with DLC that affects the Online mode (but I don't plan on playing that until I've beaten the singleplayer game and gotten good at GTA; I'm more of a singleplayer guy anyway.)

Story so far for me has been pretty engaging. Main missions are fun and get emotional at times. Side missions and stories are ridiculous but very fun. There's this one side mission where you film some people doing (something) in their backyard, and then get seen, then continue filming them - while driving away. Then later on you're fighting aliens and clowns that regenerate. You can even pick up random strangers, and drop them off at a cult (which I sadly did not do when I had the chance...) This stuff's crazy!

You can not play offline single player, since the game periodically does online authentication checks. This sort of thing should be fully disclosed prior to purchase or be fully refundable if you pay for a software and with no prior warning are unable to use it. Otherwise would be a 5 star game, but industries don't care about anyone who doesn't have access to internet anymore, since it's such a small group of buyers.

Fun crime simulator with decent story telling and good graphics, especially now that we can play at higher graphical settings with better frame rates. But there's a LOT of violence everywhere, so this won't be for everyone. If you can ignore the amount of over-the-top violence and needless gore, this can be a somewhat cinematic experience. This is about single player.

Multiplayer also has some nice story missions (a lot more have been added over time), but it costs a lot of in-game money (can be earned as you play, although may take a while, or you can just buy shark cards - buy in-game money directly using real currencies). The other problem with multiplayer is finding people to play with, as a lot of story missions require having 1-3 partners in crime (both literally and figuratively). If you have a 4 player team, online can be a lot of fun!

I am a 35 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 29 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

GTA Online is broken.  The performance has degraded so far as to be unplayable.  The single player works great, but as someone who has played since launch, on multiple platforms, I can no longer recommend the PC version. If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I've played this game for thousands of hours on console and I can say with no doubt in my mind that this is my favorite game of all time. Words cannot describe the pure serotonin and dopamine that I gain from playing this game. The grind is still one of the most satisfying things I have ever experienced. The storymode is one of, if not the best story that I have had the pleasure of playing through. Although I have had my rough patches with this game, whether it being my gripes with the company, or a current update, I always find myself coming back to play. The stories are funny and interesting, the online play is satisfying and content rich, the only major gripe that I have with the game are the cheaters/modders (if you were a majority console player like me). Hopping into a random GTA lobby and having fun and bantering with randoms have given me some of the funnest nights of my life. This game has helped me nurture a bond with my friends that has only grown stronger since our widespread escapades have ceased. I just really wanted to write this review to say thank you to Rockstar, and even if we haven't agreed much in recent years when it comes to RD2 and that horrible remastered collection, I still can't help but getting hyped for GTA6. I'm hoping that GTA6 will be the sequel that this masterpiece deserves, and not some shitty cash grab that so many AAA games are nowadays. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU. If you are looking to purchase this game, GET IT. Especially if you have a group of friends to play with. I promise you it will be one of the most fun experiences you will have with your friends. And if you don't have any? Thats completely fine too! The PC community is actually very non-toxic when compared to the console player base I have most of my playtime with. Especially because of all-chat. I just feel that the only improvement that could be made is to enforce banning cheaters much more, as I feel that the major issue with the PC community is that every other lobby you load into, there is a cheater in god mode, that fucks with you just trying to play the game legit. Super unsatisfying setting up a heist, and having someone teleport to you, kill you, and steal/blow-up the goods, for no other reason then to bait a reaction in chat. Look, I have no problem with people enjoying the game how they want to, but when it becomes destructive, it makes the game overall less fun to play for others, and it very detrimental to the game. Overall, the game itself is a 9.5/10, but I do feel like the community does detract from free mode play a bit.

I last played a GTA game when the original was still groundbreaking and cool. As far as I'm concerned, it still is. I never thought taking them 3D would be a good move so I avoided them until now, but having an idle afternoon and a bit of spare cash, I bought it recently on offer. I did this, having noted (and in spite of) the comments about bad online experiences, on the basis that I expected only to play the single player story mode. This review doesn't therefore, concern GTA Online.

What I can say, is that the story mode is awful. Loading times (which are embarrassingly slow) aside, I just can't see how anyone could possibly enjoy it. Your time is mostly spent being whined at, patronised and generally annoyed by a cast of NPCs whose only role is apparently to order you around and swear a lot. Being an middle-class white male, I suspect that my failure to appreciate the first few hours of the game is entirely cultural.

Added to that, there just doesn't seem to be any point to doing anything. At the start of the game, you have no money, but really no way to earn any either. You're presented with an "open world" - but it's a total nonsense, because the only way to make money in any significant quantity is to do the missions, making it a very linear experience. All of the things which you could _choose_ to do in the original game (and with which it would be possible to build up a modest pot of cash / arsenal / etc.) have been removed.

For example, you can't sell cars you've stolen, rendering the description "grand theft auto" somewhat suspect. For any other misdemeanour you might consider committing, the police simply shoot you - but that's fine, because getting arrested is far more annoying and costly than getting wasted paying the hospital bill. The stock market, meanwhile, doesn't seem to function at all, and when it does, only goes one way, as soon as you invest in anything - and you're given only 5 days worth of past prices to make a judgement about whether to invest in the first place.

The only way to delay, but not avoid this terrible gameplay loop is to steal $11 from some unsuspecting pedestrian, followed by a 3 mile excursion, to find the nearest bridge to hide under, to escape the clutches of the law. Do that a few times in a play session and one might start to think of GTA V as a somewhat over-hyped running simulator.

Of course, one can try holding up grocery shops and so on to improve returns - I got over $100 once - but that merely introduces another 3-mile run to find one in the first place, before you even get to the point of committing your outrageous crime.

Disappointing would be an improvement. Avoid.

The best Czech food.-Pork dumpling zelo

Pork dumpling zelo is one of the most popular dishes of the Czechs - we would not even be afraid to call it almost a national dish. Roast pork, delicious cabbage and fluffy dumplings can make the day more pleasant, especially if a glass of well-chilled beer is served with them. How to master this basic recipe?

What we will need for the liver:

1 kilogram of pork neck in total
100 grams of lard, preferably pork
5 tricks of garlic
2 medium onions
1 tablespoon plain flour
2 teaspoons ground cumin
salt and pepper.

Procedure: Preheat the oven to 140 ¬∞ C. Salt the meat, pepper it and rub garlic thoroughly into it from all sides. Cut the onion into cubes and pour it into the baking dish. Put the meat on this onion bedding and add lard. Pour about 200 ml of hot water and bake. Bake the meat for about 3 hours. After removing it from the oven, let it rest in the baking tray for 15 to 20 minutes so that the juice is evenly distributed in it. Then we take the meat out of the roasting pan and cut it into slices, in the form of which we will serve it. Make the sauce from the onion baked with meat juice - transfer the contents of the baking dish to a pot, dust with flour and mix well. Pour another 200 ml of cold water over the mixture and cook on low heat and stirring for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

What we will need for cabbage:

1 bag of sauerkraut (who does not like sauerkraut, can use freshly sauerkraut, but it is good to salt before cooking in a bowl and let it rest for about an hour - it drains the juice and softens)
100 grams of bacon in total
2 medium onions
2 tablespoons lard
2 tablespoons plain flour
2 teaspoons ground cumin
salt
sugar
2 - 3 tablespoons vinegar

Procedure: Heat the lard in a pan. Add diced bacon, onion and cumin. Fry for a while, then add the cabbage. Pour it with either brine from the bag or the juice that the cabbage released, and let it cook for about 15 minutes. Add vinegar, salt and sugar to the cabbage according to how we like it. Attention! If we use fresh, salted cabbage, with additional salting carefully! After 15 minutes, dust the cabbage with flour and cook for another 15 minutes.

What we will need for dumplings:

1 kilogram of coarse flour
500 milliliters of lukewarm semi-skimmed milk
20 grams of fresh yeast
1 egg
1 croissant
salt
pinch of sugar

Procedure: In a larger bowl, mix the sifted flour with sugar and salt. We knock eggs into it, crush the yeast and add milk. Let it rest for 5 minutes. Then we make a compact dough with our hands. Next, add a croissant cut into small cubes and let it rise in the cloth-covered bowl for an hour. We then shape the cones from the dough, which we cook in a salted water bath for 18 minutes. Attention! We have to turn them around halfway through. After removing the dumplings from the bath, we pierce them in several places with a fork so that steam leaves them. Then we cut them into slices.

Done? Now all you have to do is place the dumplings, a portion of cabbage, cover everything with slices of delicious meat and pour the sauce over the plate. Enjoy your meal!

[h1]Review For Story Mode Only:[/h1]

Story: 6/10 The story comprises of the three main characters Michael, Trevor, and Franklin. All three go on heists and do jobs for other people such as the FBI. The story is nothing crazy. Michael has family problems and is one of the main plots of the story, I don't blame him though, his family is complete shit to him. Franklin is from the hood and wants to make it big by learning from Michael & Franklin. Trevor's goes to find Michael after learning that his best friend is actually still alive. 

Game play: 6/10 Whilst there are a lot of activities you can do in this game, most of the content is very frustrating. Without the cheats and option to skip missions I'm not sure I would have completed the story as fast as I did. Helicopters control like doo doo. Cars will also spin out way too easily. The cops in this game are relentless and the conditions for some of these missions will fail you very easily. The pedestrians will always get in your way. These npcs are so stupid that it makes the game feel less alive than a non open world game like Yakuza. I will give it props though, the shooting, heists, and assignations in this game are really fun.

Music: 4/10 The music in this game is just.... what can I say. There are rarely any good songs that pop up on the radio and I really hate how the radio turns on every single time I drive a car.

Graphics: 8/10 For a 2013 game, the graphics still hold up quite well, although I was definitely more impressed with the graphics when it first launched but now graphics like these are standard.

Price: Get it when on sale. This game is often on sale for cheaper never pay more than 15 dollars I'd say.

Overall score: 7/10

*Review for GTA 5 Online*

This review is for GTA V Online, not the singleplayer GTA V. GTA V's singleplayer is great for what it is but most people buying this game in 2022 will be purchasing it for the online experience. 

  GTA V Online has such an amazing groundwork. A beautiful map, tons of content, and a plethora of things to do. 

  All of the above features are thrown out the window by the amount of modders and cheaters in the game. While many people would argue that there aren't that many of them or that they don't affect the experience, both of these statements are just untrue. From my experience, almost every public lobby has at least 1-2 modders in it. These "modders" and the amount they can do outside the game's boundaries is absolutely unacceptable. 

  They can spawn unobtainable vehicles, become invincible, fly, explode the entire map, teleport, become NPCs such as animals, lock you into a cage, crash your game instantly, and many other things. If this wasn't enough, they can violate your privacy. They can force you to type things into chat and even SEE YOUR IP ADDRESS. It's questionable if having a VPN will help this, though many have said that it definitely will, and I strongly advise using one if you do happen to be playing. 
  
  Your first thought would be to report these people to Rockstar, correct? Well. Modders get alerts when you send a report through the game, which allows them to delete them before they even reach Rockstar. That's right. You can't even report these cheaters which can be an actual threat to your game experience, your Rockstar account, and your real-world well being. 

  On top of all this, Rockstar as a company is just completely awful. They have taken most customer support down for the game, so most email reports will not work to get any cheaters banned even with video proof. However, they do have ban waves in which they ban accounts of suspected cheaters every month or so. Hilariously, my account was falsely banned for 30 days and my entire character reset. All of the 95.4 hours you see at the time of writing this review was erased for existing in a lobby with a modder, something out of my control and completely without my consent. I had never received a warning nor committed any offense on my GTA or Social Club account before this. 

This game is outdated, not supported by the developers, and swarming with cheaters that can put you at risk. 
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME FOR THE ONLINE.

Incredible game-play, almost open world both online and off.  Graphics are great and re-play-ability is insane, especially with online.  YES there are plenty of players online that are going to grief you, but you can always change 'session' if it gets bad.  Or you can get better at it and mess them up before they mess you up.  It's NOT great for someone who wants to play an online version of GTA (when using online) because it's no longer just AI -- it's actual players who can be quite mean and follow you pretty much anywhere you go (you are visible on the map .. kind of think that should be a bit less ubiquitous.)  I still support this game both offline and on.  It's occasionally glitchy like most online action games, but less-so than most.

Honestly, I don't know where to start.
On the surface It looks like there's a shit ton of stuff to do in this game. There's hundreds of individual missions, Like 10 heists, missions for your businesses, etc. The problem is you make shit money for ALMOST ALL OF THEM. Example, missions you get from the characters in from the campaign can give you somewhere around 20K, more or less depending. Seems like a good chunk of change, right? Not when you consider that car you want is 1.4 mil, or the business you want is 1.6 mil. Making money when you first start out is TERRIBLE. I played this game on and off over the years, but I really got into this time around and I forgot what the grind was like. When I downloaded it for the first time in about 2 1/2 years I was so excited to play because they had added so much content. But when I booted it up and started playing I Immediately was reminded of why I stopped in the first place. Everything feels so out of reach. There's tons of cool stuff to be had but unless you want to commit hundreds of hours to the game or buy shark cards good luck. Moving on to properties. Obviously the whole objective of online is to acquire properties and use them to make more money etc. The problem is almost every single business is 1.5 mil+ and on top of that they aren't immediately profitable. To start to make decent money you have to grind even more and piss more money into them to even break even. Example: When I got back into the game every told me the bunker was the way to go. As far as passive income was concerned this thing was regarded as the best. So I saved my money, sold a few of the cars I bought and did a shit ton of regular missions and crate warehouse missions. (Business where you collect random stuff and sell it in one big go) after a while of all of this I finally had enough to buy the cheapest bunker. This is where I realized exactly how bad the grind in this game is. So the bunker makes guns which you then do a sell mission to sell and make money. For the bunker to make guns you need supplies. There's two means to get supplies. Buy them flat out (to fill up on them is 75K) or to do a mission and go get them (which fill up 1/5 of the bar) The missions to get supplies are flat out fucking terrible. ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE PLAYING SOLO. The bunker isn't the only business with terrible missions also btw. And by terrible I mean you're playing by yourself, and you go to do a resupply mission because you're broke after buying the thing and can't afford supplies. The mission is shoot down a fucking helicopter that's halfway across the map, kill the 3 people that parachute out in all separate directions, then take the crates back 1 at a time because you can't carry multiple. Also I forgot to mention that this entire time the whole lobby of 30 people get a pop up that you are doing this and your visible on the map the entire time. Same goes for selling the final product as well. Have a million dollars worth of guns to sell? Good luck doing it solo considering the game gives you 3 vehicles you have to take to separate locations all while the exact location of said vehicles is shown on the map for the whole lobby to see. At this point you're probably thinking "why not get some people to help you out?" and that would make sense if there was literally and incentive for other people to do so but there isn't. The MC and CEO work has a shit ton of missions designed for multiple people to play but the only person who is remotely benefited by doing them is the person that owns the businesses. You'd think if you help your friend sell 1.2 million dollars worth of fucking guns you'd make something right? how does 5K sound? There's no incentive to help other people complete these missions as you make no money and your time would be better served doing your own. I want to play this game with my friends and have a good time but as someone who hasn't played for 5 fucking years and doesn't own a whole lot I can't, because I have to grind to get decent cars/equipment for the game to be fun. Finally we arrive to the heists. The idea of doing a heist with 4 of your buds sounds like a blast right? Break some asshole out of jail, rob a bank, etc. And on top of that make a large sum of money. What's not to love? For starters, the beginning heists (The ones you unlock via buying a high end apartment) are terrible. Each one has 4-5 setup missions where you basically acquire the means to complete the heist. Makes complete sense until you realize these missions are literally designed to waste your time. These setup missions take so long to complete depending on the specific one. On top of that while doing a heist the normal enemies you face are beefed up and have way better aim than usual. Better aim as in you'll be swerving in and out of traffic doing 100mph and the guy on the side of a helicopter can literally fucking beem you and hit every single shot. On top of this on normal difficulty you only get 1 extra team life. So if you are playing with someone who made the mistake of being new to the game they either sit in the back and do nothing the whole time or everyone gets punished. But it all must be worth it in the end right? That's the point of the a heist, it's meant to be challenging but have a big payout right? Welp, not according to rockstar. After around 40 mins to a hour of doing these setup missions you finally get to the heist. The objective is to go to a bank, rob it, and escape via motorcycle to a boat halfway across the map. Pretty straightforward. That is until you get the money and get out of said bank and immediately get beemed by the shit ton of cops outside. Which by the way, the whole concept of doing all this intricate prep work to get all this specific equipment just to stache your getaway vehicles 4 blocks away is pretty fucking stupid. Did I mention when you get shot money falls out of your bag and is taken out of the total cut? Or if you use all 1 of your team lives and have to restart from a checkpoint you don't get that money back? So you and your 3 buddies take all this time to do this heist, you get to the finale, and half of your total 1 mil (already being split between 4 people) is taken from you because you got shot a bunch at the end. Which unless you are a 800 pound incel that plays gta more than you breathe it's impossible not to. Weird enough the money magically stops falling out of your bag after you lose half of that mil. Did I also mention that the heist has a 100K setup cost for the person that hosts? oh, and don't forget the police and civilian  AI are literally programmed to run into while you are trying to escape on the shitty motorcycles you get. The worst part about it is that the newer the heist is, the better it gets. But rockstar can't take the time to go back and fix the old content because they are to busy bathing in the 6 BILLION DOLLARS they've made off the game to fix literally anything. There's literally 1 good way to make money in this game and that's the cayo heist. you can make around 1.4 mil a hour. Now why would I do anything else to make money except for this. Nothing else in the game gives you a payout like this. No business or heist. And you can do it solo. There's literally no balance. Rockstar developed all this shit no one uses anymore because 1 heist pays a shit ton more than anything else. Oh, I failed to mention that if you don't get a infinite loading screen while doing this stuff you'll have a modder in 99% of lobbies to blow you up and crash your game. Apparently 6 Billion isn't enough to develop some decent anti cheat. In the past two week I've had maybe 3 lobbies where there hasn't been a cheater. I didn't even touch on the greifers with stupid OP vehicles either. I know I talked specifics a lot in this review but this sums a majority of the content in regards to making money. If you insist on playing google how to "quickly repeat"  the cayo heist.
