[h1][u]Grand Theft Auto V is an unfairly misjudged and very misunderstood title.[/u][/h1]

When you think of Grand Theft Auto V, you probably think of a game that‚Äôs about nothing more than stealing cars, killing people and robbing banks. While it‚Äôs true that these are three major aspects of the game, there is so much more to GTA V, and as someone who has invested nearly 600 hours into the game, having played through the story mode three times, including obtaining 100% completion and unlocking countless achievements, as well as having spent a respectable chunk of that time in GTA Online, it pains me to see such a great game get lumped together with mindless shooters such as Call of Duty.

Grand Theft Auto V is a brilliant game, and is very rich in excellent story-telling, tremendous voice acting, and more self-aware humour and attention to detail than possibly any other video game out there. The game has three playable protagonists, the first of whom is Franklin Clinton, a 25-year old street gangster and repo man who tries to make a serious name for himself in the criminal world whilst living with his aunt in a ghetto neighbourhood a few doors down from his best friend Lamar, who frequently meddles in his business and always has a dozen hilarious zingers up his sleeve whenever the two are together. The second protagonist is Michael De Santa, a middle-aged typical Los Santos douchebag with narcissistic personality disorder. Michael has a plastic wife and two spoiled kids who hate him, and has been living in hiding under a different name for nine years after a deal with FIB Agent Dave Norton. The third protagonist is Trevor Philips, an oddly-lovable, unpredictable neurotic psychopath, who despite his intimidating and disturbing tendencies is as loyal as a golden retriever to those he cares about. Trevor lives in a trailer out in the boonies,and is involved in a number of gang wars, as well as a meth business. Trevor is usually seen with his boot-licking business partner Ron and his empty-headed ice cream-loving pal Wade. Following a crucial story event that I won‚Äôt spoil here, Michael (and later Trevor) take Franklin under their wing, marking Michael‚Äôs official return to crime after a decade-long hiatus. An unlikely friendship is formed, and the trio embark on an unforgettable crime spree. Let me touch a bit more on some of the game‚Äôs important characters. Franklin‚Äôs Aunt Denise is an outspoken feminist who is often parading around her neighbourhood yelling out triumphant chants with her lady friends. Michael‚Äôs wife Amanda is an ex-stripper turned trophy wife who birthed Michael‚Äôs two children: Jimmy and Tracey. Jimmy is an overweight free-loading loser who disrespects his father and sits in his room all day smoking weed and yelling obscenities at people online, and Tracey dreams of being a dancer and a singer, and is often hanging out with swinger groups and trying out for Reality TV. Simeon Yetarian, a sketchy Armenian sleazebag who owns an auto shop, is Franklin (and Lamar)‚Äôs employer at the start of the game. Lester Crest, an old associate of Michael and Trevor's, is a tech whiz who foresees all of their heists. Then there‚Äôs Devin Weston, a rich douchebag whose shoes are probably more expensive than Michael‚Äôs house. Devin gives the protagonists some of their jobs throughout the story, and notoriously holds out on their pay. Dave Norton is a corrupt FIB Agent who makes a deal with Michael at the beginning of the game. Later on, he and the absolute tool that is FIB Agent Steve Haines negotiate even more jobs for Michael, Trevor and Franklin. The group also have many enemies, such as Martin Madrazo, head of the Mexican drug cartel, Wei Cheng, the leader of a Chinese crime syndicate, and Stretch, a frenemy of Franklin‚Äôs who has led him into countless traps and expresses a strong dislike for him. There are several other supporting and minor characters throughout the game, but these are all of the majorly important ones. Now let‚Äôs talk about the game itself for a bit.

The story mode packs hundreds of hours of content for you to enjoy, with over seventy main story missions (including three different game endings), as well as a metric truck-ton of side missions. Additionally, the amount of possible ways to entertain yourself apart from missions is in the hundreds. GTA V is not just a crime simulator, but also a life simulator. Do you want to practice your shooting? Spend an afternoon at the gun range. Would you like to improve your flying skills? Go to flight school or try your hand at some of the trick flights. Looking for a relaxing way to spend your day after an intense heist? Grab a buddy and play a game of golf, tennis or darts. You can also visit the strip club, grab a drink at the bar, go to the movies (you actually get to see the movie), do yoga, go hunting for elk, or sit at home and watch television (with actual 10-minute long episodes of fictional TV Shows, as well as news channels). Still not enough for you? Take a drive while listening to one of the twenty-two available radio stations that offer great music of pretty much any genre, in addition to hours-worth of ridiculous advertisements, comments by the stations‚Äô respective hosts, and news segments that discuss events currently happening in your part of the game. You can also import your own music. As you drive (or sail along), be sure to look out for the countless collectibles in the game in order to earn some achievements and unlock more side quests. Between both the Story Mode and GTA Online, you can find Letter Scraps, UFO Parts, Nuclear Waste, Submarine Parts, Peyote Plants, Casino Cards, Action Figures, Treasure Clues, Bounty Hunting Missions, and possibly even more collectibles that I‚Äôm forgetting. You can also compete in races on both sea and land, participate in triathlons, go skydiving, visit the carnival and ride the ferris wheel or roller coaster, and put your driving (or flying) skills to the test with the respective Stunt Jumps and Under the Bridge/Knife Flights. Did I mention you can also change your look? If you're getting bored with the same hair style, facial hair or clothing, don't worry! Just pop any of the Barber Shops or Clothing Stores into your GPS and go on a shopping spree with your hard-earned money! You can also visit the AmmuNation Store and buy new guns, melee weapons, weapon attachments, parachutes, bombs and more. If this still isn‚Äôt enough for you, pull out your cell phone. There are also hours upon hours of entertainment to be found on GTA V‚Äôs fictional internet. You can browse the social media pages of every living character you come across in the game, online shop for cars, bikes, boats, businesses and more. There are also many videos to be watched, surveys to be taken, and easter eggs to be discovered. In addition to all of these incredible activities, GTA Online offers even more things to do that are exclusive to the Online portion of the game, one of the more notable ones is the activities in the Diamond Casino, such as horse betting, table games, spinning the daily wheel, and of course, slot machines.

Grand Theft Auto V is truly a masterpiece, and I am not ashamed to call it one of the greatest games of all-time. It even has the numbers to prove it, having sold 165,000,000 units to date, making it the second best-selling game in history behind Minecraft. I could go on for hours about this game, but really the best way to experience this game is to play it for yourself. If you‚Äôve always thought of GTA V as just another shooter with no personality, please, I urge you to give this game a chance. Though I can admit that the Online mode has its fair share of toxic players, this game is so much more than its reputation, and I will defend it as being a quality title until the day I die.

This review is about GTA V Online

I don't even know where to start... While the game has so much potential to provide a good gaming experience it somehow manages to fail at almost every aspect that makes a game enjoyable.

The COMMUNITY is the WORST i have EVER seen and i've been playing games for over 25 years. There is not a single lobby where there aren't any cheaters/hackers (and yes i purposely call em that). Be it the guy that just uses a mod menu to have fun with the game (those are not healthy for the game but somewhat tolerable) or the guy that teleports across the map to other players, having god mode on and randomly killing anyone they come across just to forcefully exit/crash your game when you give them a hard time doing that. It is ACTUALLY UNPLAYABLE in most public lobbies due to the insane amount of disturbed and sad souls out there. It's just a perfect example of what happens when anyone can have "power".
Even if there is no hacker trying way too hard to make your experience the worst, there are still unbelievably many people griefing/randomly killing anyone they come across. And the best part (sarcasm) about all that is that the game entitles you to do that. If someone tries to deliver products to get a little bit of money which they can spend on 1/5 of a car the whole lobby gets a message about what you are doing and that they should kill you and take those products.
The game tells you to be a toxic person. And since the game is catering to kids at least as much as to adults (lets not forget that this game is rated M = 17+) Rockstar is creating a prototype of gamers that are out of anyone's control.
It is a widely known fact that Rockstar does not listen to their community at all (if you can even call it a community because it contains the word unity). R* has made over 6 billion dollars from this game yet they leave the game in such an unbelievably bad shape, riddled with bugs, no anti cheat precautions, extremely out of touch additions, vehicles and stories, very bad controls, balancing, AI, obsolete features (damn the list doesnt even stop there) that is has nothing to do with what they got known for. This is a game that feels like it is halfway through developement.
They are milking their players with an insane amount of ignorance. And everyone who buys shark cards (ingame money for actual money) is actively supporting what they do.

How did this happen? Well, money! Money is the answer here. The developers take awards, smile at the cameras, bathe in money, ignore those that made them who they are and they are getting away with everything.

SOME PROS would be that it is a pretty decent looking game for such an old game and the driving has improved quite alot, also you definitely can have a good laugh from playing this game. I wish i could add more to this list but it gets tainted by everything bad about it way too much.

Would i recommend this to anyone? Well...no. MAYBE play the single player game if you can pick it up from a sale but if you think you will get that good ol' GTA vibe but with friends this time... be prepared for a hell of a surprise.

Rockstar has lost hundrets of thousands or even millions of potential buyers that liked to play what R* made them who they are, or at least who they were. If you could sell your soul to the devil, be sure they did not only sell their soul, they happily ripped it out of their bodies, took a piss on it, have it go through all circles of hell and laughed maniacally while getting a molten gold injection in their liveless bodies.


EDIT: Oh and please take a look at those reviews. Anyone with a working brain should realize it's mostly children and trolls writing those "reviews". Like come on..

I've played a combined 2000+ hours on this game and I hate every second. This game has had a death grip on me for almost 10 years. Will I stop? No. This game has been with me for almost half of my life. It is a part of me now. It is me. I am GTA Online. I am suffering and pain. I am the one who knocks, knocks at the gates of hell to let me in and take me out of the purgatory I have been stuck in for so long. I beg of you, someone, anyone, grab my hand, pull me out of the cold, wrinkly hands of Rockstar so I may be free once again. If they release a new DLC before I escape I fear I may be dragged back down into the deepest pits of GTA torture. I can't take it anymore. Anything would be better than spending another second on this game. Yet I must. I have no choice. This game is in my DNA. My genetic code is made up of flying motorcycles, angry blonde men, and garbage servers. Someone needs to clear my cache, as that seems to be the only solution Rockstar ever offers to any issues. My cache must be full, that is why I can't take it anymore. It all makes sense. Maybe if my cache is cleared, I will be free to live out to rest of my life in peace and solitude. This is my final plea: Reset my cache and release me. I want nothing more in this life.

I`m a 47 years old freelancer and this game saved my life!
I born like a handicapped boy and I have problem with my legs. I was "nailed" to the chair basically entire my life.
Even when in my childhood I never had any friends cause of that. There`s was literally nothing I can do... I just wanted to be like an ordinary kid just running and playing some football. I hated this life. Nobody was understanding me except my family. Only thing I found really entertaining it was watching my brother plays. He noticed that and we started to sharing one old PC. It was really fun! We talked a lot of some games topics and he teach me basically everything I need to know. But after some time, my older brother have to move from our family to another town, because of his college and he gave me his old PC. PC gave me chance to forget everything I have experienced in my life. Time passed and I started to playing my life changing game, Grand Theft Auto 5. There I met my dear friends and my wife. They accepted me the way I was. Right now I have a family and my son. We still playing games sometimes and I hope this will stay as it is. Never lose your hope in the best!

Q: Should i exploit or get a mod menu in this game?
A: Why not both, rockstar won't give a damn about you since you're not hurting their revenue.
 
Q: Would i get banned doing exploit and stuff?
A: Maybe, since their banning attemps only end up banning the innocent instead of the perpetrator. 

Q: Why is rockstar not banning these hackers and modders???
A: Like i said, as long as it doesn't hurt their revenue THEY WON'T TAKE ANY DRASTIC ACTION.

Q: So if GTA Online is screwed, How's the singleplayer?
A: Decent.

Q: If there's so many bad stuff happening in GTA Online how do certain people have fun?!
A: They have their own way of having fun in that clusterduck of a game. (Including me)

Q: Should i buy it?
A: If you're a solo masochist do so, The only time where people (including me) will recommend you buying this game is either you want to play the [b]singleplayer experience ONLY[/b] or you have [b]3 other friend who own the game and would play together[/b]. other than that buy another game instead of this piece of crap.

Fortnite Battle Royale sets itself apart by trading the traditional, bland military simulation vibe with vivid colors and an outstanding, freeform building system that‚Äôs unlike anything else in competitive multiplayer games.As its name suggests, Fortnite Battle Royale fits so neatly into the battle royale genre that blew up last year that the basic description sounds as standard as you can get: Up to 100 players are dropped onto a large but constantly shrinking map with the goal of gathering weapons and gear to become the last person or team left standing. But if you look just a little closer, it can‚Äôt be mistaken for any other game because the vehicle you‚Äôre skydiving out of is, inexplicably, a flying party bus ‚Äì a nice change of pace from a drab military plane ‚Äì and the place you land is a giant, beautifully colorful island, instead of a realistic landscape, surrounded by a violent storm.
Thankfully, unlike other battle royale games, like PlayerUnknown‚Äôs Battlegrounds, where an unlucky circle could leave getting out of the encroaching circle almost impossible, Fortnite‚Äôs map is at least small enough (relative to PUBG‚Äôs) that even if you have to run across the entire island to get to the safety of the randomly centered eye of the storm you run very little risk of being killed by the collapsing border.
On the island are several large and totally unique cities, each with their own style of structures ‚Äî a quaint suburb of houses, a giant office district filled with skyscrapers, or a retail area with an outdoor mall. Each city is full of vibrant colors, and the map as a whole has hundreds of buildings with randomly spawning loot in the form of guns, explosives, and healing items.
Wait, Which Fortnite Is This? Developed by Epic Games, Fortnite was originally conceived as a third-person, co-op, survival game where teams of players could mine resources and build structures to hold off hordes of undead enemies. That version, now a standalone game called Fortnite Save the World, still exists, but it‚Äôs not great. But as the battle royale genre started to gain popularity early in 2017, Epic adapted its survival game‚Äôs basic systems into something new: Fortnite Battle Royale, a separate, free-to-play game that feels like the perfect home for Save the World‚Äôs wayward mechanics.
Fortnite Battle Royale‚Äôs inventory management is, thankfully, simple by design. You get just five slots, so you‚Äôre forced to balance your arsenal of guns with your need for healing or explosives to deal with enemy structures. It‚Äôs a neat limiting factor that forced me to keep a mental shopping list of exactly what I was on the lookout for as I ran across the island, and to resist the urge to pick up anything else. With such specific needs in mind, every chest came with the thrill of hoping it would reveal the weapons I wanted most. Fortnite gives you plenty of ways to mix and match weapons, so even if that chest doesn‚Äôt come up with the exact item you want, you‚Äôll never feel powerless in a fight.
Once you do find the weapons you‚Äôre looking for, most fights in Fortnite go about the same way: You start with one shot from a slow-firing heavy weapon like a sniper rifle or pump shotgun in hopes of ending the fight before it really started, then (if needed) switch over to a faster assault rifle or tactical shotgun to carry out the rest of the battle. While it‚Äôs far from the only way to play, this combination seems to be the preferred method for almost every player and provides the foundation of almost every fight in Fortnite.
It‚Äôs a chaotic and fun system that makes fights a little more complicated.
It‚Äôs a lightning-fast system where fights can end in the blink of an eye with just one slight miss. This makes for a stark contrast from other battle royale games like PlayerUnknown‚Äôs Battlegrounds, which is filled with long, tense standoffs where sustained accuracy often matters more than a single well placed shot. It‚Äôs a chaotic and fun system that makes fights a little more complicated than simply aiming at your opponent and firing, but after a few hours with Fortnite I started to get the shoot-and-switch rhythm down and fights started to become almost automatic.
It‚Äôs the stuff around the shooting that helps Fortnite differentiate itself from every other battle royale game and shows off what truly makes it special: The building.
Carrying over the building system from Save the World is a brilliant choice that sets Battle Royale apart not just from other battle royale games, but most competitive multiplayer games in general. Just about everything that isn‚Äôt the ground can be mined for wood, stone, or steel, which can be used to create walls, stairs, and floors anywhere on the map (so long as some part of the structure touches the ground). It‚Äôs a massive system with so many possibilities that, at first blush, it can be daunting to try to figure out how to build the massive structures that others around you have created. But that‚Äôs one of the best things about Fortnite: It always keeps things simple.
That‚Äôs one of the best things about Fortnite: It always keeps things simple.
With just three primary tiles ‚Äì floors, walls, and stairs ‚Äì the building toolset may seem limited, but it‚Äôs got everything you really need. Whether it was building a staircase up to that hard-to-reach loot chest or quickly laying down an impromptu piece of cover to protect from an attacking enemy, I found I always had the tools I needed for the job at hand, and I could swap to the piece I needed without missing a beat. In fact, that swapping is so easy that one of my favorite moves is placing one platform and jumping off of it, then switch to another type in mid-air and place it before I land. That trick allows you to scale vertical walls or go straight up a mountain. While this may sound like an impressive feat of dexterity, Fortnite makes it so simple that almost anyone can pull it off ‚Äì and they do, making it one of the most common tricks to getting around the island.
The first time I really understood how Fortnite‚Äôs building and shooting played into one another came in the middle of a fight in Retail Row, one of the map‚Äôs many cities. Another player and I were sheepishly taking shots at one another from behind single walls we had built. After I ran out of ammo in my assault rifle, I was forced to turn to my shotgun ‚Äì a weapon I had largely disregarded up until this point. With the few resources I had left, I built stairs over my opponent‚Äôs wall, jumped off, flipped around, and shotgunned him. Looking back, it was as routine a play as it gets, but it was an absolute revelation for me at the time. Suddenly, everything made sense, and I realized that Fortnite Battle Royale is more about building than it is about shooting.
While the little things you can use it for may seem obvious ‚Äì like building stairs to get to the roof of a building, or making a wall to block an enemy‚Äôs shots ‚Äì the system also gives you room to think outside the box. You could build around a downed teammate that you can‚Äôt help yet, or create a decoy fort to lure enemies into an ambush while you wait behind a tree. The system even provides some elegant solutions to getting caught outside the trademark random circles of the battle royale genre: If you find yourself on the wrong side of a lake or chasm, no problem ‚Äì just make your own bridge to the other side.
One player lured me into his elaborate fortress of hallways in hopes of forcing me toward his waiting shotgun at the end of the maze.
Thanks to the building system‚Äôs simple but robust design, you can throw structures together in a way that suits your style. While some people love high towers that stretch into the sky, I like to keep things at a lower altitude, giving me more room to bounce between my platforms and the ground. One player I faced lured me into his elaborate fortress of hallways, with doors that led to nothing, all in hopes of forcing me toward his waiting shotgun at the end of the maze.

My first (yes first) GTA game I ever played and beaten all the way through.  A friend gifted me this game and REALLY REALLY wanted me to play it because of its story.  The game really tells a great story about friendship among other things.  The game play is eh...not bad.  A few of the missions (esp the flying ones) are bit rage inducing as they require precison at times, but overall forgiveable (I crashed my  helio and it only took damage were as in the real world it would be kaput).  Check point systems are pretty forgiveable as well.  

There's a lot to see and do in the game.  I didn't do the online part as I just wanted to do the main story.  Story aside, there's a good 50 hours of story telling here overall, that includes the side missions.

Overall a good hoot for your buck if you need some good laughs and bromance.

Dont buy this game.
The matchmaking system is completely busted and has been for as long as 8 years from what ive been able to find. R* in their infinite wisdom, made it so the only way to actually get people to join your missions and heists is to have an "auto invite" button. This is supposed to automatically invite people across different sessions. This system just decides to stop working for some people.. forever. Only inviting those currently in your session. If this happens to you you cannot play any missions or heists because you need 3 other people to join. Assuming you dont have a huge crew and your friends are offline. Your only hope of getting enough people to do a heist or any mission will be from the on-call system (which no one uses)
This started happening to me yesterday and has completely ruined the game for me as im new to pc and dont have many pc friends yet. Youd think a AAA dev would fix an 8 year old bug that completely ruins the experience for many players but i guess thats just to be expected from the geniuses over at R* considering that their only goal is to milk every penny from you and their game that came out almost a decade ago. 
Not to mention the ridiculous amount of cheaters and modders that infest this game. Sometimes they straight up just crash your game, or insta kill the entire lobby. Theres no point to progressing in this game because some loser with a mod menu can just be god and theres nothing you can do about it unless you want to stoop to their level and cheat.
I warned you. Dont buy it. Not even for the story mode. its 10 years old, just watch someone else play it.

Buyer beware ALL RockStar products. They all require an extra layer of Social Club DRM. The first time it launches, it permanently attaches to your Steam account to the last used email without your consent, even if you can't actually successfully log in using the account.

You used to be able to log in with any Social Club account like on the consoles. Not anymore.

Social Club DRM is tied to an email address I can't access. They permanently tied that to my Steam account without my consent, so now I can't play any RockStar games. I cut a ticket to them and they require you to have access to the email on the permanently tied account.

Edit: When I really tried to follow up with support, they sent an email indicating I can't play GTAV or any Rockstar products on this account if I disconnect my Steam account from my Social Club account. I'm not sure if they used poor wording, but I can't support unethical practices like this. Stay away.

Everyone knows what this game is, it's only the most profitable piece of media ever created. The singleplayer is fantastic in every way, Rockstar nailed everything here, gameplay, story, side content, variety, mission design (while still worse than the classic GTA games, it's at least a good upgrade from GTA 4's mission design), the game's core soundtrack is phenomenal and probably my favorite aspect of the game. Grand Theft Auto 5 may as well be the best GTA game.

Then comes Grand Theft Auto Online, which gives me immense pain. Everything that can go wrong with a GTA game, it goes wrong in GTA Online. And to top the downgraded GTA 5 gameplay, shitty mini stories, mediocre side content, awful economy, AWFUL mission design, insane amount of paywalls, Cockstar's Social Club is probably the worst thing ever created, since by playing any game that requires Social Club, your IP address is exposed as Social Club runs on P2P servers (multi billion dollar company by the way).

I only recommend this if you never had the chance to play the story, otherwise if you're getting this for Online, buy something else.

I originally had this game in my Rockstar Games Acount. 
The account was hacked and somehow the game was stolen. I made a ticket, zero help or support from Rockstar. (by the way, to make a "2 step autentication" you need to download some app on your mobile device. Really?) 
Now I saw the game on sale, here on Steam. I tought why not? 
So, hoping that I would get rid of all the launchers and useless things that Rockstar forces you to log in on and play on, I bought the game on Steam. To play it on steam. 
It just doest't happen. You still need tons of launchers and accounts from Rockstar. On top of that, the game doesn't save the settings, I have tryed for 1 hour... 
In the end I requested a refund for this product because, in my opinion, no one should spend money on Rockstar products. No custommer support, not to mention that I had to search on Google to see what I ned to do to open a ticket. 
At the end of the day they couldn't care less if you have any issue. 
As much as I liked GTA, I will never buy any Rockstar product. A cracked copy is the best option here, same thing in terms of support, 0. At least no money is lost.

gta 5 is a blatant cash grab that barely functions. The online version is so horrendous I am suprised that they are making a new game. It is based off of excessive grinding and griefing to make the grind even longer. Along with rockstar's inability or care to stop modding this turns the game into a disaster of modders griefing entire lobbys and making the game unplayable. There needs to be some way that modders can block the report feature along with general bug fixes to the regular online mode. I believe this is possible to fix but since this toxic community forces more people to buy shark cards I doubt that they care enough to fix these issues

I only recommend half of this game. If you're interested in primarily the online, do not get your hopes up. It is extremely grindy and monetized like a free to play game. Most missions are bland and largely not worth doing from both a reward and fun perspective. Lobbies are also plagued with griefers and hackers. Also, [b]USE A VPN[/b]. The online is all peer to peer and there are no ip address protections.

Now onto the good half, story mode. Story mode offers a fun narrative with decent set pieces. The structure of the game does feel dated though. I know the game is called Grand theft Auto but there is so much brain dead driving back and forth, only being made somewhat bearable when dialogue is happening. Almost every mission, you need to drive to, then watch a cutscene, then drive somewhere else to do some shooting (or some other set piece); rinse and repeat. However, when you are not doing an excessive amount of driving, the missions are pretty enjoyable. Side missions though are a mixed bag. Some are good and others you're driving a slow tow truck to cover someone's job. Despite, all my gripes I still had a very good time with this game and I'd like to attribute this to the larger than life characters, heists, and set pieces.

Grant Theft Auto is a great game, a very well designed, very well written, very well balanced game that mark the high point of current gen games in almost every aspect. It pains me to give it 4 stars instead of 5 because one obvious problem which I absolutely can not, and will not overlook no matter how great the game is. And that problem is the misogyny through out the game.

If you want to read about how great the game is, you can read any critic reviews from Polygon, gamespot or any other game sites. And I agree with all them, it's a great game. But I want to talk about women in GTA V, or more precisely, the lack of such.

Character development in GTA V is quite interesting. Every single one of characters you end up playing, meeting, working for, fighting with or against, eventually killing...are total assholes. They're selfish, obnoxious, arrogant, stupid, and completely insane. They rob banks and kill people without the slightest remorse, they use other people and set them up to killed while pretend to be peaceful and spiritual. They're the everyday morons you see exaggerated 100 times. People would argue that because everyone in Los Santos is horrible in their own way, it is acceptable to have annoying and despicable women character as well.

Here's the difference though. The main characters: Michael, Trevor and Franklin, as well as some of major supporting characters such as Leslie, Dave, or Lamar... They're horrible people indeed, but they all have some kind of redeeming quality, especially the 3 main characters. They're very well crafted extremely flawed characters with a lot of depth, people you despise yet can't help to sympathize. They're people you can relate to from a certain level. Not from being a psychopath (I hope), but realizing that they're facing the same problem we face everyday.

But the girls in Los Santos are annoying, shallow, pathetic, with no redeeming quality. They're there to be funny, or to create obstacles for the main character to overcome. Most of them have very thin back stories, aren't all that interesting, and overall, they're just very badly written. It's almost as if the writers are so taken away by the dynamics between the 3 main character (The bro-mance between Trevor and Michael, the father/son relationship between Michael and Franklin), they just don't care about add women into the game.

I have a half joking theory that Rockstar writers are probably closet women hating gay guys. They're willing to write a main character who's gay, yet unwilling to write a good female character. It's not that they can't, Bonnie in Red Dead Redemption is actually well written, so is Katie in GTA IV. They're real women with real personality, and strong in their own way. I was quite hopeful to see some real changes in GTA V, especially after all those outcry for better female characters in games over the past few years. Oh how was I bitterly disappointed. It would be so nice to have a strong (homicidal or not) girl in GTA universe.

Eventually, I think the writers just don't care. Why should they? The game is making insane amount of money even as misogyny as it is. There's no incentive for them to write good female character other than it would be nice to write good female characters as decent writers.

I guess I should talk a little bit about the actual game other than whine about misogyny. Like I said, GTA V is great. But what impressed me the most is how well balanced the game is. The world is huge, but never overwhelming; the missions are diverse and fun but never chaotic; the character switching is fun and exciting but never hectic even in the middle of the heated gun battle. All of the heists are very well designed, and very fun to play out (I wish there're more).

Michael is probably my most favorite characters in all Rockstar games. He's such a complex character and so different from your typical game protagonist. His psychotic and almost romantic attachment with Trevor, his mentor/fatherly attitude towards Franklin, while still remain a hard cold selfish killer.

Regardless how I think about their misogyny, GTA V is a great game. You should play it.

[h1] Game Details [/h1]
[list]
	[*]   [b] Game Name: [/b] Grand Theft Auto V
	[*]   [b] Game Release: [/b] 2013
	[*]   [b] Genre Tags: [/b] Open World, Action, Adventure, Singleplayer, Multiplayer
	[*]   [b] Estimated Playtime: [/b] 100+ Hours
	[*]   [b] Personal Rating: [/b] 6/10
        [*]   [b] 550+ Hours on Xbox One [/b]
[/list]

[h1] Review [/h1]
[b] Summary - [/b] Grand Theft Auto V is a 2013 action-adventure game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games. It is the seventh main entry in the Grand Theft Auto series, following 2008's Grand Theft Auto IV, and the fifteenth installment overall. Set within the fictional state of San Andreas, based on Southern California, the single-player story follows three protagonists - retired bank robber Michael De Santa, street gangster Franklin Clinton, and drug dealer and gunrunner Trevor Philips - and their attempts to commit heists while under pressure from a corrupt government agency and powerful criminals. The open world design lets players freely roam San Andreas' open countryside and the fictional city of Los Santos, based on Los Angeles.

[b] Story - [/b] GTA V has one of the best stories in my opinion. You will come across some of the best voice acting and just amazing characters in this game. With some twists and interesting story pieces to see, I had an absolute blast with it. I don‚Äôt want to say much or anything at all about it. You need to experience the story on your own.

[b] Gameplay - [/b] The gameplay is incredible for GTA V. The driving is fun, the combat is amazing and really smooth. You have so many vehicles and places to see. A ton of weapons and ways to cause chaos. You can find some funny easter eggs and never really experienced any bugs that took me out of the experience. The gameplay is like your typical GTA experience, but with some adding flavor. The single player experience was a masterpiece to me, and hopefully the new GTA game builds up on this and gives you even more freedom when the new one comes out (if they release another one).

[b] Multiplayer - [/b] Okay, so the multiplayer has some problems I have to say. This section really hurts me. I use to play a ton of GTA multiplayer on Xbox one. I probably have like 300+ hours on it alone. Let‚Äôs start with progression. Getting money in this game is ridiculous. You have to grind your life away to even make a good bit of money. Now you have a good bit of money, well have fun buying awesome rides and even getting a cool house. I get it that it wants you to work for these things, but the way they do it is scummy. A lot of stuff in the multiplayer is so expensive, it‚Äôs like they want to pressure you to buy shark cards so you can get what you want. The Shark Card system is a complete joke. I hate games that do this. Now if it's free to play, then fine I will let that pass, but this game is just ridiculous. Please don‚Äôt spend real money for in-game currency. The best way to get money is to do heists, and that can take a while to get, and so repetitive.The lobbies can be toxic too, but this is GTA afterall so that's to be expected. The multiplayer can be a let down to me. I feel like if they just make things cheaper and more accessible, I feel like it would be more enjoyable. Oh and done forget about the hacker problem, just to add the icing on the cake. I know I trashed the multiplayer so far, but if you can somehow excuse all those negative, I found the multiplayer part of GTA to be actually really fun and addicting with friends. You have a ton of content and will always have something to aim for online. It will take you time, but if you got a ton of free time then you may actually love the multiplayer. PVP as well so that's a plus, something Rockstar is really good at in my eyes. The multiplayer is amazing, but it does have one too many flaws for me to get back into.

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
[list]
	[*] Amazing story
	[*] Great dialogue 
	[*] Top notch voice acting
	[*] Every character feels unique
	[*] Multiplayer has a lot of content
	[*] Great graphics at the time
	[*] Really well optimized
	[*] Lots of small details
[/list]

[h1] Cons: [/h1]
[list]
	[*] Multiplayer is super grindy
	[*] Multiplayer can be buggy and kicks you out of server
	[*] Single Player can be kinda boring after beating everything
	[*] Long load times
	[*] Multiplayer heists can be repetitive after a while
	[*] Tons of hackers online
	[*] You can get into toxic servers pretty often
[/list]

alright to start of this review i want to make clear that this game actually is really good WHEN ITS WORKING. 
But as by now everyone knows and making my review pretty pointless. gta online has some MAJOR issues to this day that rockstar should look at and fix if they plan to keep this game running even longer than it already has. 

First of i'll talk about general balancing issues that ruin the game on a serious level. 
in my opinion the most problematic balance problem in this game is the opressor MK2 which just ruins any other vehicle with relative ease.
And the only vehicles like the buffalo STX, terrorbyte and MOC that ARE resilliant to the MK2 don't have the offensive capacity to even fight back so you're still at a major disadvantage. 

Guns in general are a complete waste of spots for anything but NPC missions which means you only really need 1-2 guns a sniper rifle and an assault rifle. 
Fighting players pretty much means you're either supposed to use rocket launchers or any vehicle that, you guessed it has rocket launchers.

To shorter up the review i'm moving straight to bugs since i believe its what ruins the game the most. 
As someone that uses the casino heist as the main source of my income i'm genuinely dissapointed this company hasn't done anything to fix issues that have been in the game for atleast 2 years which include a bug that i just ran in 4 times in a row. 

Entering your arcade will fairly often lead to an infinite loading screen which you can do nothing about. 
And this happens both when you generally just try to enter it OR when you've finished the casino heist and the ending cutscene is supposed to play so it doesn't and now you're stuck on a white screen. 

launcher itself is also downright abysmal a lot of the time to a point where i personally have to close the rockstar app multiple times before i can even launch gta. 
the issue here is that steam says i'm running gta but the application never opens so i'm forced to task manager close the rockstar app and then open it as administrator which only has a 50% chance of fixing the issue.

all this being said i do want to point out positive sides of gta V that rockstar has done well since the game is obviously popular for a reason 
-graphics 
-sound
-music
-car designs
-customization options for most vehicles

these are all incredibly well done and nothing feels cooler than riding out of LS customs with one of the newly released cars and rockstar gets this right with pretty much every content update they release.
I feel like talking about the positive things in gta is a bit redundant since pretty much everyone already knows the game so i won't go into detail about the good things i've mentioned and even if i did my verdict would not change.

yes the positives generally outweight the negatives but the game being this old and consistently updated has no excuse to run this poorly even on high end computers with its numerous bugs that happen way to frequently and its toxic playstyle vehicles that rockstar refuses to do anything about.

I'm pretty mixed on Grand Theft Auto V, I like it as a game, I've bought the game 3+ times already for Christs sake and have been playing since it originally released back in 2013 (God, I can't believe it's been that long already). But there are some very irksome things about this game as a whole, especially in the Online mode (more on that later). 

But anyways, the first problem I have with this game is how boring some of the missions can be, like more than half of them are just you driving from point A to point B and completing some menial task. For example, there is one mission where you are playing as Franklin, and the whole point of the mission is to tow vehicles with a tow truck... how exciting. Of course I don't expect every mission to be jam packed with action, but the amount of missions that are like this is just ridiculous.

Another problem I have with the single player is how under utilised the whole open world is. Compared to GTA IV and even San Andreas, there is not a whole lot going for activities. You have golf, tennis, yoga, triathlons, bike races and that's really it. Sure, there are the strangers and freaks missions, but these quickly get old in my opinion. And once you've completed the story it just feels like a husk. And it's a shame really, because the world can be very fun to explore, but it doesn't feel there is much incentive (besides you just making arbitrary goals) to.

Now, onto the Online mode, and my god, what a cesspit it has become. Ignoring the hackers and the amount of people flying around on their Oppressor MK IIs killing everything insight, the grind is way TOO damn much. The in-game economy is not balanced enough, you get paid so little for activities and things costs millions of dollars. Oh yeah, and in order to even do some of the better paying content you need to first buy certain buildings/vehicles! It has gotten way too out of hand, but Rockstar knows there is nothing stopping them. Sure mod menus exist, but not everyone wants to use them.

This game is game is/has always been a cash cow for Rockstar, and it shows by the lack of development of any other GTA games in past 10 years. Don't get me wrong, this game is awesome and is an incredible feat in game design as a whole, but there are so many things wrong with it that I can't recommend it to anyone new, especially if you are looking to play Online.

If you like open world games based on real life with a long-running story this game is definitely the pick for you. 

There's almost nothing about this game that's not to like. The story is compelling with an interesting set of characters that you'll care for, even though they're a bunch of criminals. I think the story is very fun to play and I also think that the game had a creative mission design, which made the story even more fun to play. 

Next to the very compelling story the game also has a big open world with a lot of things to do which sometimes mirror real life, like going to the amusement park. I think it's a blend of not knowing what you're going to come across and oppurtunities that make the open world really fun to explore. 

Moreover, this game has a very amusing online mode which is very amusing when you're playing with your friends. 

To summarize, I think this game is really phenomenal and I think it's one of the best games ever made. I give this game a 9/10.

This latest chapter in Rockstar's highly popular GTA series takes place in the city Los Santos
based on Los Angeles.
You play as three characters and switch between them at forced events during the story or when you feel like it.
There is Michael whos life looks like he could be a character based a littlebit on Tony Soprano?
A hasbeen gangster now in witness protection with a family life with big house fancy cars and children who are spoiled rich kids + a wife who is bored and doesnt understands him.

he is ready for almost anything to earn a buck and looking to do the next big score.
And ofcause not to forget Trevor
a redneck psychopath who lives outside of Los Santos in a trailer
has a methlab and calls himself a businessman.

A true masterpiece of game design, but on Steam a flawed implementation.

This is yet another title (looking at you, Ubisoft) where purchasing on Steam only buys you a new third-party launcher. One with its own issues that immediately blocked me from accessing my purchase. And another thing that will likely erase my purchase when Rockstar decides to stop supporting its launcher.

This is not what the vision of Steam was supposed to be. A dozen and one third party stores and launchers linked to Steam. What's the point of Steam then? Why not just buy it anywhere since it won't run under Steam anyway, and won't be limited to Steam's policy of respecting the customer?

Just get a cheap copy on console and then there's less money to throw away when one company or another decides to obsolete the product.

If you do still buy this on Steam, know that you'll be informed upon launch that your soul and key belong to Rockstar, it will be linked to your "Rockstar Social Club" account (better not lose that), and Valve/Steam is no longer part of the equation, despite the transaction, platofmr, and independent account and EULA you just had with them.

This was not the original dream when Steam launched. It is not the way.

GTA5 represents all the content that Grand Theft Auto 4 brought 5 years ago and is enhanced in all aspects. Of all the perceived elements, GTA5 achieves a higher level of achievement, and its design itself is ambitious. No game's scene map has reached such a scale and size, and behind its humor and violence is a spicy wisdom. It tells a compelling, unexpected, and thought-provoking storyline without interfering with the player's free adventures in San Andreas. This is one of the best video games of all time.

This game used to a ton of fun on console, but playing on PC in 2022 gives you at least one or two cheaters in every lobby, and multiple people spamming you with website urls on the phone in-game to buy cheats. Constant spamming + cheaters in virtually every lobby. Also, good luck if you are trying to transfer an account to PC, it didn't work for me.

EDIT: I put in another like 50 hours after writing the first review, and I will say that while cheating is a huge issue (make sure you have a vpn, they can see your IP address) the players on here are also way friendlier than I remember and seeing things like lobby-wide car meetups is not a rare occurrence like it used to be. Most people are extremely friendly and the ones that like to grief other people sometimes get their game crashed by cheaters or are kicked out of lobbies by everyone in them. And most lobbies are just a few people, but if you want to vibe in a lobby of 20+ people you can find those as well. The amount of high quality, engaging content that Rockstar has put in since 2017 is crazy high and for 30$ I would absolutely recommend this game despite the cheating that happens just for the content alone, there is so much of it.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

9 years later and the beating heart of the GTA online community is still griefers and modders.
You can switch through 20 sessions of 30 players and each session will have over 15 modders.

- They will freeze your car and force character to stand outside, to be killed or orbited.
- They will force invite the whole session into 1 apartment then kick them out and kill them all outside
- They will make you randomly teleport to the middle of the ocean, car and all.
- They will attack you using godmode and non reloading infinite ammo explosive weapons
- They will place cages on you.
- If you slip into passive before a guy shoots you to death, he will crash your game for your trouble.
- They will spawn 100 passenger jets on your head until you crash
- They can teleport around the map killing players instantly.
- They can disable your passive mode
- They can just appear in your car, take copies of your car and personal plate to spawn when they like.
- They can force you to commit suicide
- They can spam your in game phone with messages fast
- The modders bypass all report and kick functions but can kick or crash you out of a server anytime
- Your friend only session can be invaded by random modders, no security.
- You can only votekick or report 1 player per hour XDDDDDDD how stupid rockstar were XDDDD

I can no longer recommend this game in good faith with the GTA Online portion after being suspended after 300 hours of playing the game and grinding away at the Agency, Auto Shop, and Heists and just enjoying the game with a band of friends. Losing my character with all the progress I made when I have done nothing wrong except literally going to bed one day and waking up to see I've been suspended. Now I outright fear even going onto the game even after the suspension is gone in a month along with my other friends and never being able to play again.

The policy that is in place where one is not allowed to appeal a suspension or a ban is absolutely insane, and I know there are other innocent players that have been getting false flagged by their overly zealous anti-cheat. But due to their policy anyone who plays legit and gets flagged or even sabotaged by a modder cannot do anything about it but accept their fate of losing all their progress the first time and than condemned to just never play again the second time they get flagged. 

One can go onto Youtube, Reddit or even check other Reviews here on Steam on this matter. They've basically shut down the customer service over the phone and if you respond on their support questioning your suspension you just get the same copy pasted message and your requests locked. Even speaking to a live service rep via their website just results in you immediately getting the same thing and them closing out the chat. You won't even get to know why you were suspended/banned as they stated they will not release any information on why action was taken against you.

This game is super fun, however, I got a lot of things to say that make me super mad. Sometimes to the point that i wanna delete the game. 1. Modders, my question is why has this game been out since 2013 and Rockstar still hasn't fixed this issue. This not only ruins your experience, but it is unsafe, as they can easily get your location. 2. Glitches, this is the biggest issue. A few minutes ago i spent 30 minutes doing a mission, and i had to leave the game because it got stuck on a loading screen. Super annoying, now i have to do it again hoping it won't just glitch me out of the game. 3. Infrequent updates. Come on, one of the most popular games ever, gets an small update that doesn't even add that much every year or two. That is all, very fun, but this is very annoying. having to redo things constantly because the game gets stuck on a loading screen? Can't even join a new session, have to forcefully quit the game. I just don't understand how this game has been out since 2013, and still manages to have this many bugs and this many other problems.

The game throws many things at you at once, and there are a lot of modders/hackers who can ruin the game and can view your IP address. they will use god mode and other many things. Lastly, Rockstar Games never responds and never tries to fix anything. IT'S A BILLION-DOLLAR GAME. The game is normal 40-50 dollars and this is very costly for them not to fix any issues is very dumb of them. There are many good parts of this game but the problems of this game are getting bigger and bigger every day. Feel free to comment on my review!

This is one of my favourite games of all time. The story mode is a masterpiece and the online is alright. The story mode is full of fun, interesting missions to complete and I think they did a brilliant job with the characters. The chemistry between the trio makes them impossible to defeat during the heists. The open world is just fantastic and there is basically no limits to what you can do. Every mission helps you discover new areas in the map and shows you gameplay mechanics. 

The online mode is great, but ruined by modders and Rockstar Games being greedy. The freeplay can be brilliant when your messing around with other players and fighting each other, but can be ruined by modders killing everyone in the lobby. The missions are okay, some of them are brilliant, like the Cayo Perico heist or The Contract missions, but most of them are very repetitive. Rockstar Games don't really update the game that much, only every few months, causing the game to get boring after playing for a few days. I don't like the fact that everything is so cheap, and the heists pay so much, for example if you do 5 Cayo Perico heists then you can afford to buy the best vehicle in the game. I think they should make things a bit more expensive or make the heists pay out a bit less in order to fix this.

FINAL REVIEW
Story mode: 10/10
Online: 7/10

Unfortunately I have a love hate relationship with GTA. I wasn't allowed to play GTA growing up, so when GTA V came out I was finally old enough to buy it myself. Sadly I had sold my 360 to purchase my PC and Rockstar didn't release GTA V for PC yet....Finally after two years of waiting, it released on steam. I remember all my friends and I staying up late to download the game when it released so we could play it after school. I was hyped. When school let out we all raced home to play. All my friends started playing immediately; except me. My game would crash during the Police siren intro. Every time. I tried it so many times I logged 7hrs of playtime just from the game crashing every 15 seconds. Luckily Steam still issued me a refund because a lot of people were having the same problem. Years go by and I watch from the sidelines as my friends complete heists together and make memories. In 2018 I finally purchase GTA V again to try it. It worked. But by then the lobbies were a complete shit show. Just chaotic. Heard the single player is pretty good. Sadly I had to watch it on YouTube.

honestly fortnite Battle Royale sets itself apart by trading the traditional, bland military simulation vibe with vivid colors and an outstanding, freeform building system that‚Äôs unlike anything else in competitive multiplayer games.As its name suggests, Fortnite Battle Royale fits so neatly into the battle royale genre that blew up last year that the basic description sounds as standard as you can get: Up to 100 players are dropped onto a large but constantly shrinking map with the goal of gathering weapons and gear to become the last person or team left standing. But if you look just a little closer, it can‚Äôt be mistaken for any other game because the vehicle you‚Äôre skydiving out of is, inexplicably, a flying party bus ‚Äì a nice change of pace from a drab military plane ‚Äì and the place you land is a giant, beautifully colorful island, instead of a realistic landscape, surrounded by a violent storm.
Thankfully, unlike other battle royale games, like PlayerUnknown‚Äôs Battlegrounds, where an unlucky circle could leave getting out of the encroaching circle almost impossible, Fortnite‚Äôs map is at least small enough (relative to PUBG‚Äôs) that even if you have to run across the entire island to get to the safety of the randomly centered eye of the storm you run very little risk of being killed by the collapsing border.
On the island are several large and totally unique cities, each with their own style of structures ‚Äî a quaint suburb of houses, a giant office district filled with skyscrapers, or a retail area with an outdoor mall. Each city is full of vibrant colors, and the map as a whole has hundreds of buildings with randomly spawning loot in the form of guns, explosives, and healing items.
Wait, Which Fortnite Is This? Developed by Epic Games, Fortnite was originally conceived as a third-person, co-op, survival game where teams of players could mine resources and build structures to hold off hordes of undead enemies. That version, now a standalone game called Fortnite Save the World, still exists, but it‚Äôs not great. But as the battle royale genre started to gain popularity early in 2017, Epic adapted its survival game‚Äôs basic systems into something new: Fortnite Battle Royale, a separate, free-to-play game that feels like the perfect home for Save the World‚Äôs wayward mechanics.
Fortnite Battle Royale‚Äôs inventory management is, thankfully, simple by design. You get just five slots, so you‚Äôre forced to balance your arsenal of guns with your need for healing or explosives to deal with enemy structures. It‚Äôs a neat limiting factor that forced me to keep a mental shopping list of exactly what I was on the lookout for as I ran across the island, and to resist the urge to pick up anything else. With such specific needs in mind, every chest came with the thrill of hoping it would reveal the weapons I wanted most. Fortnite gives you plenty of ways to mix and match weapons, so even if that chest doesn‚Äôt come up with the exact item you want, you‚Äôll never feel powerless in a fight.
Once you do find the weapons you‚Äôre looking for, most fights in Fortnite go about the same way: You start with one shot from a slow-firing heavy weapon like a sniper rifle or pump shotgun in hopes of ending the fight before it really started, then (if needed) switch over to a faster assault rifle or tactical shotgun to carry out the rest of the battle. While it‚Äôs far from the only way to play, this combination seems to be the preferred method for almost every player and provides the foundation of almost every fight in Fortnite.
It‚Äôs a chaotic and fun system that makes fights a little more complicated.
It‚Äôs a lightning-fast system where fights can end in the blink of an eye with just one slight miss. This makes for a stark contrast from other battle royale games like PlayerUnknown‚Äôs Battlegrounds, which is filled with long, tense standoffs where sustained accuracy often matters more than a single well placed shot. It‚Äôs a chaotic and fun system that makes fights a little more complicated than simply aiming at your opponent and firing, but after a few hours with Fortnite I started to get the shoot-and-switch rhythm down and fights started to become almost automatic.
It‚Äôs the stuff around the shooting that helps Fortnite differentiate itself from every other battle royale game and shows off what truly makes it special: The building.
Carrying over the building system from Save the World is a brilliant choice that sets Battle Royale apart not just from other battle royale games, but most competitive multiplayer games in general. Just about everything that isn‚Äôt the ground can be mined for wood, stone, or steel, which can be used to create walls, stairs, and floors anywhere on the map (so long as some part of the structure touches the ground). It‚Äôs a massive system with so many possibilities that, at first blush, it can be daunting to try to figure out how to build the massive structures that others around you have created. But that‚Äôs one of the best things about Fortnite: It always keeps things simple.
That‚Äôs one of the best things about Fortnite: It always keeps things simple.
With just three primary tiles ‚Äì floors, walls, and stairs ‚Äì the building toolset may seem limited, but it‚Äôs got everything you really need. Whether it was building a staircase up to that hard-to-reach loot chest or quickly laying down an impromptu piece of cover to protect from an attacking enemy, I found I always had the tools I needed for the job at hand, and I could swap to the piece I needed without missing a beat. In fact, that swapping is so easy that one of my favorite moves is placing one platform and jumping off of it, then switch to another type in mid-air and place it before I land. That trick allows you to scale vertical walls or go straight up a mountain. While this may sound like an impressive feat of dexterity, Fortnite makes it so simple that almost anyone can pull it off ‚Äì and they do, making it one of the most common tricks to getting around the island.
The first time I really understood how Fortnite‚Äôs building and shooting played into one another came in the middle of a fight in Retail Row, one of the map‚Äôs many cities. Another player and I were sheepishly taking shots at one another from behind single walls we had built. After I ran out of ammo in my assault rifle, I was forced to turn to my shotgun ‚Äì a weapon I had largely disregarded up until this point. With the few resources I had left, I built stairs over my opponent‚Äôs wall, jumped off, flipped around, and shotgunned him. Looking back, it was as routine a play as it gets, but it was an absolute revelation for me at the time. Suddenly, everything made sense, and I realized that Fortnite Battle Royale is more about building than it is about shooting.
While the little things you can use it for may seem obvious ‚Äì like building stairs to get to the roof of a building, or making a wall to block an enemy‚Äôs shots ‚Äì the system also gives you room to think outside the box. You could build around a downed teammate that you can‚Äôt help yet, or create a decoy fort to lure enemies into an ambush while you wait behind a tree. The system even provides some elegant solutions to getting caught outside the trademark random circles of the battle royale genre: If you find yourself on the wrong side of a lake or chasm, no problem ‚Äì just make your own bridge to the other side.
One player lured me into his elaborate fortress of hallways in hopes of forcing me toward his waiting shotgun at the end of the maze.
Thanks to the building system‚Äôs simple but robust design, you can throw structures together in a way that suits your style. While some people love high towers that stretch into the sky, I like to keep things at a lower altitude, giving me more room to bounce between my platforms and the ground. One player I faced lured me into his elaborate fortress of hallways, with doors that led to nothing, all in hopes of forcing me toward his waiting shotgun at the end of th

With Grand Theft Auto 5, developer Rockstar North aspires to re-establish GTA as the most important video game franchise in the world, to further raise the bar, the budget, the breadth of experience of the big games.

The impact of 2008's Grand Theft Auto 4 and its predecessors can be seen in practically every AAA release and AAA game studio. The blockbuster game is what it is because of the Grand Theft Auto series' astonishing financial, critical and cultural success.

Grand Theft Auto 5 is the culmination of the series, Rockstar's catalogue and arguably the entirety of AAA video games, which have become bigger and more expensive since the release of Grand Theft Auto 3 over a decade ago. The achievement of Grand Theft Auto 5 is its consistent quality. That's what makes its world feel so believable ‚Äî there's almost nothing that will pull you out of it.

This review is about GTA V Online

I don't even know where to start... While the game has so much potential to provide a good gaming experience it somehow manages to fail at almost every aspect that makes a game enjoyable. 

The COMMUNITY is the WORST i have EVER seen and i've been playing games for over 25 years. There is not a single lobby where there aren't any cheaters/hackers (and yes i purposely call em that). Be it the guy that just uses a mod menu to have fun with the game (those are not healthy for the game but somewhat tolerable) or the guy that teleports across the map to other players, having god mode on and randomly killing anyone they come across just to forcefully exit/crash your game when you give them a hard time doing that. It is ACTUALLY UNPLAYABLE in most public lobbies due to the insane amount of disturbed and sad souls out there. It's just a perfect example of what happens when anyone can have "power".
Even if there is no hacker trying way too hard to make your experience the worst, there are still unbelievably many people griefing/randomly killing anyone they come across. And the best part (sarcasm) about all that is that the game entitles you to do that. If someone tries to deliver products to get a little bit of money which they can spend on 1/5 of a car the whole lobby gets a message about what you are doing and that they should kill you and take those products. 
The game tells you to be a toxic person. And since the game is catering to kids at least as much as to adults (lets not forget that this game is rated M = 17+) Rockstar is creating a prototype of gamers that are out of anyone's control.
It is a widely known fact that Rockstar does not listen to their community at all (if you can even call it a community because it contains the word unity). R* has made over 6 billion dollars from this game yet they leave the game in such an unbelievably bad shape, riddled with bugs, no anti cheat precautions, extremely out of touch additions, vehicles and stories, very bad controls, balancing, AI, obsolete features (damn the list doesnt even stop there) that is has nothing to do with what they got known for. This is a game that feels like it is halfway through developement.
They are milking their players with an insane amount of ignorance. And everyone who buys shark cards (ingame money for actual money) is actively supporting what they do.

How did this happen? Well, money! Money is the answer here. The developers take awards, smile at the cameras, bathe in money, ignore those that made them who they are and they are getting away with everything.

SOME PROS would be that it is a pretty decent looking game for such an old game and the driving has improved quite alot, also you definitely can have a good laugh from playing this game. I wish i could add more to this list but it gets tainted by everything bad about it way too much.

Would i recommend this to anyone? Well...no. MAYBE play the single player game if you can pick it up from a sale but if you think you will get that good ol' GTA vibe but with friends this time... be prepared for a hell of a surprise.

Rockstar has lost hundrets of thousands or even millions of potential buyers that liked to play what R* made them who they are, or at least who they were. If you could sell your soul to the devil, be sure they did not only sell their soul, they happily ripped it out of their bodies, took a piss on it, have it go through all circles of hell and laughed maniacally while getting a molten gold injection in their liveless bodies.


EDIT: Oh and please take a look at those reviews. Anyone with a working brain should realize it's mostly children and trolls writing those "reviews". Like come on..

INDUSTRIAL SOCIETY AND ITS FUTURE
Introduction

1. The Industrial Revolution and its consequences have been a disaster for the human race. They have greatly increased the life-expectancy of those of us who live in ‚Äúadvanced‚Äù countries, but they have destabilized society, have made life unfulfilling, have subjected human beings to indignities, have led to widespread psychological suffering (in the Third World to physical suffering as well) and have inflicted severe damage on the natural world. The continued development of technology will worsen the situation. It will certainly subject human beings to greater indignities and inflict greater damage on the natural world, it will probably lead to greater social disruption and psychological suffering, and it may lead to increased physical suffering even in ‚Äúadvanced‚Äù countries.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he created an "invite only" game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

While I mostly recommend this game, it is an awful trash game. It's super fun to play. Nothing is the least bit realistic, but the driving is stupid fun. The gun play is absolute garbage, but I love it.


Concerning online play:

It is the most inconsistent pile of trash game I've ever played. In one mission vehicle you press right arrow to make a drop, in the next it's E, next time it's F. You cannot change these keys. And where E is drop in one vehicle, it's Landmines in the next, and car horn in the next. Good luck not hitting the wrong button and dropping a mine under yourself and blowing up, losing all those mission supplies you spent an hour collecting.

Buttons change at random, each mission is slightly different. Sprinting in buildings is slightly faster than walking, but only if in first-person camera. Flying vehicles feel like they are swimming through pudding. Flight sticks are not supported. Boats move so fast they constantly fly out of the water, so then they slow down, then hit a wave and fly out of the water again. Repeat ad naseum.

You cannot set a waypoint during a mission if the leader has set a waypoint. Also if the leader sets a waypoint after you did, it deletes your waypoint.

There are NPCs that call and interrupt your game about every 2-10 minutes. You can hang up, but it overrides your primary fire button till you answer. Also, there is a setting to turn off the calls. It does nothing.

You can pay to win, but there's not much point. Money is pretty easy to come by, and you really just need one garage and like two vehicles to have tons of fun. Not sure why anyone buys the real-money cards just to save a little time, but the game has made crazy amounts of money, so maybe I'm missing something.

The UI to buy most things is in just the worst "web apps" in-game. The UI to run each business is completely different between each business, and requires you to use a different laptop inside the business. Also each laptop has a completely different UI? Overall it's kind of like the worst possible UX a game can have...

But it's stupid fun to play (with other friends).

Oh yeah, and hacking is rampant. You constantly run into people who make themselves invulnerable, kill you at the click of a button from across the map, or spawn objects around you to trap you. The players in this game are the worst, since it's all peer-to-peer server model.

You'd think a game that has made literal billions of dollars could fix a few of these issues, but it won't. So just enjoy it for what it is.

Super fun, recommend it, but it's also the worst. I can go on for about 3 more pages with complaints on the inconsistency in this game, if you really want. But also I'll keep playing.

I used to enjoy making content for this game. That was way back when I had people to play on it with. You are probably wondering on what I'm talking about since you can clearly have only 13 hours of playtime on the game, but that's where the truth gets revealed. I've had this game bought (Not on Steam) for quite some time till now, and I simply bought it on Steam to have easier access to my in-game account. I always wanted to create content for games, and GTA V was one of the first places where I could show how creative I am. Unfortunately, over the years the GTA community seemed to keep on rejecting me and my content, all to the point of where I hardly have any motivation for working on making my content. And that's not everything, based on what I've seen online, it seems that this game is pretty much reached the end for its old players, and I can't say that I'm surprised of that, because I'm not, obviously. I still hop on from time to time (Mostly when there is a new update that I can play through), but other than that, I just don't play this game anymore. And for a fact, I think you shouldn't be playing either. So, if you're looking to play a game, play any game, but not this one though. Because if you play GTA V nowadays, you'll simply be wasting your time on a shot game.

About Grand Theft Auto 5:


Originally launched in 2013, Rockstar Games' decidedly adult-oriented GRAND THEFT AUTO V has been remastered for newer consoles, including PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S. The story mode puts players in the shoes of a trio of criminals in Los Santos, a fictionalized version of Los Angeles. One protagonist is middle-aged and begins the game as a recently retired criminal; another is unpredictable, cruel, and dependent on drugs; and the third is a young man just beginning his life of crime. Players have the ability to switch freely among these men as they work through a dramatic criminal saga set in an open world that sees them carrying out heists, stealing cars, taking revenge on rivals, and killing anyone who gets in their way, including police officers and innocent civilians. The popular multiplayer mode GTA Online, meanwhile, allows players to create a unique avatar before setting out on a freeform criminal career with activities ranging from bank robberies and car theft to assassinations and shooting down airplanes, in addition to more traditional adversarial multiplayer modes such as deathmatch and capture the flag. The 2022 remastered edition sports enhanced graphics -- including support for HDR, ray tracing, 4K resolution, and 60 frames-per-second refresh speeds -- as well as a Career Builder mode for GTA Online that lets first-time players begin with millions of dollars to help them buy properties and gear so that they can catch up to longtime GTA players who have the ability to transfer over their characters from older platforms.

My Personal Recommendation:

This isn't a game for kids. Beyond its glamorized depiction of crime, greed, and violence, Grand Theft Auto V is filled with mature satire both obvious and nuanced -- some of which hasn't aged very well -- that younger audiences are bound to take at face value. That said, it's also an expertly designed game that remains surprisingly playable and engaging. It gives players a vibrant and authentic world bursting with activities and things to discover, tight controls that seamlessly transition between various actions, and a cleverly designed story that puts the player in the shoes of three separate characters, pushing each narrative forward at its own pace. Newly added features in remastered versions of the game -- ranging from vastly improved loading times and enhanced audio to subtle new haptic feedback and contextual trigger sensitivity when using the PlayStation 5 controller -- have helped this game remain relevant and widely played much longer than most.
GTA Online is bound to be where most folks spend the bulk of their time, though. Newer editions allow players to skip the opening part of the story mode altogether -- which was required in earlier editions in order to teach people how to play -- and jump straight into Rockstar's multiplayer universe, where almost nothing's scripted and pretty much anything goes. What's more, the new Career Builder gives players $4 million up front and lets them set themselves up as a gun runner, the operator of a shady nightclub, a corrupt CEO, or a bike gang leader. GTA Online provides endless opportunity for players to indulge dark criminal fantasies while testing their mettle against other players. Just keep in mind, though, that just about everything here -- online and off -- is geared for adult audiences. And even then it won't be to all tastes. Grand Theft Auto V is well made and entertaining, but unequivocally inappropriate for kids.
