y'kno what, that game is from 2013. Since then it was remastered, re-issued, re-made a couple times. Down to important stuff:

Story from 2013 is a time-accurate satire, in the best tradition of Rockstar Games. Game mechanics have been made more comfortable for a rather easy-going gamer than it was back in 2008 with GTA IV but whatever, still a nice game to play and a hilarious set of figures to laugh at.

Online from 201X-2022 and going is a meta-joke of Rockstar Games. They have placed themselves into GTA universe and are now laughing about their own values and corporate strategy. Tired of a game that is older than your kid? Try GTA Online, it's got players that are younger than that and will whack that bit of fun you were having with some flying bike you were unable to counter financially. Because like in the real life, you can enjoy it more if you have more of some fictional units of value at your expense. Go get yourself a flying bike, a flying car, a VTOL jet, a hangar, an office, a VTOL fortress, a truck full of tech to store the flying bike, a nightclub to store the aforementioned truck, a bunch of businesses to actually finance the nightclub, yadda yadda. Have fun. Because it's the only return you're gonna enjoy from GTAO. Payouts for online activities are miserable so you are stuck repeating the same old grind you've been doing for a year in order to achieve anything enjoyable in an online game that hat enjoyment and fun as it's primary goal.

The soundtrack is a masterpiece. Brings me memories of the last decade. Makes me feel young again. As anything else that makes me feel young, I only paid for it once and never again.

Absolutely recommend.

Im going to give an honest review from both sides of GTA V being that Ive played on PC and Console. 

For story mode, its a classic that will never get old. And if you do get bored of the base game, you can get some mods like Chaos mod or Rainbomizer and make it really interesting and a lot harder. I have learned a lot of cool glitches to use in the base game. For the base game i would give it a solid 9/10.

Time to talk about the elephant in the room. GTA Online. Ive put hundreds of hours on console and experienced a really fun time with the LFG feature on Xbox. On console there is so much more stuff you can do and you can make friends SO much easier than on PC. But this review is for PC! Now i hate to say it but PC GTA Online sucks. It genuinely does. Ive now put about 140 hours into online alone and starting the grind is the worst part. If for some reason in 2022 you dont have the criminal enterprise pack, youre in for a hell of a ride. The only thing i would reccomend is getting some friends (i know its hard but trust me), i would say about 3 or 4 would do the trick, and grind together until you get enough to buy the Kosatka for $2.2M. 
Thats just the tip of the ice berg though. Please do remember that there are ways to bring cheats into online. Modders and Godmode players run rampant and the "servers" are p2p. Yikes. A modder can crash your game if they truely feel like they want to get rid of you and never come back. 
The game has a lot going for it, but rockstar is never going to truely make the game good again unless they fix the problems with the game. Yes, you can have the best experience, but the bleak truth is that Rockstar has given up on this game.
Overall: 7/10
Story: 9/10
Online 4/10

The single player is really good, but lets be honest, you're not here for the single player. If you're going to play online, then don't waste your time with public lobbies. Find a few buddies and start an invite only lobby for you to enjoy. The public lobbies are filled with griefers on oppressers and hackers who spam you with scam messages. If you're coming over from a console, then don't bother. Restarting from scratch is much harder than you remember the grid being in the first place. I really wouldn't mind the fact that you couldn't transfer your character if Rockstar's reason wasn't so blatantly false. They say its to stop all the hacked accounts from transferring over from console, but they don't care at all about the hackers in this version of the game. I used to believe that Rockstar was one of the good developers that cared about the consumer experience, but seeing the way the treat Read Dead 2 online and the state of the public servers in this game has changed my mind. Rockstar is one buggy mess of a launch away from being CD Project Red. I hope that doesn't happen...

Honestly, I wasn't a huge fan of GTA V when I first picked up the game 2 years ago for the PS4. The story was mid and GTA Online was genuinely more boring than Fallout: 76. That was until I picked up the game on sale a few days ago for my PC. Good. God. This game is incredible. GTA V is still very okay, but GTA Online is genuinely one of the games I've had the most fun in in years. I'm genuinely impressed with the game. I love doing heists and playing with my friends doing missions and causing chaos in the streets. Definitely a solid 8/10 for this game, only because the real star here is GTA Online, not V itself.

The online mode is full of griefers and hackers, you'll get blown up every five minutes unless you have a high level friend to carry you, but at that point the missions will either be trivial and boring for them or near impossible without being carried for you. The story is absolute shit with characters who are entirely unlikeable. Before you say "Oh, that's the point, there'yre supposed to be bad guys" I just have to ask why you'd be playing an asshole in a video game, normal people don't want to be assholes. The offline mode also has lots of side content, like drinking, watching TV, getting high, going to a strip club, or riding a faris wheel, but these are all horribly mundane things that you're better off just doing for real using the money you would have spent on this game.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Played this game since day one on PS3. Back then it was an amazing game, really, and if you're into single player game you really should get it on any platform you can.

But now the multiplayer has become something terrible, it's just a game of farming the same thing in loop, or a game of spending thousands into the game to get the new contents. Because there is none to the single player, everything is on the multiplayer. And because everything is just so much expensive there, sharkcards just seems worthless at some point.

And the content added isn't what I think would be great for the game, but of course that's up to everyone's perspective, but the fact it's way too expensive to be enjoyable is terrible.

I understand that for the game to keep working, they need to make money, but it seems that even if you decide to spend money to be able to have fun in the game, that money will be spent in a snap of fingers. I swear this game is Thanos when it comes to mons.

Please purchase the game if you're into single player because the story is great, but please note it's got no new content for single player, and that multiplayer is barely enjoyable without farming money or playing in private session. (Unless you're into PvP everywhere, with people that have way better weapon than you such as orbital strike, and that if you engage in fight, you'll lose ammo, armor that you spent money on, money that you farmed, etc.)

NOW! There is a solution for multiplayer that is FiveM, it has tons of game mods and some servers doesn't have problems with mons. So that would be your only way to get away with it.

As much as this game should probably get negative feedback now as time goes on and not much content or any fun content in exact is added.. and no new game to continue this series, it still was one of the greatest games ever made, its just dead now so ima wait for the next one to hopefully impress me more than this one did back in 2013..

The Hog Rider card is unlocked from the Spell Valley (Arena 5). He is a very fast building-targeting, melee troop with moderately high hitpoints and damage. He appears just like his Clash of Clans counterpart; a man with brown eyebrows, a beard, a mohawk, and a golden body piercing in his left ear who is riding a hog. A Hog Rider card costs 4 Elixir to deploy.

Strategy

His fast move speed can boost forward mini tanks like an Ice Golem in a push. At the same time, he can also function as a tank for lower hitpoint troops such as Goblins as he still has a fair amount of health. Most cheap swarms complement the Hog Rider well, as they are nearly as fast as him and usually force more than one card out of the opponent's hand.

The Hog Rider struggles with swarms, as they can damage him down and defeat him quickly while obstructing his path. Barbarians in particular can fully counter him without very strict timing on the defender's part, though be wary of spells.

A Hunter can kill the Hog Rider in 2 hits if placed right on top of it. However, if you place something in front of the Hog Rider, the Hunter's splash will damage the Hog Rider and hit the card in front of it more.

The Hog Rider in conjunction with the Freeze can surprise the opponent and allow the Hog Rider to deal much more damage than anticipated, especially if the opponent's go-to counter is a swarm, or swarms are their only effective counter to him. Skeletons and Bats will immediately be defeated by the spell, while Spear Goblins, Goblins, and Minions will be at low enough health to be defeated by a follow up Zap or Giant Snowball.

However, this strategy isn't very effective against buildings as the Hog Rider will take a while to destroy the building, giving the opponent ample time to articulate another counter.

Against non-swarm troops, it can deal a lot of damage during the freeze time, but this can allow the opponent to set up a massive counterpush. For this reason, players should either only go for a Hog Rider + Freeze when they have other units backing it up from a counterattack, or if the match is about to end and they need to deal as much damage as possible.

It is not a good idea to send in a Hog Rider simply to destroy a building, especially if it is the only building targeting unit available, as defeating Crown Towers becomes substantially more difficult. Spells or simply waiting out the lifetime of the building are more effective. The exception to this is an Elixir Collector placed in front of the King's Tower. If a Hog Rider placed at the bridge, he can destroy the Collector for a positive Elixir trade, though the damage from both Princess Towers will usually mean he does not survive to deal any damage to them. However, if the opponent sends in defending troops, it can be an opportunity to gain spell damage value.

In a deck with several low-cost cards, it might be worth it to simply send the Hog Rider against one building. These decks shuffle their card rotation quick enough, that they will arrive to their next Hog Rider before the next building arrives in the opponent's card rotation.

Long-ranged troops like Musketeer and Flying Machine can snipe those buildings, preserving some of the Hog Rider's health, possibly allowing it to get some Tower damage.

When there are buildings placed in the middle to counter the Hog Rider, understanding the placement of the Hog Rider and the type of building placed can help the Hog Rider to bypass certain buildings.

Passive buildings such as spawners and Elixir Collector have a larger hitbox than defensive buildings; which means that if a passive building was placed 3 tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, then it is impossible for the Hog Rider to bypass that placement as the Hog Rider will get pulled to that building.

Defensive buildings have a smaller hitbox than a passive building, which means if that if a defensive building was placed three tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, a Hog Rider placed at the very left or right side of the Arena may be able to bypass it due to its smaller hitbox.

If the player has a building already placed down in the center of the arena, and the opponent tries to bypass it with a Hog Rider at the edge of the arena, they can use certain air troops to push the Hog Rider towards the building as it jumps over the river, effectively denying the bypass attempt. They must be already hovering over the correct placement, as very quick reflexes are required to correctly perform this technique.

For Bats, Skeleton Dragons, and Minion Horde, they should be placed right in front of the Hog Rider as soon as it is deployed.

For Minions, Skeleton Barrel, Mega Minion, Flying Machine, Electro Dragon, Baby Dragon, Inferno Dragon, Balloon, and Lava Hound, stagger the above placement one tile to the right if the Hog Rider is placed on the left side of the arena, and vice versa.

They can also use ground troops to achieve the same result. Something like an Ice Golem deployed at the Hog Rider‚Äôs landing spot will obstruct his path and force him to go around the unit, which causes him to be closer to the building instead of the Crown Tower.

The Hog Rider can kite Very Fast non-building targeting troops due to his own Very Fast speed and building only targeting if he is placed on the fourth tile from the bridge, slightly into the opposite lane. He can also stall grounded units when placed right at the bridge. He will pull them towards him while deploying, and then be untargetable by them when he jumps over the bridge. After landing, he will pull them back. This can be useful when the player needs to deal damage in the same lane they are defending. It will also help separate troops behind a tank in a large push.

A Tornado placed on the second tile front of the player's King's Tower and staggered two tiles towards the Princess Tower will activate it without any damage dealt to the Princess Tower, helping them in defending future pushes. This can also be a method of mitigating all damage dealt to a Princess Tower, but doing this more than three times may result in the King's Tower's health being low enough to be targeted directly, opening up the possible threat of a back door three crown. A better alternative is to pull the Hog away from the Princess Tower into the attacking range of all three Crown Towers, which will negate all damage as long as none of them are already distracted

A very powerful combo is the Hog Rider, the Musketeer, and the Valkyrie, typically referred to as the Trifecta. The Musketeer will defend against most troops, while the Valkyrie can protect her and the Hog Rider from swarms or high damage units. The Hog Rider is used to deal damage to the tower.

This can be effectively countered by Lightning, one-shotting the Musketeer and severely damaging both the Valkyrie and Hog Rider. The Minion Horde is also effective, but the enemy can Zap them and the Musketeer will one-shot them all. Even if the Musketeer is defeated, the Hog Rider and Valkyrie will have enough time to severely damage the Tower.

The Hog Rider should be placed behind the Valkyrie to give it a boost so that it stays in front of the Hog Rider, protecting it.

A Hog Rider combined with a Goblin Barrel can be awkward for the opponent to defend against. Timing it so that the Hog Rider is tanking the tower shots for the Goblins is the most effective way to deal damage. However, a Barbarian Barrel can shut this down with minimal Tower damage for a positive Elixir trade, as long as the Goblin Barrel was placed directly on the Tower.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

This game is a joke. Rockstar does absolutely nothing to stop modders in this game and fix basic bugs that have plagued the game for years. They seem to only fix money glitches, no surprise there. Heist and missions regularly glitch and break, and sometimes it seems intentional. Probably to get you to buy shark cards. The funny thing is, if you want people to spend money on your game, they need to be happy.  Getting constantly blown up by a modder and getting crashed is not something that will make happy customers. There are so many illegitimate ways to get money such as websites selling accounts to modders taking you on glitched heists it's legitimately funny how dumb Rockstar is to think people will buy their overpriced shark cards. As for modders, they actually have more control over the game than Rockstar does. They can see your ip address, glitch you out, destroy your cargo etc and you can't do anything about it. This game has literally no anticheat. I'd like to congratulate Rockstar on creating an online experience that's best enjoyed in a glitched solo private lobby. No wonder so many people play FiveM. At least they give a crap about their players and creating a genuinely fun experience. Just today I spent an hour rebooting my game to do a heist because modders kept crashing my game. Once I could get in a good lobby the heist broke twice and required more rebooting. GG's Rockstar.

GTA 5 may not have the best community and if you're playing online you should most likely go in a solo session but GTA 5 is one of the most fun video games out there whether you're playing through the main campaign or playing GTA online it takes a while to get burnt out of. In GTA online building up an MC or organization from nothing and getting huge amounts of income from it is one of the most satisfying things you can do period. While in the campaign the story is intriguing and not just filler that makes things make sense,  i won't go into detail as not to spoil it but it is interesting. And the actual gameplay is amazing. And finally the car chases. You can't name a game after stealing cars and not include car chases so of course GTA delivers. The car chases can be at breakneck speeds or a snail's pace and they are always jampacked with explosions, head-on collisons , and car pile ups. With the added feature of shooting from the window you can also sacrifice most likely not crashing for the ability to shoot the driver out of the car ramming you off the road or chuck a grenade at it. The tires can also be shot out and make the car chasing you lose stability but they can also do the same to you. In general the car chases are fun and action packed. So most people that don't think violent video games are bad, GTA 5 is an amazing game most people will enjoy.

I was gonna write a long paragraph about stupid characters, story, driving and so on, but I already wasted enough of my time on this game. My feelings in a nutshell:
I spent like [b]200$[/b] on a guitar and accessories, having zero knowledge about the instrument.
I also spent [b]15$[/b] on this game, having some clues what I'm about to experience.
[u]Believe it or not I regret paying those 15$.[/u]

I'm only recommending this, BECAUSE, the Single Player story is dynamic, even if it had a rocky start because of the introduction of Trevor's character when he's in the state of San Andreas. Let's be clear: Johnny Klebitz deserved better and was probably best suited to be written off properly than just being offed by Trevor just like that.

As for GTA Online? Well... Simple. DO NOT PLAY IT if you don't want to be griefed, modded on, and get yourself banned from at any session at any way possible. It will make your life hellish, and it's best you avoid it altogether. Rockstar and TakeTwo NEVER fixed the GTA Online modder epidemic and it sucks BAD for immersion-looking players. Not a good multiplayer product. It's best you check out other means of playing multiplayer games like Roleplay servers or Activity servers like those in FiveM. If you want to enjoy this game, give both this game credit, but also give this game credit for its dynamic content being used in other servers rather than GTA Online. The vanilla online content wouldn't change much, but you WILL lose patience with the hackers and illegal modders.

Other than anything "GTA Online", this is a big recommended game. This contains the continuation of GTA IV's story. Hopefully, the next installment will be twice as better as this one.

The online part of this game is unplayable garbage. You will spend half of your time waiting on loading screens trying to decide if they bugged out or just slow right now. Cheaters run as rampant as I have ever seen in any video game ever. This is pretty much a containment game for the scum of the internet and you should not afflict yourself with it if you can help it.

* Also, the game itself is an achievement, a marvel, and a triumph of gaming.

It‚Äôs map and the detail put into this game is outstanding. You get a very big map with fully accessible shops (a couple on each block). There‚Äôs so much you can do and explore. The storyline is good, but I prefer GTA: Online. You do mission with other people and can have fun with your friends. 

GTA Online on the other hand is better, in my opinion. You can do missions with other people or your friends, race with them, troll with them, really do anything with them. All while you can build an empire. The detail and the graphics are excellent, but even civilians talk and there‚Äôs a lot to interact with. Although you have been warned, the hackers are a tiny TINY problem.

The game itself is great. The story is wonderful. The problem comes from online. It is impossible to play the game and avoid modders. You have the option to play in a private session but you can't cause they will use a mod menu, break into your private session, kill you, and crash your game. Rockstar doesn't care either. They say they take modding and hackers seriously but it's clear they don't or the problem wouldn't be so rampant. Every night it's the same shit. Rockstar could easily fix their security problems if they just spent the money everyone knows they have to do so. Don't play this game unless you have a very high bullshit tolerance or just stick to playing the first week after a new major update or ban wave. It's the only way to enjoy it.

[h1]GTA5[/h1] GTA5 has been one of my top games in the past 10 years, and if i'm still playing it today, then damn its a pretty good game! Sure it has its ups and downs but this is GTA5. You gotta understand that this is a savage game all about money to get vehicles and upgrade them so you can do more missions to get more money, to get more/better vehicles. But GTA5 has been pretty consistent at adding content. Personally I enjoy the multi player coop experience or even just free roam. There are so many things to do in this game today I cant even list them out.
